[Her]101-birdalone voice seemed so cheery and friendly to [the priest]1984-the priest , that [he]1984-the priest shook off somewhat the moodiness of [his]1984-the priest desire , and looked up and said : [I]0-i shall tell [thee]101-birdalone , [lady]504-lady , that [I]0-i suppose [thou]2030-thou hast more errand with [[my]0-i lords]2037-my lords than to crave lodging of [them]2037-my lords despite the custom of [the castle]1838-the castle . Nay , [I]0-i have an inkling of what thine errand may be , whereof more anon ; but now shall [I]0-i tell [thee]101-birdalone what is best for [thee]101-birdalone to do so as to have speech of [them]2037-my lords the soonest . [They]2037-my lords have gone forth with [some of [[our]2040-our lads]2041-our lads]2039-some of our lads to gather venison , or it may be beeves and muttons for [our]2040-our victualling , and somewhat of battle may [they]2037-my lords have had on the way , for [ill neighbours]2042-ill neighbours have [we]2040-our . But if [they]2037-my lords come back unfoughten [they]2037-my lords will be wending [this road]2043-this road , and must needs pass by [thy]101-birdalone copse - side ; and if [thou]101-birdalone be sleeping the noise of [them]2037-my lords will full surely awaken [thee]101-birdalone . Then all [thou]101-birdalone hast to do is to come forth and stand in the way before [them]2037-my lords , that [they]2037-my lords may see [thee]101-birdalone ; and when once [they]2037-my lords have seen [thee]101-birdalone , how may [they]2037-my lords pass [thee]101-birdalone by unspoken with ?

[I]0-i thank [thee]101-birdalone heartily for [thy]101-birdalone rede , said [Birdalone]101-birdalone ; but [I]0-i would ask [thee]101-birdalone two things : first , what is the name of [the castle behind [us]2045-us]2044-the castle behind us ? and second , why have [ye]101-birdalone the custom of shutting the door upon [women]433-women ? Said [the priest]1984-the priest : [The castle]1838-the castle is called in [this country - side]2049-this country - side , [the White Ward by [the Water]7-the water]2050-the white ward by the water ; but within there [we]2045-us call it [the Castle of [the Quest]31-the quest]1931-the castle of the quest ; and thus is it called because [[my]0-i lords]2037-my lords are seeking [their]2037-my lords loves whom [they]2037-my lords have lost ; and [they]2037-my lords have sworn an oath that [no woman]757-no woman shall enter therein till [their]2037-my lords own loves have trodden [its]1838-the castle floors .

Rose the heart of [Birdalone]101-birdalone at that word , and [she]101-birdalone deemed indeed that [she]101-birdalone was come thither whereas [[her]101-birdalone she - friends]2054-her she - friends would have had [her]101-birdalone . [The priest]1984-the priest beheld [her]101-birdalone and saw how [her]101-birdalone beauty was eked by that gladness , and [he]1984-the priest scarce knew how to contain [himself]1984-the priest ; and might speak no word awhile ; then [he]1984-the priest said : Hearken further concerning [thy]101-birdalone matter ; if [[my]0-i lords]2037-my lords be tarried , and come not by matin - song , then [I]0-i doubt not but [the castellan]2000-the castellan will send [folk]1529-folk to see to [thee]101-birdalone . [He]1984-the priest looked down therewith and said : [I]0-i will come to [thee]101-birdalone [myself]0-i ; and will bring [thee]101-birdalone [men - at - arms]2059-men - at - arms , if need be . But sometime to - morrow morning [[my]0-i lords]2037-my lords will come , save mischief hath betid , which [God]120-god forbid . And [he]1984-the priest crossed [himself]1984-the priest ; then [he]1984-the priest looked up and full in [her]101-birdalone face , and said : But keep [thine]101-birdalone heart up ; for whatsoever may betide , [thou]101-birdalone shalt not be left uncared for .

Said [Birdalone]101-birdalone : [I]0-i see of [thee]101-birdalone that [thou]101-birdalone art become [[my]0-i good friend]2061-my good friend , and it rejoiceth [my]0-i heart ; [I]0-i shall be well at ease to - night in [thy]101-birdalone cot , and to - morrow morn [I]0-i shall be valiant to do [thy]101-birdalone bidding .

The sweetness of [her]101-birdalone speech so overcame [him]1984-the priest , that [he]1984-the priest but looked confusedly on [her]101-birdalone , as if [he]1984-the priest scarce heard [her]101-birdalone ; and [they]2062-they went on together without more words , till [he]1984-the priest said : Here are [we]2062-they at the cot , and [I]0-i will show [thee]101-birdalone [[thy]101-birdalone chamber]312-thy chamber . So [he]1984-the priest led [her]101-birdalone to [a little thatched bower]2064-a little thatched bower , built with walls of wattle - work daubed with clay , which stood without the remnant of the cot : [it]2064-a little thatched bower was clean and dry , for the roof was weather - tight ; but there was nought in [it]2064-a little thatched bower at all save a heap of bracken in a corner .

There stood [the priest]1984-the priest , still holding [Birdalone]101-birdalone 's hand , and spake not , but looked about , yet always covertly on [Birdalone]101-birdalone ; but in a while [he]1984-the priest let go [her]101-birdalone hand , and seemed to wake up , and said : This it is ; [a sorry place]2066-a sorry place enough , were it even for [a gangrel body]2067-a gangrel body . Even so am [I]0-i , quoth [she]101-birdalone laughing ; and [thou]101-birdalone mayest look to it , that herein [I]0-i shall rest full happily . Then [he]1984-the priest gave [her]101-birdalone a horn , drawing it from out of the basket of victual , which [he]1984-the priest now set down on the ground ; and [he]1984-the priest said : If [thou]101-birdalone shouldst deem [thee]101-birdalone hard bestead , then wind this horn , and [we]2068-we shall know its voice up there and come to help [thee]101-birdalone . Now [I]0-i give [thee]101-birdalone good - night .

[She]101-birdalone thanked [him]1984-the priest sweetly , and [he]1984-the priest went slowly out of the bower , but was scarce gone ere [he]1984-the priest came back again , and said : One thing [I]0-i may perchance tell [thee]101-birdalone without drawing thine anger on [my]0-i head ; to wit , that [I]0-i it was who said to [the castellan]2000-the castellan that [he]2000-the castellan should take [thee]101-birdalone in . Wilt [thou]101-birdalone say aught to this ? [She]101-birdalone said : [I]0-i will thank [thee]1984-the priest again and again ; for it was the saving of [my]0-i life and [mine]0-i errand . And clearer is it now than ever that [thou]101-birdalone art [a good friend unto [me]0-i]2070-a good friend unto me .

As [she]101-birdalone looked on [him]1984-the priest and caressed [him]1984-the priest with kind eyes , [she]101-birdalone saw that [his]1984-the priest brow was knit , and [his]1984-the priest face troubled , and [she]101-birdalone said to [him]1984-the priest : What ails [thee]1984-the priest ? art [thou]101-birdalone wroth with [me]0-i in any wise ? O no , said [he]1984-the priest ; how should [I]0-i be wroth with [thee]101-birdalone ! But there is a thing [I]0-i would ask of [thee]101-birdalone . Yea , and what ? said [she]101-birdalone . [He]1984-the priest said : Nay , [I]0-i may not , [I]0-i may not . It shall be for to - morrow , or another day . [He]1984-the priest spake it looking down , and in a broken voice ; and [she]101-birdalone wondered somewhat at [him]1984-the priest , but not much , deeming that [he]1984-the priest was troubled by something which had nought to do with [her]101-birdalone , and which [he]1984-the priest might refrain from thinking of , even before [a stranger]1248-a stranger .

But presently [he]1984-the priest caught [her]101-birdalone hand and kissed it , and bade [her]101-birdalone good- night again , and then went hastily out of the bower ; and when [he]1984-the priest was well without , [he]1984-the priest muttered , but not so as [she]101-birdalone might hear [him]1984-the priest : Durst [I]0-i have asked [her]101-birdalone , [she]101-birdalone would have suffered [me]0-i to kiss [her]101-birdalone cheek . Alas ! fool that [I]0-i was ! [Birdalone]101-birdalone turned then to [her]101-birdalone bracken bed , and found [it]2072-it sweet and clean ; and [she]101-birdalone was at rest and peace in [her]101-birdalone mind , albeit [her]101-birdalone body was exceeding weary . [She]101-birdalone felt happy in [the little lonely cot]2073-the little lonely cot , and [her]101-birdalone heart had gone out to [the sweet meadow - land]2074-the sweet meadow - land , and [she]101-birdalone loved it after all the trouble of [the water]361-the water ; and herseemed that even now , in the dusk a - growing into dark , it loved and caressed [her]101-birdalone . So [she]101-birdalone laid [her]101-birdalone down , nor unclad [herself]101-birdalone at all , lest [she]101-birdalone should have to arise on a sudden , and show those tokens of [the three damsels on [her]101-birdalone body]2076-the three damsels on her body .

A little while [she]101-birdalone lay there happily , hearkening the voices of the nightingales in the brake , and then [she]101-birdalone fell into a dreamless sleep , unbroken till the short night passed into day .

CHAPTER III . HOW [BIRDALONE]101-birdalone DIGHT [HER]101-birdalone FOR MEETING THE CHAMPIONS OF THE QUEST

It was the birds beginning [their]2077-their first song once more that awakened [Birdalone]101-birdalone before the sun was up ; but [she]101-birdalone had no will to stir a while , whereas [she]101-birdalone felt so happy and restful ; and that all the more when [she]101-birdalone remembered where [she]101-birdalone was , and told [herself]101-birdalone that [her]101-birdalone errand was now like to be accomplished ; and [she]101-birdalone thought of [[her]101-birdalone friends whom [she]101-birdalone had left on [the Isle of Increase Unsought]22-the isle of increase unsought]2078-her friends whom she had left on the isle of increase unsought , and blessed [them]2078-her friends whom she had left on the isle of increase unsought for [their]2078-her friends whom she had left on the isle of increase unsought kindness , and the love of [them]2078-her friends whom she had left on the isle of increase unsought was sweet to [her]101-birdalone heart , and amidst such thoughts [she]101-birdalone fell asleep again .

When [she]101-birdalone awoke thereafter there was a flood of sunshine lying on [the meadows]2079-the meadows , and [she]101-birdalone sprang up in haste lest [she]101-birdalone had overslept [herself]101-birdalone , but when [she]101-birdalone was come out of the bower , [she]101-birdalone soon saw that the sunbeams lay low on [the land]213-the land , and that it was yet the first hour of the sun ; so [she]101-birdalone turned about , and went through the copse to the other side , and lo ! [a little clear stream running before [her]101-birdalone]2081-a little clear stream running before her . So [she]101-birdalone spake to [herself]101-birdalone softly and said : Fie on it ! [I]0-i was weary with [the boat]859-the boat and [my]0-i hunger last night , and [I]0-i went to bed unwashen ; and this morn [I]0-i am weary for the foulness of [my]0-i unwashen body . Unseemly it were to [me]0-i to show [myself]0-i sluttish before [these lords]2083-these lords ; let [me]0-i find time for a bath at least .

Therewith [she]101-birdalone went swiftly down to [the water]361-the water , undoing [her]101-birdalone girdle and laces by the way . [She]101-birdalone came to [the stream]2085-the stream and found it running between blue - flowering mouse - ear and rushes , into a pool which deepened from [a sandy shallow]2086-a sandy shallow : so anon [her]101-birdalone borrowed raiment was lying on [the grassy lip of [the water]361-the water]2087-the grassy lip of the water , and [she]101-birdalone was swimming and disporting [her]101-birdalone in the pool , with [her]101-birdalone hair loose and wavering over [her]101-birdalone white back like some tress of the water - weed . Therein [she]101-birdalone durst not tarry long , but came hurrying out on to the grass , and clad [herself]101-birdalone in haste . But [she]101-birdalone covered not [her]101-birdalone shoulders with the golden gown , nor laced it over [her]101-birdalone bosom , so that [Viridis]116-viridis ' smock might be the plainer to see : which smock was noteworthy , for the breast thereof was broidered with green boughs , whence brake forth little flames of fire , and all so dainty - wrought as if [the faery]7087-the faery had done it .[101-birdalone]

Withal [she]101-birdalone gathered up the gown into [her]101-birdalone girdle , and let the skirt- hem clear [her]101-birdalone ankles , so that [Atra]117-atra 's shoon might be seen at once ; and they were daintily dight with window - work and broidery of gold and green stones , and blue . And forsooth it was little likely that [any man]2089-any man should stand before [her]101-birdalone a minute ere [his]2089-any man eyes would seek to [her]101-birdalone feet and ankles , so clean and kindly as they were fashioned .

Therewith [she]101-birdalone set [her]101-birdalone hands to [her]101-birdalone head , and trussed up [her]101-birdalone hair , and bound it closely to [her]101-birdalone head , so that it might hide no whit of [her]101-birdalone borrowed attire .

There [she]101-birdalone stood , with [Aurea]116-viridis 's collar lying on [her]101-birdalone dear neck , and [Viridis]116-viridis ' girdle about [her]101-birdalone shapen loins , and [Atra]117-atra 's ring on [her]101-birdalone lovesome finger . And [she]101-birdalone hearkened a while and heard no sound of [coming men]7088-coming men ; and there came into [her]101-birdalone heart a gentle fear , which grieved [her]101-birdalone not . Over the water before [her]101-birdalone hung an eglantine bush , with its many roses either budding or but just out . [Birdalone]101-birdalone stole thither softly , and said , smiling : Nay , if [I]116-viridis have nothing that is mine on [my]116-viridis body , [I]116-viridis will take this of [the maiden]406-the maiden 's bath and make it mine . And therewith [she]101-birdalone plucked a spray of the bush and turned it into a garland for [her]101-birdalone head ; and then when [she]101-birdalone had stood shyly a while in [that same place]7090-that same place , [she]101-birdalone turned and went swiftly to [her]101-birdalone place beside [her]101-birdalone night - harbour , and stood there hearkening with that sweet fear growing upon [her]101-birdalone , [her]101-birdalone colour coming and going , and [her]101-birdalone heart beating fast .[116-viridis]

Now the thought of [that kind priest who had led [her]2091-she to the bower last night]2090-that kind priest who had led her to the bower last night came into [her]2091-she mind , and [she]2091-she wondered why [he]2090-that kind priest who had led her to the bower last night had been so troubled . And [she]2091-she thought , would [those others]2092-those others be so kind to [her]2091-she , or would [they]2092-those others deem [her]2091-she [an impudent wench]2093-an impudent wench or [a foolish]2094-a foolish , or pass [her]2091-she by ?

Forsooth if any had passed [her]2091-she by it had been not that [he]2090-that kind priest who had led her to the bower last night should miss seeing [her]2091-she beauty , but that [he]2090-that kind priest who had led her to the bower last night should fear it , and deem [her]2091-she [some goddess of [the Gentiles of old time]2096-the gentiles of old time]2095-some goddess of the gentiles of old time come before [him]2090-that kind priest who had led her to the bower last night for [his]2090-that kind priest who had led her to the bower last night ensnaring .

CHAPTER IV . AND NOW [SHE]2091-she MEETS THE CHAMPIONS

Now , as [she]2091-she stood hearkening , [she]2091-she deemed [she]2091-she heard something that was not so loud as the song of the blackbird in the brake , but further off and longer voiced : and again [she]2091-she hearkened heedfully , and the sound came again , and [she]2091-she deemed now that it was the voice of an horn . But the third time of [her]2091-she hearing it [she]2091-she knew that it was nought less ; and at last it grew nigher , and there was mingled with it the sound of [men]219-men shouting and the lowing of neat .

Then [she]2091-she stepped down to the very edge of the way , and now [she]2091-she saw [the riding - reek]2098-the riding - reek go up into the clear air , and [she]2091-she said : Now are [they]219-men coming without fail , and [I]0-i must pluck up a heart ; for surely [these dear friends of [[my]0-i friends]2100-my friends]2099-these dear friends of my friends shall neither harm [a poor maiden]2101-a poor maiden nor scorn [her]2101-a poor maiden .

Soon came [the leading beasts from out of the dust - cloud]2102-the leading beasts from out of the dust - cloud , and behind [them]2102-the leading beasts from out of the dust - cloud was the glitter of spear - heads ; and then presently was a herd of neat shambling and jostling along [the road]2103-the road , and after [them]2102-the leading beasts from out of the dust - cloud a score or so of [spearmen in jack and sallet]2104-spearmen in jack and sallet , who , forsooth , turned to look on [Birdalone]101-birdalone as [they]219-men passed by , and spake here and there a word or two , laughing and pointing to [her]101-birdalone , but stayed not ; and all went on straight to [the castle]1838-the castle .

Thereafter was a void , and then came riding leisurely [another score of [weaponed men]2107-weaponed men]2106-another score of weaponed men , whereof [some in white armour]2108-some in white armour ; and amongst [them]2106-another score of weaponed men were five sumpter horses laden with carcasses of venison . And all these also went by and stayed not , though the most of [them]2106-another score of weaponed men gazed on [Birdalone]101-birdalone hard enough .

Last of all came [three knights]2109-three knights riding , one with a gold surcoat over [his]2110-his armour , and thereon a cleft heart of red ; [the second with a green surcoat]2111-the second with a green surcoat , and on the same [a chief of silver with green boughs thereon]2112-a chief of silver with green boughs thereon , [their]2109-three knights ends a - flaming ; but the third bore a black surcoat besprinkled with silver tears . And [all these three]2113-all these three rode bare - headed , save that [the Black Knight]2114-the black knight bore an oak - wreath on the head .

Now did [Birdalone]101-birdalone take to [her]101-birdalone valiancy , and [she]101-birdalone stepped out into [the road]2103-the road till [she]101-birdalone was but a ten paces from [those men]2116-those men , who reined up when [they]2116-those men beheld [her]101-birdalone ; and [she]101-birdalone said in a clear voice : Abide , [warriors]2117-warriors ! for if [ye]2117-warriors be what [I]0-i deem [you]2117-warriors , [I]0-i have an errand unto [you]2117-warriors .

Scarce were the words out of [her]101-birdalone mouth , ere all three had leapt off [their]2113-all these three horses , and [the Golden Knight]1329-the golden knight came up to [her]101-birdalone , and laid [his]1329-the golden knight hand upon [her]101-birdalone side , and spake eagerly and said : Where is [she]101-birdalone , whence [thou]2119-thou gattest this gown of good web ? And [thou]2119-thou , said [she]101-birdalone , art [thou]2119-thou [Baudoin the Golden Knight]123-baudoin ? But [he]1329-the golden knight set [his]1329-the golden knight hand to the collar on [her]101-birdalone neck , and touched [her]101-birdalone skin withal , and said : This , was [she]101-birdalone alive when [thou]2119-thou camest by it ? [She]101-birdalone said : If [thou]2119-thou be [Baudoin the Golden Knight]123-baudoin , [I]0-i have an errand to [thee]2119-thou . [I]0-i am [he]123-baudoin , said [the knight]2120-the knight ; O tell [me]0-i , tell [me]0-i , is [she]101-birdalone dead ? Said [Birdalone]101-birdalone : [Aurea]116-viridis was alive when last [I]0-i saw [her]101-birdalone , and [mine]0-i errand is from [her]101-birdalone to [thee]2119-thou , if [thou]2119-thou be verily [[her]101-birdalone lover]2121-her lover . Now with this word [I]0-i pray [thee]2119-thou to be content a while , said [she]0-i , smiling kindly upon [him]2119-thou , for needs must [I]0-i do [mine]0-i errand in such wise as [I]0-i was bidden . And [thou]2119-thou seest also that [[thy]2119-thou friends]2122-thy friends would have a word of [me]0-i .

Forsooth , [they]2122-thy friends were thrusting in on [her]0-i , and [the Green Knight]1331-the green knight gat a hold of [her]0-i left wrist in [his]1331-the green knight left hand , and [his]1331-the green knight right was on [her]0-i shoulder , and [his]1331-the green knight bright face close to [her]0-i bosom whereon lay [Viridis]116-viridis ' smock ; and thereat [she]0-i shrank aback somewhat , but said : [Sir]7091-sir , it is sooth that the smock is for [thee]7091-sir when [thou]2119-thou hast answered [me]1331-the green knight a question or two . Meanwhile [I]1331-the green knight pray [thee]7091-sir forbear a little ; for , as [I]1331-the green knight trow , all is well , and [thou]2119-thou shalt see [[my]1331-the green knight dear friend]7092-my dear friend [Viridis]116-viridis again .[1331-the green knight]

[He]1331-the green knight withdrew [him]1331-the green knight a little , flushed and shamefaced . [He]1331-the green knight was [a young man exceeding beauteous]2124-a young man exceeding beauteous , clear - skinned and grey - eyed , with curly golden hair , and [he]1331-the green knight bore [his]1331-the green knight armour as though it were silken cloth . [Birdalone]101-birdalone looked upon [him]1331-the green knight kindly though shyly , and was glad to the heart 's root that [Viridis]116-viridis had so lovely [a man to [her]116-viridis darling]2125-a man to her darling . As for [the Golden Knight]123-baudoin , as [Birdalone]101-birdalone might see now , [he]1331-the green knight stood a little aloof ; [he]1331-the green knight was [a very goodly man of some five and thirty winters]2126-a very goodly man of some five and thirty winters ; tall [he]1331-the green knight was , broad - shouldered and thin - flanked , black - haired , with somewhat heavy eyebrows , and fierce hawk - eyes ; [a man terrible of aspect]2127-a man terrible of aspect , when [one first]2128-one first beheld [him]1331-the green knight .

Now when [the Black Squire]125-arthur had hearkened [Birdalone]101-birdalone 's word concerning [Viridis]116-viridis , [he]1331-the green knight threw [himself]1331-the green knight down on the ground before [her]116-viridis , and fell to kissing [her]116-viridis feet ; or , if [you]2129-you will , [Atra]117-atra 's shoon which covered them . When [she]116-viridis drew back a little , [he]1331-the green knight rose on one knee and looked up at [her]116-viridis with an eager face , and [she]116-viridis said : To [thee]1331-the green knight also [I]0-i have an errand from [Atra]117-atra , [[thy]1331-the green knight speech - friend]2130-thy speech - friend , if [thou]1331-the green knight be [Arthur the Black Squire]125-arthur . [He]1331-the green knight spake not , but still gazed on [her]116-viridis till [she]116-viridis reddened . [She]116-viridis knew not whether to deem [him]1331-the green knight less goodly than [the other twain]1532-the other twain . [He]1331-the green knight also was [a young man of not over five and twenty years]2132-a young man of not over five and twenty years , slim and lithe , with much brown hair ; [his]1331-the green knight face tanned so dark that [his]1331-the green knight eyes gleamed light from amidst it ; [his]1331-the green knight chin was round and cloven , [his]1331-the green knight mouth and nose excellently fashioned ; little hair [he]1331-the green knight had upon [his]1331-the green knight face , [his]1331-the green knight cheeks were somewhat more hollow than round . [Birdalone]101-birdalone noted of [his]1331-the green knight bare hands , which were as brown as [his]1331-the green knight face , that they were very trim and shapely .

Now [he]1331-the green knight rose to [his]1331-the green knight feet , and [the three]302-the three stood together and gazed on [her]116-viridis ; as how might [they]302-the three do otherwise ? [Birdalone]101-birdalone hung [her]101-birdalone head , and knew not what next to do or say . But [she]101-birdalone thought within [herself]101-birdalone , would [these three men]2134-these three men have been as kind to [her]101-birdalone as [[her]101-birdalone three friends of [the Isle]26-the isle]2135-her three friends of the isle , had [she]101-birdalone happened on [them]2134-these three men in like case as [she]101-birdalone was that time ? And [she]101-birdalone settled with [herself]101-birdalone that [they]2134-these three men would have been no less kind .

Now spake [the Golden Knight]1329-the golden knight , and said : Will [the kind maiden]2137-the kind maiden do [her]2137-the kind maiden errand to [us]2134-these three men here and now ? for [we]2134-these three men be eager and worn with trouble . [Birdalone]101-birdalone looked adown and was somewhat confused . [Fair sirs]2138-fair sirs , said [she]101-birdalone , [I]0-i will do [your]2138-fair sirs will herein .

But [the Black Squire]125-arthur looked on [her]101-birdalone and saw that [she]101-birdalone was troubled , and [he]125-arthur said : [Your]101-birdalone pardon , [fair fellows]2139-fair fellows , but is it not so that [we]2134-these three men have [an house somewhat anigh]2140-an house somewhat anigh , not ill purveyed of many things ? By [your]2139-fair fellows leave [I]0-i would entreat [this kind and dear lady]2141-this kind and dear lady to honour [us]2134-these three men so much as to enter [the Castle of [the Quest]31-the quest]1931-the castle of the quest with [us]2134-these three men , and abide there so long as [she]2141-this kind and dear lady will ; and therein may [she]2141-this kind and dear lady tell [us]2134-these three men all [her]2141-this kind and dear lady errand at [her]2141-this kind and dear lady leisure ; and already [we]2134-these three men may see and know , that it may not be aught save a joyous one .

Then spake [the Golden Knight]1329-the golden knight , and said : [I]0-i will ask [the lady]1157-the lady to pardon [me]0-i , and will now join [my]0-i prayer to thine , [brother]2145-brother , that [she]2141-this kind and dear lady come [home]387-home with [us]2134-these three men . [Lady]504-lady , [he]1329-the golden knight said , wilt [thou]2148-thou not pardon [me]0-i , that in the eager desire to hear tidings of [my]0-i speech - friend [I]0-i forgat all else .

And therewithal [he]1329-the golden knight knelt before [her]504-lady , and took [her]504-lady hand and kissed it ; and for all [his]1329-the golden knight fierce eyes and [[his]1329-the golden knight warrior]2149-his warrior 's mien , [she]504-lady deemed [him]1329-the golden knight kind and friendly . Then needs must [the Green Knight]1331-the green knight kneel and kiss also , though [he]1329-the golden knight had no pardon to crave ; but [a fair sweet lad]2151-a fair sweet lad [she]504-lady thought [him]1329-the golden knight , and again [her]504-lady heart swelled with joy to think that [[her]504-lady friend]446-her friend [Viridis]116-viridis had so dear a speech - friend to long for [her]504-lady .

Then came the turn of [the Black Squire]125-arthur , and by then were [the two others]2153-the two others turned away a little toward [their]2153-the two others horses ; and [he]1329-the golden knight knelt down on both knees before [Birdalone]101-birdalone and took [her]101-birdalone right arm above the wrist , and looked at the hand and kissed it as if it were a relic , but stood not up ; and [she]504-lady stood bending over [him]1329-the golden knight , and a new sweetness entered into [her]504-lady , the like of which [she]504-lady had never felt . But as for [the Black Squire]125-arthur , it seemed that one hand would not suffice [him]1329-the golden knight , and [he]1329-the golden knight took [her]101-birdalone left hand and fell to kissing it , and then both the hands together all over the backs of them , and then the palms thereof , and [he]1329-the golden knight buried [his]1329-the golden knight face in the two palms , and held them to [his]1329-the golden knight cheeks ; and the dear hands suffered it all , and consented to the embracing of [his]1329-the golden knight cheeks . But [Birdalone]101-birdalone deemed that this was the kindest and sweetest of [the three kind warriors]2154-the three kind warriors , and sorry [she]504-lady was when [he]1329-the golden knight let go [her]504-lady hands and stood up .

[His]1329-the golden knight face was flushed , but [his]1329-the golden knight speech calm , as [he]1329-the golden knight spake so that [the other knights]2155-the other knights might hear [him]1329-the golden knight : Now will [we]2156-we straight to [the castle]1838-the castle , [lady]504-lady , and [we]2156-we will ask [thee]504-lady which of [us]2156-we three [thou]504-lady wilt honour by riding [his]1329-the golden knight horse there ; shall it be [[Baudoin]123-baudoin 's bright bay]2159-baudoin 's bright bay , or [Hugh]124-hugh 's dapple - grey , or [my]0-i red roan ? And therewith [he]1329-the golden knight took [her]504-lady by the hand and led [her]504-lady toward the horses . But [she]504-lady laughed , and turning a little , pointed to [the castle]1838-the castle , and said : Nay , [sweet lords]2161-sweet lords , but [I]0-i will fare afoot , such a little way as it is , and [I]0-i all unwont to the saddle .

[Spake]117-atra [the Green Knight]1331-the green knight : If that be so , [lady]504-lady , then shall [we]2156-we three walk afoot with [thee]504-lady . Nay , nay , [she]504-lady said ; [I]0-i have nought to carry but [myself]0-i ; but [ye]504-lady have [your]504-lady byrnies and [your]504-lady other armour , which were heavy for [you]504-lady to drag on afoot , even a little way . Moreover , [I]0-i were fain to see [you]504-lady mount [your]504-lady horses , and ride and run about [the meadow]510-the meadow with tossing manes and flashing swords , while [I]0-i trudge quietly toward the gate ; for such things , and so beauteous , are all new unto [me]0-i , as [ye]504-lady shall learn presently when [I]0-i tell [you]504-lady [my]0-i story . Do so much to pleasure [me]0-i , [kind knights]2165-kind knights .

[The tall Baudoin]123-baudoin nodded to [her]504-lady , smiling kindly , as much as to say that [he]123-baudoin thought well of [her]504-lady desire . But [the Green Knight]1331-the green knight ran to [his]1331-the green knight horse with a glad shout , and [anon]2167-anon was in the saddle with [his]2167-anon bright sword in [his]2167-anon fist ; then [he]2167-anon spurred , and went a - gallop hither and thither over the mead , making [his]2167-anon horse turn short and bound , and playing many tricks of the tilt - yard , and crying , [A Hugh]124-hugh , [A Hugh]2168-a hugh , for [the Green Gown]134-the green gown ! [The Golden Knight]1329-the golden knight was slower and more staid , but in manywise [he]2167-anon showed [his]2167-anon war - deftness , riding after [Hugh]124-hugh as if [he]2167-anon would fall on [him]2167-anon , and staying [his]2167-anon way just as it became perilous ; and [he]2167-anon cried , [Baudoin]123-baudoin , [Baudoin]123-baudoin , for Gold - sleeves ! And all this seemed to [Birdalone]101-birdalone both terrible and lovely .

But for [the Black Squire]125-arthur , [he]125-arthur was slow to let loose [Birdalone]101-birdalone 's hand ; but thereafter [he]125-arthur was speedy to vault into [his]125-arthur saddle , and [he]125-arthur made courses over [the meadow]510-the meadow , but ever came back to [Birdalone]101-birdalone as [she]101-birdalone went [her]101-birdalone ways , riding round and round [her]101-birdalone , and tossing [his]125-arthur sword into the air the while and catching it as it fell . And no less lovely did this seem to [Birdalone]101-birdalone , and [she]101-birdalone smiled on [him]125-arthur and waved [her]101-birdalone hand to [him]125-arthur .

Going slowly in this wise , [she]101-birdalone came at last to [the castle]1838-the castle gate ; and now had all those three out - gone [her]101-birdalone and stood afoot in the wicket to welcome [her]101-birdalone , and [the Golden Knight , who was [the oldest of [the three]302-the three]2173-the oldest of the three]2172-the golden knight , who was the oldest of the three , was [the speaker of the welcome]2175-the speaker of the welcome .

Over the threshold of [the Castle of the Quest]1931-the castle of the quest went [Birdalone]101-birdalone 's feet then , and [she]101-birdalone was grown so happy as [she]101-birdalone had never deemed [she]101-birdalone should be all [her]101-birdalone life long .

CHAPTER V. [BIRDALONE]101-birdalone HAS TRUE TOKENS FROM [THE CHAMPIONS OF THE QUEST]2177-the champions of the quest

Now [they]2178-they brought [Birdalone]101-birdalone into [a very fair chamber]2179-a very fair chamber , where was presently everything [she]101-birdalone might need , save [a tiring woman]2180-a tiring woman , which , forsooth , was no lack unto [her]101-birdalone , since never had [she]101-birdalone had any to help [her]101-birdalone array [her]101-birdalone body . So [she]101-birdalone did what [she]101-birdalone might to make [herself]101-birdalone [the trimmer]2181-the trimmer ; and in a while came [two fair swains of service]2182-two fair swains of service , who brought [her]101-birdalone in all honour into [the great hall]1785-the great hall , where were [the three lords abiding [her]101-birdalone]2184-the three lords abiding her . There were [they]2178-they served well and plenteously , and fair was the converse between [them]2178-they ; and in especial was the talk of [Arthur the Black Squire]125-arthur goodly and wise and cheery , and well - measured ; and [the Green Knight]124-hugh 's speech merry and kind , as of [an happy child]2185-an happy child ; and [the Golden Knight]1329-the golden knight spake ever free and kindly , though not of many words was [he]1329-the golden knight . And who was happy if [Birdalone]101-birdalone were not ?

But when [they]2178-they had eaten and washed [their]2178-they hands , then spake [the Golden Knight]1329-the golden knight : [Dear maiden]1206-dear maiden , now are [we]2178-they ready to hear the innermost of thine errand , all [we]2178-they together , if [thou]2189-thou wilt .

[Birdalone]101-birdalone smiled and reddened withal , as [she]101-birdalone said : Fair lords , [I]0-i doubt not but [ye]2190-they are even [they]2191-they unto whom [I]0-i was sent , but [they]2191-they who sent [me]0-i , and who saved [me]0-i from death and worse , bade [me]0-i do [mine]0-i errand in such a way , that [I]0-i should speak with [each one of [you]2190-they privily]2192-each one of you privily , and that for a token each should tell [me]0-i a thing known but to [him]2193-him and [his]2193-him love , and to [me]0-i unto whom [she]2194-she hath told it . Now am [I]0-i all ready to do [mine]0-i errand thus , and no other wise .

Laughed [they]2190-they now , and were merry , and [the Green Knight]1331-the green knight blushed like [a maiden]2196-a maiden ; forsooth like to [[his]1331-the green knight very speech - friend]2197-his very speech - friend [Viridis]116-viridis . But [the Black Squire]1334-the black squire said : [Fair fellows]2139-fair fellows , get [we]2190-they all into the pleasance this fair morn , and sit there on the grass , and [[our]2190-they sweet lady]2200-our sweet lady shall take [us]2190-they one after other into [the plashed alley]2201-the plashed alley , and have the tokens of [us]2190-they .

Even so [they]2190-they did , and went into the pleasance , which was [a goodly little garth south of [the castle]1838-the castle]2202-a goodly little garth south of the castle , grassed , and set thick with roses and lilies and gillyflowers , and other fragrant flowers . There then [they]2190-they sat on the daisied greensward , [the three lords]2204-the three lords together , and [Birdalone]101-birdalone over against [them]2190-they , and [they]2190-they three watched [her]101-birdalone beauty and loveliness and wondered thereat .

But [she]101-birdalone said : Now it comes to the very point of [mine]101-birdalone errand ; wherefore [I]0-i bid [thee]2205-he , [Baudoin]123-baudoin [the Golden Knight]1329-the golden knight , to come apart with [me]0-i and answer to [my]0-i questions , so that [I]0-i may know surely that [I]0-i am doing [mine]0-i errand aright .

Therewith [she]101-birdalone arose to [her]101-birdalone feet , and [he]2205-he also , and [he]2205-he led [her]101-birdalone into [the plashed alley]2201-the plashed alley , out of earshot of [the other twain , who lay upon the grass]2208-the other twain , who lay upon the grass biding [their]2208-the other twain , who lay upon the grass turn with but little patience .

But when [those two]2209-those two were in the deep shade of [the alley]2210-the alley , [Birdalone]101-birdalone said : [Thou]2211-thou must know , [Sir Golden Knight]123-baudoin , that [the three lovers of [you]2213-you three]2212-the three lovers of you three were good to [me]0-i in [my]0-i need , and clad [my]0-i nakedness from [their]2212-the three lovers of you three very bodies , but this raiment [they]2212-the three lovers of you three lent [me]0-i , and gave it not ; for [they]2212-the three lovers of you three bade [me]0-i give it up piece by piece each unto [the one who had given it to [his]2214-the one who had given it to his love love]2214-the one who had given it to his love , whom [I]0-i should know by the token that [he]2214-the one who had given it to his love should tell truly the tale of its giving . Now , [fair sir]2215-fair sir , [I]0-i know well , for [I]0-i have been told , what was the tale of [thy]2211-thou giving this golden gown to [Aurea]116-viridis , and that same tale shalt [thou]2211-thou now tell [me]0-i , and if [thou]2211-thou tell it aright , then is the gown thine . Begin , then , without more tarrying .

[Lady]504-lady , said [the knight]2120-the knight , thus it was : [Aurea]116-viridis , [[my]0-i sweetling]2218-my sweetling , abode with [an ancient dame]2219-an ancient dame , [a kinswoman of [hers]2219-an ancient dame]2220-a kinswoman of hers , who was but scantly kind to [her]2219-an ancient dame ; and on a day when [we]2221-we had met [privily]2222-privily , and were talking together , [[my]0-i love]2223-my love lamented the niggard ways of [[her]2219-an ancient dame said kinswoman]2224-her said kinswoman , and told how [she]2219-an ancient dame had no goodly gown to make [her]2219-an ancient dame fair when feasts were toward ; but [I]0-i laughed at [her]2219-an ancient dame , and told [her]2219-an ancient dame that so clad as [she]2219-an ancient dame was and [her]2219-an ancient dame attire was verily but simple [she]2219-an ancient dame was fairer than any other ; and then , as [ye]2225-ye may wot , there was kissing and clipping between [us]2221-we ; but at last , as from the first [I]0-i meant it , [I]0-i promised [her]2219-an ancient dame [I]0-i would purvey [her]2219-an ancient dame such a gown as [no lady]2226-no lady should go with a better in all [the country - side]2227-the country - side ; but [I]0-i said that in return [I]0-i must have the gown [she]2219-an ancient dame went in then , which had so long embraced [her]2219-an ancient dame body and been strained so close to [her]2219-an ancient dame body and [her]2219-an ancient dame sides , and was as it were a part of [her]2219-an ancient dame . That [she]2219-an ancient dame promised [me]0-i with kisses , and [I]0-i went away as merry as a bird . Straightway thereafter [I]0-i did do make this very gown , which [thou]2228-thou bearest , [dear maiden]1206-dear maiden , and on the appointed day [she]2219-an ancient dame came out to [me]0-i unto the same place clad as [she]2219-an ancient dame was before ; but the new gown [I]0-i had with [me]0-i . Hard by [our]2230-our trysting - place was a hazel - copse thick enow , for it was midsummer , and [she]2219-an ancient dame said [she]2219-an ancient dame would go thereinto and shift gowns , and bear [me]0-i out thence the gift of the old clout so [she]2219-an ancient dame called it , laughing merrily . But [I]0-i said : Nay , [I]0-i would go into [the copse]2231-the copse with [her]2219-an ancient dame to guard [her]2219-an ancient dame from evil things , beasts or [men]219-men ; and withal to see [her]2219-an ancient dame do off the old gown , that [I]0-i might know before [I]0-i wedded [her]2219-an ancient dame whatlike stuffing and padding went to make the grace of [her]2219-an ancient dame flanks and [her]2219-an ancient dame hips . And again was [she]2219-an ancient dame merry , and [she]2219-an ancient dame said : Come , then , [thou]2233-thou Thomas unbelieving , and see the side of [me]0-i . So [we]2234-we went into that cover together , and [she]2219-an ancient dame did off [her]2219-an ancient dame gown before [mine]0-i eyes , and stood there in [her]2219-an ancient dame white coat with [her]2219-an ancient dame arms bare , and [her]2219-an ancient dame shoulders and bosom little covered , and [she]2219-an ancient dame was as lovely as [a woman of the faery]2235-a woman of the faery . Then [I]0-i made no prayer unto [her]2219-an ancient dame for leave , but took [my]0-i arms about [her]2219-an ancient dame , and kissed [her]2219-an ancient dame arms and shoulders and bosom all [she]2219-an ancient dame would suffer [me]0-i , for [I]0-i was mad with love of [her]2219-an ancient dame naked flesh . Then [she]2219-an ancient dame did on this golden gown , and departed when [she]2219-an ancient dame had given [me]0-i the old clout aforesaid , and [I]0-i went away with it , scarce feeling the ground beneath [my]0-i feet ; and [I]0-i set the dear gown in a fair little coffer , and here in [this castle]1970-this castle [I]0-i have it now , and many times [I]0-i take it forth and kiss it and lay [my]0-i head upon it . Now this is a simple tale , [lady]504-lady , and [I]0-i am ashamed that [I]0-i have made it so long for [thee]504-lady . And yet [I]0-i know not ; for [thou]2238-thou seemest to [me]0-i so kind and loving and true , that [I]0-i am fain that [thou]2238-thou shouldest know how sorely [I]0-i love [[thy]2238-thou friend]2239-thy friend and [mine]0-i .

[Birdalone]101-birdalone deemed [Baudoin]123-baudoin [a good man]2240-a good man indeed , and the tears came into [her]101-birdalone eyes as [she]101-birdalone answered and said : True is [thy]123-baudoin tale , [dear friend]1232-dear friend , and [I]0-i have deemed it rather short than long . [I]0-i see well that [thou]123-baudoin art [[Aurea]116-viridis 's very lover]2242-aurea 's very lover ; and it joys [me]0-i to think that [thou]123-baudoin , [O terrible champion]2243-o terrible champion , art yet so tender and true . Now is the golden gown thine , but [I]0-i will pray [thee]123-baudoin to lend it [me]0-i a little longer . But this jewel shalt [thou]123-baudoin have from [my]0-i neck here and now ; and [thou]123-baudoin knowest whence it came , thine [Aurea]116-viridis 's neck forsooth .

Therewith [she]101-birdalone betook it [him]1232-dear friend , and [he]1232-dear friend held it in [his]1232-dear friend hand doubtfully a while , and then [he]1232-dear friend said : [Dear maiden]1206-dear maiden , [I]0-i thank [thee]1206-dear maiden , but [I]0-i will take this collar , and lay it in [my]0-i casket , and be glad thereof ; and that the more , as , now [I]0-i look on [thee]1206-dear maiden , [I]0-i see nought missing from the loveliness of [thine]1206-dear maiden own neck .

Go to [[thy]123-baudoin fellows]2245-thy fellows now , said [Birdalone]101-birdalone , and send [me]0-i [the Green Knight]1331-the green knight , [the goodly lad]2247-the goodly lad . So went [he]1232-dear friend , and presently came [Hugh thither]124-hugh merry and smiling , and said : [Thou]2248-thou hast been long about the first token , [sweet mistress]2249-sweet mistress ; [I]0-i fear [me]0-i [I]0-i shall make no such goodly story as hath [Baudoin]123-baudoin . And yet , said [she]2249-sweet mistress , [Viridis]116-viridis ' tale was the longest of all . [I]2249-sweet mistress doubt [thou]2248-thou mayst fail in the token . And [she]2249-sweet mistress laughed ; and [he]1232-dear friend no less , and took [her]2249-sweet mistress by the shoulders , and kissed [her]2249-sweet mistress cheek frankly , and in such wise that [she]2249-sweet mistress feared [him]1232-dear friend nought , and said : Now that is to pay [thee]1232-dear friend for [thy]1232-dear friend gibe ; what wouldst [thou]1232-dear friend have of [me]2249-sweet mistress ? Said [Birdalone]101-birdalone : [I]2249-sweet mistress would have [thee]2248-thou tell [me]2249-sweet mistress how it was that [Viridis]116-viridis came by the smock with the green boughs aflame , which now [I]2249-sweet mistress bear upon [me]2249-sweet mistress .[2249-sweet mistress]

Hearken , [darling lady]2250-darling lady , said [he]2251-he : On a day [Viridis]116-viridis and [I]0-i were alone in [the meadow]510-the meadow , and so happy , that [we]2253-we might find nought to do save to fall into strife together ; and [I]0-i said it to [her]2250-darling lady , that [she]2250-darling lady loved [me]0-i not as well as [I]0-i loved [her]2250-darling lady ; which , by the way , was no less than a lie , for of all things living [she]2250-darling lady is the most loving , and when [we]2253-we be together [she]2250-darling lady knoweth not how to make enough of [me]0-i . Well , [we]2253-we fell to wrangling after the manner of [lovers]2254-lovers , till [I]0-i , having nothing else to say , bade [her]2250-darling lady remember that since [we]2253-we had first come to love [each other]580-each other , [I]0-i had given [her]2250-darling lady many things , and [she]2250-darling lady had given [me]0-i nothing . [Lo]128-lo , then ! [[my]0-i dear]2256-my dear , what [an ill - conditioned lad]2257-an ill - conditioned lad was [I.]0-i But , little as [I]0-i meant it , [she]2250-darling lady took it all amiss , and leapt up , and fell to running back [home]387-home over [the meadow]510-the meadow ; [thou]2260-thou mayst think how easily [I]0-i caught up with [her]2250-darling lady , and how little loth [she]2250-darling lady was to be dragged back by the shoulders . So when [we]2253-we were sitting again under the thorn - bush , [we]2253-we had well - nigh done [our]2253-we wrangle ; but [she]2250-darling lady unlaced [her]2250-darling lady gown and drew down a corner thereof , to show [me]0-i [her]2250-darling lady shoulder , how [I]0-i had hurt it e'en now ; and forsooth some little mark there was on the rose - leaf skin ; and that made good time for kissing again , as [ye]2261-ye may well wot . Then [she]2250-darling lady said unto [me]0-i : And how may [I]0-i , [a poor damsel]2262-a poor damsel , give [thee]2260-thou gifts , and [my]0-i kindred all greedy about [me]0-i ? Yet would [I]0-i give [thee]2260-thou a gift , such as [I]0-i may , if [I]0-i but knew what [thou]2260-thou wouldst take . Now [my]0-i heart was afire with that kissing of [her]2250-darling lady shoulder , and [I]0-i said that [I]0-i would have that very same smock from [her]2250-darling lady body , which then [she]2250-darling lady bore , and that thereof [I]0-i should deem that [I]0-i had a rich gift indeed . What ! said [she]2250-darling lady , and wouldst [thou]2260-thou have it here and now ? And indeed [I]0-i think [she]2250-darling lady would have done it off [her]2250-darling lady that minute had [I]0-i pressed [her]2250-darling lady , but [I]0-i lacked the boldness thereto ; and [I]0-i said : Nay , but would [she]2250-darling lady bring it unto [me]0-i the next time [we]2263-we met ; and forsooth [she]2250-darling lady brought it folded in a piece of green silk , and dearly have [I]0-i loved it and kissed it sithence . But as for [thy]2250-darling lady smock , [I]0-i had it fairly wrought and embroidered with the flaming green branches , as [thou]2250-darling lady seest it , and [I]0-i gave it to [her]2250-darling lady ; but not on the day when [she]2250-darling lady gave [me]0-i the gift ; for the new one was long about doing . Now this is all the tale , and how [Viridis]116-viridis might eke it into a long one , [I]0-i wot not . But let it be , and tell [me]0-i , have [I]0-i won [thy]2250-darling lady smock , or lost it ?

[Birdalone]101-birdalone laughed on [him]2264-he and said : Well , at least [thou]2250-darling lady shalt have it as a gift ; and [thou]2250-darling lady mayst call it given either by [Viridis]116-viridis or [me]0-i , which [thou]2250-darling lady wilt . But with it goes another gift ; which [thou]2250-darling lady mayst have at once since [thou]2250-darling lady must lend [me]0-i the smock a little longer . And therewith [she]2250-darling lady betook [him]2264-he [her]2250-darling lady girdle , and [he]2264-he kissed it , but said : Nay , [fair lady]2265-fair lady , this befitteth well the loveliness of [thy]2250-darling lady body that [thou]2250-darling lady shouldst wear it ; and well it befitteth the truth and love of [thy]2250-darling lady soul toward it for [me]0-i ; [I]0-i pray [thee]2250-darling lady to keep it . Nevertheless , [she]2250-darling lady said , [I]0-i will not have it , for it goeth with [mine]2250-darling lady errand that [thou]2250-darling lady take it of [me]0-i . Now [I]0-i bid [thee]2250-darling lady depart , and send hither [[thy]2250-darling lady fellow]2266-thy fellow , [the Black Squire]1334-the black squire .

Went [he]2264-he then , and anon comes [the Black Squire]1334-the black squire , and now that [he]2264-he was alone with [Birdalone]101-birdalone this first time , [he]2264-he seemed moody and downcast , all unlike [the two others]2153-the two others . [He]2264-he stood a little aloof from [Birdalone]101-birdalone , and said : What wouldst [thou]2250-darling lady ask of [me]0-i ? [Her]2250-darling lady heart was somewhat chilled by [his]2264-he moodiness , for erst had [she]2250-darling lady deemed [him]2264-he [the kindest of [the three]302-the three]2270-the kindest of the three ; but [she]2250-darling lady said : It is of [mine]2250-darling lady errand to ask of [thee]2264-he concerning this foot - gear which [Atra]117-atra lent [me]0-i until [I]0-i give it unto [thee]2264-he , if [thou]2264-he be verily [[her]117-atra lover]2121-her lover . Said [he]2264-he : [I]0-i was verily [[her]117-atra lover]2121-her lover . [Birdalone]101-birdalone said : Then canst [thou]2264-he tell [me]0-i the manner of [thy]2264-he giving these fair shoon unto [Atra]117-atra ?

[He]2264-he said : Even so ; [we]2274-we were walking together in [this country - side]2049-this country - side and came to [a ford of [the river]2277-the river]2276-a ford of the river , and it was somewhat deep and took [me]0-i to over the knee , so [I]0-i bore [her]117-atra over in [my]0-i arms ; then [we]2274-we went on a little further till [we]2274-we must cross [the river]2277-the river back again in another place , and there [the ford]2279-the ford was shallower , and , the day being hot , [Atra]117-atra must needs wade it on [her]117-atra own feet . So [she]117-atra did off hosen and shoon , and [I]0-i led [her]117-atra by the hand , and it took [her]117-atra but up to mid - leg . But when [we]2274-we came up out of [the water]361-the water and were on the grass again , [I]0-i craved the gift of [her]117-atra foot - gear for the love of [her]117-atra , and [she]117-atra gave it straightway , and fared [home]387-home barefoot , for it was over the meads [we]2274-we were wending in early summer , and the grass was thick and soft . But thereafter [I]0-i did do make the fair shoon which [thou]2282-thou hast on [thy]2282-thou feet , and gave them to [her]117-atra . And , for a further token that [my]0-i tale is true , [I]0-i shall tell [thee]2282-thou that the name of [the first ford [we]2274-we waded]2283-the first ford we waded that day is [the Grey - nag]2284-the grey - nag 's Wade , and the second is called [Goat Ford]33-goat ford . This is all [my]0-i tale , [lady]504-lady ; is the token true ?

True it is , [squire]1851-squire , said [Birdalone]101-birdalone , and was silent awhile , and [he]1851-squire also . Then [she]117-atra looked on [him]1851-squire friendly , and said : [Thou]2282-thou art out of heart as now , [[my]0-i friend]318-my friend . Fear not , for [thou]2282-thou shalt without doubt see [thy]2282-thou speech - friend again . Moreover here is a ring which [she]117-atra set upon [my]0-i finger , bidding [me]0-i give it [thee]2282-thou . And [she]117-atra held it out unto [him]1851-squire .

[He]1851-squire took the ring , and said : Yea , it is best that [I]0-i have it of [thee]504-lady , lest unluck come thereof . [She]117-atra saw trouble in [his]1851-squire face , but knew not what to say to cheer [him]1851-squire , and [they]2288-they stood silently facing [one another]2289-one another for awhile . Then [he]1851-squire said : Let [us]2288-they back to [[our]2288-they fellows]2290-our fellows , and talk it over , what is now to be done .

So [they]2288-they went [their]2288-they ways to where lay [the other two]2291-the other two upon the green grass , and [the Black Squire]1334-the black squire lay down beside [them]2288-they ; but [Birdalone]101-birdalone stood before [them]2288-they and spake unto [the three]302-the three .

CHAPTER VI . HOW THE CHAMPIONS WOULD DO [BIRDALONE]101-birdalone TO BE CLAD ANEW IN [THE CASTLE OF [THE QUEST

Lords]2295-the quest lords]2294-the castle of the quest lords , [she]117-atra said , now is it clear by the tokens that [mine]117-atra errand is to [you]1851-squire and none other ; now therefore am [I]0-i to tell [you]1851-squire what to do to come unto [[your]1851-squire speech - friends]2296-your speech - friends and deliver [them]2296-your speech - friends and bring [them]2296-your speech - friends back hither . For this is [their]2296-your speech - friends case , that [they]2296-your speech - friends are in captivity in [a wonder - isle of [this great water]2298-this great water]2297-a wonder - isle of this great water , and it is called [the Isle of Increase]34-the isle of increase Unsought .

Spake [the Golden Knight]1329-the golden knight : [Fair lady]2265-fair lady , [we]2301-we have heard before that [[our]2301-we friends]2302-our friends fared hence , or rather were taken hence over [the water]361-the water . And that is the cause why [we]2301-we builded [this castle on [the water]361-the water 's edge]2304-this castle on the water 's edge , on [the very stead where was raised [the pavilion]1427-the pavilion]2306-the very stead where was raised the pavilion , [the house]325-the house made for [the ladies]2309-the ladies to abide therein the battle of [the Champions]135-the champions . Since that time , moreover , many [a barge and keel]2310-a barge and keel have [we]2301-we thrust out into [the water]361-the water , that [we]2301-we might accomplish the Quest whereunto [we]2301-we were vowed ; but ever one way went [our]2301-we seafaring , that when [we]2301-we were come so far out into [the water]361-the water as to lose sight of [land]653-land , came upon [us]2301-we mist , rose against [us]2301-we dusk and darkness ; and then a fierce driving wind that drave [us]2301-we back to [this shore]2314-this shore . It is but six days ago since [we]2301-we tried this adventure for the last time , and belike the same shall befall [us]2301-we the next time [we]2301-we try it . Wherefore [I]0-i must ask [thee]2315-thou , [lady]504-lady , dost [thou]2315-thou know any way whereby [we]2301-we may come to [the said isle]2317-the said isle ? For if [thou]2315-thou dost , full surely [we]2301-we will try it , whatsoever may be the risk thereby to [our]2301-we bodies or [our]2301-we souls .

Full surely [I]0-i do , said [Birdalone]101-birdalone ; else how had [I]0-i come from thence hither [mine]0-i own self ? And therewith [she]101-birdalone told [them]2318-them of the Sending Boat , what it was , and how [she]101-birdalone had come all the way by means thereof from [the Isle of [Increase Unsought]32-increase unsought]22-the isle of increase unsought ; and [they]2318-them all hearkened [her]101-birdalone heedfully , and wondered both at the sorcery , and the valiant heart of [her]101-birdalone who had driven it as [she]101-birdalone would in despite of the evil . But in the end [she]101-birdalone spake and said : [Lords]2319-lords , [ye]2319-lords have now heard some deal of [my]0-i story , even that which concerns [you]2319-lords thereof ; and which must needs be told at once : wherefore doubtless [ye]2319-lords shall fare unto [your]2319-lords speech- [friends]416-friends by this ferry in the very wise that [I]0-i shall show [you]2319-lords ; unless perchance [ye]2319-lords deem that [I]0-i have been lying and making light tales to [you]2319-lords , as , sooth to say , [I]0-i deem [ye]2319-lords think it not .

[Spake]117-atra [the Golden Knight]1329-the golden knight : [Damsel]133-damsel , in all wise [we]2322-we trow in [thee]2319-lords and [thy]2319-lords tale . And [God]120-god forbid that [we]2322-we should tarry ! Go [we]2322-we hence this very day .

[Yea]2323-yea , but hearken , said [the Black Squire]1334-the black squire : Is it not a part of [this damsel]2325-this damsel 's errand that [she]2325-this damsel should deliver to [us]2322-we the raiment of [[our]2322-we friends]2302-our friends , which now [she]2325-this damsel beareth on [her]2325-this damsel own body , that [we]2322-we may bear it back unto [them]2302-our friends ?

Sooth is that , said [Birdalone]101-birdalone , and [ye]2327-ye may well wot that this may be nought but needful , whereas [the said ladies]2328-the said ladies be all beset by sorceries .

See [ye]2327-ye then , [fellows]1323-fellows , said [the Black Squire]125-arthur , it may not be to - day nor yet to - morrow that [we]2322-we may take [the road]2103-the road . For [ye]2327-ye wot that there is [no woman]757-no woman 's gear in all [the castle]1838-the castle , and [we]2322-we must needs send otherwhere to seek it .

Look [thou]2333-thee , [maiden]1117-maiden , said [the Golden Knight]1329-the golden knight , laughing , how duly [this young knight]2336-this young knight thinketh of [thee]2333-thee ; whereas [I]0-i , who am [[his]2336-this young knight elder]2337-his elder , and should be wiser than [he]2336-this young knight , am but heedless of [thee]2333-thee . [I]0-i pray [thy]2333-thee pardon .

Moreover , said [the Black Squire]1334-the black squire , there may well be wisdom in abiding ; for it is to be thought that [[our]2322-we dear loves]2339-our dear loves considered this , and knew what the time of tarrying should be , and have so dight [their]2339-our dear loves matter as to fit in therewith ; and [I]0-i may not deem it of [them]2339-our dear loves that [they]2339-our dear loves would have [us]2322-we array this [[our]2322-we dear sister]2340-our dear sister and [theirs]2339-our dear loves in unseemly wise . Nay , for that would be an ill beginning of this deal of the Quest .

Now all yeasaid this gladly ; and [the Green Knight]124-hugh said : It were not so ill done that [we]2322-we should see more of [[our]2322-we sister]2341-our sister here ere [we]2322-we depart , and hear more of [her]2341-our sister tale ; for meseemeth [she]2341-our sister began it erewhile but half - way . And [he]124-hugh turned to [Birdalone]101-birdalone , and took [her]101-birdalone hand and caressed it .

[Birdalone]101-birdalone smiled on [them]2339-our dear loves somewhat shyly , and thanked [them]2339-our dear loves ; but bade [them]2339-our dear loves spend as little time as might be on [her]2341-our sister arrayal . For , said [she]101-birdalone , though [those ladies]1806-those ladies may well have reckoned on the time of the arrayal of [my]0-i body , yet surely also [they]1806-those ladies shall have reckoned with the eager fire of love in the hearts of [you]2343-you , and the haste it shall breed therein .

Well pleased were [they]1806-those ladies with that word of hers , but [none the less]2344-none the less sent [two sergeants]2345-two sergeants and a squire with led horses unto [the cheaping - town]236-the cheaping - town , [a goodly and great town hight Greenford]2347-a goodly and great town hight greenford , which was some twenty miles thence , with the errand to bring back with [them]2339-our dear loves [a good shaper and embroideress]2348-a good shaper and embroideress , and sewing - [women]433-women , and cloth and silk and linen , and all things needful .

As for jewels , [each one of [them]2339-our dear loves]2350-each one of them was fain to give [her]101-birdalone something which [he]2351-he prized , and fair and rich were the gifts , though they had not been made for [women]433-women . As a fair SS collar of gold , which [the Golden Knight]1329-the golden knight gave [her]101-birdalone , and a girdle of broad golden plates , wrought beauteously , which was the gift of [the Black Squire]1334-the black squire . Albeit [he]2351-he did not offer to clasp it round [her]101-birdalone loins , as [she]101-birdalone deemed [he]2351-he would ; for when [the Green Knight]1331-the green knight brought [his]1331-the green knight gift , a great gold ring , very ancient of fashion , [he]1331-the green knight would have [her]101-birdalone turn back the sleeve from [her]101-birdalone fore - arm , that [he]1331-the green knight might set [his]1331-the green knight dwarf - wrought gold upon the bare flesh ; neither did [he]1331-the green knight refrain [him]1331-the green knight from kissing it withal .

But [the messengers]2356-the messengers came back with [their]2356-the messengers work - [women]433-women and stuffs early on the morrow ; and now was changed all the manner of [the womanless castle]2358-the womanless castle , and [men]219-men were full merry therein .

CHAPTER VII . OF [BIRDALONE]101-birdalone , HOW [SHE]101-birdalone TOLD [THE CHAMPIONS]135-the champions ALL [HER]101-birdalone TALE

It was a matter of eight days , the making of all [Birdalone]101-birdalone 's raiment , and meanwhile [she]101-birdalone was ever with [the three Champions]2360-the three champions , either all three together , or one or other of [them]2360-the three champions . And as to [their]2360-the three champions manners with [her]101-birdalone , ever was [the Golden Knight of somewhat sober demeanour]2361-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour , as if [he]2361-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour were [an older man than [he]2361-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour verily was]2362-an older man than he verily was . [The Green Knight]1331-the green knight was for ever praising [Birdalone]101-birdalone 's beauty to [her]101-birdalone face , and seemed to find it no easy matter to keep [his]2361-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour eyes off [her]101-birdalone , and somewhat [he]2361-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour wearied [her]101-birdalone with kisses and caresses ; but [a gay and sportive lad]2364-a gay and sportive lad [he]2361-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour was ; and when [she]101-birdalone rebuked [him]2361-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour for [his]2361-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour overmuch fondness , as now and again [she]101-birdalone did , [he]2361-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour would laugh at [himself]2361-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour along with [her]101-birdalone ; and in sooth [she]101-birdalone deemed [him]2361-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour heart - whole , and of all truth to [Viridis]116-viridis , and oft [he]2361-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour would talk of [her]101-birdalone to [Birdalone]101-birdalone , and praise [her]101-birdalone darling beauty to [her]101-birdalone , and tell of [his]2361-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour longing for [his]2361-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour love aloof . Only , quoth [he]2361-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour , here art [thou]2361-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour , [[my]0-i sister]1171-my sister , dwelling amongst [us]2366-us , and shedding [thy]2361-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour fragrance on [us]2366-us , and showing to [us]2366-us , wilt [thou]2361-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour , wilt [thou]2361-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour not , as do the flowers , all the grace and loveliness of [thee]2361-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour ; and [thou]2361-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour so tender of heart withal , that [thou]2361-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour must not blame [me]0-i overmuch if whiles [I]0-i forget that [thou]2361-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour art [[my]0-i sister]1171-my sister , and that [my]0-i love is , woe 's [me]0-i ! far away . So [thou]2361-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour wilt pardon [me]0-i , wilt [thou]2361-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour not ? [Yea]2368-yea , verily , said [she]0-i , with a whole heart . Yet [thou]2361-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour needest not reach out for [my]0-i hand ; [thou]2361-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour hast had enough of it this morning . And [she]0-i hid it , laughing , in the folds of [her]0-i gown ; and [he]2369-he laughed also , and said : Of a truth [thou]2361-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour art good in all wise , and [a young fool]2370-a young fool am [I]0-i ; but [Viridis]116-viridis shall make [me]0-i wiser , when [we]2371-we come together again . Sawest [thou]2361-the golden knight of somewhat sober demeanour ever so fair [a damsel]2372-a damsel ? Never , [she]0-i said , and surely there is none fairer in all [the world]430-the world . So hold [thee]2369-he aloof now for a while , and think of [her]0-i .

As for [the Black Squire]1334-the black squire , hight [Arthur]125-arthur , [Birdalone]101-birdalone was troubled for [him]2369-he , and [he]2369-he made [her]0-i somewhat sad . True it is that [he]2369-he came not before [her]0-i again so moody and downcast as when [he]2369-he was giving [her]0-i the token ; yet [she]0-i deemed that [he]2369-he enforced [himself]2369-he to seem of good cheer . Furthermore , though [he]2369-he sought [her]0-i company ever , and that lonely with [him]2369-he , and would talk with [her]0-i almost as [one man]2375-one man with another , though with a certain tenderness in [his]2369-he voice , and looking earnestly on [her]0-i the while , yet never would [he]2369-he take [her]0-i hand , or touch [her]0-i in any wise . And true it is that [she]0-i longed for the touch of [his]2369-he hand .

On the third day of [her]0-i sojourn in [the Castle of the Quest]1931-the castle of the quest , [Birdalone]101-birdalone took heart at the much egging of [[her]0-i friends]1314-her friends , as [they]1314-her friends sat all together in [the meadow]510-the meadow without [the castle]1838-the castle , to tell [them]1314-her friends all the story of [her]0-i ; [she]0-i hid none , save concerning [the wood - mother]934-the wood - mother , for [she]0-i deemed that [[her]0-i sweet friend]2381-her sweet friend would love [her]0-i the better if [she]0-i babbled not of [her]0-i .

So [the Champions]2382-the champions hearkened [her]0-i telling the tale in [her]0-i clear lovely voice , and great was [their]2382-the champions love and pity for [the poor lonely maiden]2383-the poor lonely maiden . And in especial clear it was to see that [they]2382-the champions were sore moved when [she]0-i told how [she]0-i first came on [the Sending Boat]832-the sending boat , and how [the witch- wife]427-the witch- wife tormented [her]427-the witch- wife innocent body for that guilt . Then [Baudoin]123-baudoin laid [his]123-baudoin hand upon [her]0-i head , and spake : [Poor child]2386-poor child , much indeed hast [thou]2387-thou suffered ! and now [I]0-i will say it , that it was for [us]2388-us and [our]2388-us loves that [thou]2387-thou hast borne all this anguish of captivity and toil and stripes .

But [Hugh]124-hugh leaned over to [her]0-i , as [she]0-i sat with [her]0-i head hanging down , and kissed [her]0-i cheek , and said : [Yea]2389-yea ! and [I]0-i was not there to smite the head off that accursed one ; and [I]0-i knew nought of [thee]2390-thee and thine anguish , as [I]0-i took [my]0-i light pleasure about [these free meadows]2391-these free meadows . And [he]124-hugh turned very red , and went nigh to weep .

[Arthur]125-arthur sat still with [his]125-arthur eyes bent down on the ground , and [he]125-arthur said nothing ; and [Birdalone]101-birdalone glanced on [him]125-arthur wistfully ere [she]101-birdalone went on with [her]101-birdalone tale . And [she]101-birdalone went on and told closely all that had happened unto [her]101-birdalone in the crossing of [the water]361-the water and on [the Isle of [Increase Unsought]25-increase]2034-the isle of increase unsought , and the other [Wonder Isles]37-wonder isles ; and [she]101-birdalone deemed it not too much that [she]101-birdalone should tell it twice over , nor [they]2394-they that twice over [they]2394-they should hearken it .

That same evening as [Birdalone]101-birdalone walked by [herself]101-birdalone in [the castle]1838-the castle pleasance , [she]101-birdalone saw [Arthur]125-arthur peering about as if [he]125-arthur were seeking [someone]496-someone ; so [she]101-birdalone stood forth , and asked [him]125-arthur was [he]125-arthur seeking aught ; and [he]125-arthur said : [Thee]2397-thee was [I]0-i seeking . But [she]101-birdalone durst not ask [him]125-arthur what [he]125-arthur would , but stood silent and trembling before [him]125-arthur , till [he]125-arthur took [her]101-birdalone hand , and spake not loud but eagerly .

After what [thou]2398-thee hast told [us]2399-us to - day , [I]0-i seem to know [thee]2398-thee what [thou]2398-thee art ; and [I]0-i tell [thee]2398-thee that it is a pain and grief to [me]0-i to leave [thee]2398-thee , [yea]2400-yea to leave [thee]2398-thee were it but for a minute . O [I]0-i pray [thee]2398-thee pity [me]0-i for the sundering . And therewith [he]125-arthur turned about and hastened into [the castle]1838-the castle . But [Birdalone]101-birdalone stood there with [her]101-birdalone heart beating fast and [her]101-birdalone flesh quivering , and a strange sweetness of joy took hold of [her]101-birdalone . But [she]101-birdalone said to [herself]101-birdalone that it was no wonder though [she]101-birdalone felt so happy , seeing that [she]101-birdalone had found out that , despite [her]101-birdalone fears , [this one of [[her]101-birdalone friends]1314-her friends]2402-this one of her friends loved [her]101-birdalone no less well than the others . And then [she]101-birdalone spake it in a soft voice that [she]101-birdalone would indeed pity [him]125-arthur for the sundering , [yea]2404-yea , and [herself]101-birdalone also .

Nevertheless , when [they]2405-they met thereafter , [his]125-arthur demeanour to [her]101-birdalone was none otherwise than it had been ; but [she]101-birdalone no longer heeded this since now [she]101-birdalone trowed in [him]125-arthur .

CHAPTER VIII . IN THE MEANWHILE OF THE DEPARTING OF [THE CHAMPIONS]135-the champions , [THEY]135-the champions WOULD PLEASURE [BIRDALONE]101-birdalone WITH FEATS OF ARMS AND [GAMES OF PROWESS]136-games of prowess

Passed the days now speedily , and [the three Champions]2360-the three champions did what [they]2360-the three champions might for the solace of [Birdalone]101-birdalone . For [they]135-the champions and [[their]135-the champions household]2407-their household showed [her]101-birdalone of arms , and [they]135-the champions tilted together courteously ; and [the sergeants]2408-the sergeants stood forth , and shot in the bow before [her]101-birdalone , till [she]101-birdalone [herself]101-birdalone by [their]135-the champions bidding took the bow in hand , and shot straighter and well - nigh as hard as [the best man there]2409-the best man there , whereat [they]135-the champions marvelled , and praised [her]101-birdalone much .

Then [the young men]2410-the young men ran afoot before [her]101-birdalone for the prize of a belt and knife , and forsooth [she]101-birdalone wotted well that were [she]101-birdalone to run against [them]2410-the young men with trussed - up skirts [she]101-birdalone would bear off the prize ; but [she]101-birdalone had no heart thereto , for amidst [them]2410-the young men all , and [her]101-birdalone new friendships , [she]101-birdalone had grown shamefast , and might play [the wood - maiden]529-the wood - maiden no longer . Yet twice [the Champions]2382-the champions fared further afield with [her]101-birdalone to show [her]101-birdalone some woodcraft ; yet were not very free to go far , because of the ill neighbours whereof [the chaplain]2413-the chaplain had told [her]101-birdalone that first night of [her]101-birdalone coming .

And in all these pastimes , whatso [they]2410-the young men were , [Birdalone]101-birdalone bore [herself]101-birdalone well and merrily , and put from [her]101-birdalone the sorrow of the sundering , and the peril of [[her]101-birdalone dear friends]2414-her dear friends which grew now so near at hand .

[The chaplain]2413-the chaplain aforesaid , who hight [Leonard]137-leonard , [she]101-birdalone fell in with not seldom ; and [he]2413-the chaplain was ever meek and humble before [her]101-birdalone ; and ever withal was sorrow easy to be seen in [his]2413-the chaplain countenance , and trouble withal ; and [she]101-birdalone knew not how to help [him]2413-the chaplain , save by being courteous and kind with [him]2413-the chaplain whenso [they]2416-they met ; but none the more might [he]2413-the chaplain pluck up cheerful countenance in answer to [her]101-birdalone kindness .

With [Sir Aymeris]138-sir aymeris , [the grizzle - haired castellan]2417-the grizzle - haired castellan , [she]101-birdalone foregathered also oft enough , and could not forbear some merry gibes with [him]2413-the chaplain concerning [their]2416-they first meeting , and how that [she]101-birdalone had been a burden and a terror to [him]2413-the chaplain ; and these mocks [she]101-birdalone made [him]2413-the chaplain because [she]101-birdalone saw it liked [him]2413-the chaplain not ill to be mocked in friendly fashion ; though forsooth betwixt the laughter [he]2413-the chaplain looked on [her]101-birdalone somewhat ruefully . And ever , ere [he]2413-the chaplain parted from [her]101-birdalone , [he]2413-the chaplain made occasion to kiss [her]101-birdalone hands ; and [she]101-birdalone suffered it smiling , and was debonair to [him]2413-the chaplain ; whereas [she]101-birdalone saw that [he]2413-the chaplain was of good will to [her]101-birdalone . In such wise then wore the hours and the days .

CHAPTER IX . [BIRDALONE]101-birdalone COMETH BEFORE [THE CHAMPIONS]135-the champions IN [HER]101-birdalone NEW ARRAY

Now the time was come when [Birdalone]101-birdalone had all [her]101-birdalone gear ready , and [the women]2418-the women were to abide in [the castle]1838-the castle as [[her]101-birdalone serving - damsels]2420-her serving - damsels while [the Champions]2382-the champions were away .

So now in the summer eve , an hour before sunset , [Birdalone]101-birdalone did on the richest of [her]101-birdalone new raiment , and came into [the hall]1202-the hall where sat [the Three together]2423-the three together , and [Sir Aymeris]138-sir aymeris with [them]2423-the three together . [She]101-birdalone was so clad , that [she]101-birdalone had on a green gown with broidered sleeves , and thereover a white cote - hardie welted with gold , and gold - embroidered ; on [her]101-birdalone feet were gold shoon of window - work , pearled and gemmed ; and on [her]101-birdalone head a rose garland ; on [her]101-birdalone neck [she]101-birdalone bore the Golden Knight 's collar ; [her]101-birdalone loins were girt with the Black Squire 's girdle ; and on [her]101-birdalone wrist was [the Green Knight]1331-the green knight 's ancient gold ring ; and [she]101-birdalone carried in [her]101-birdalone arms [Aurea]116-viridis 's gown and [Viridis]116-viridis ' shift and [Atra]117-atra 's shoon .[101-birdalone]

Rather sunrise than sunset it seemed , as verily [Birdalone]101-birdalone [she]101-birdalone came into [the hall]1202-the hall with bright eager eyes , and flushed cheeks , and countenance smiling with love . [The men]2426-the men stood up all , and would come down from the dais to meet [her]101-birdalone ; but [she]101-birdalone bade [them]2426-the men go back , and sit each in [his]2426-the men place till [she]101-birdalone stood before [them]2426-the men .

Up [the hall]1202-the hall then [she]101-birdalone walked , and every step of [hers]101-birdalone seemed lovelier than the last , till [she]101-birdalone came to [them]2426-the men and gave unto [each]1584-each [his]2426-the men keepsake , and said : [Champions]2429-champions , now is [mine]101-birdalone errand all done , save that to- morrow [I]0-i must show [you]2429-champions the manner of [the Sending Boat]832-the sending boat . Now there is nought save the darkness of the coming night to hinder [you]2429-champions from this last deal of [your]2429-champions Quest ; and it is [I]0-i that have brought [you]2429-champions to this , and have done this good unto [you]2429-champions , if no more good [I]0-i do in [the world]430-the world . Wherefore [I]0-i pray [you]2429-champions to love [me]0-i ever , and bear [me]0-i ever in [your]2429-champions minds .

[They]2426-the men gazed on [her]101-birdalone , and were overcome by [her]101-birdalone loveliness and grace , and by the kindness and valiancy of [her]101-birdalone heart . Next arose [the Golden Knight]123-baudoin , [Baudoin]123-baudoin to wit , and took a cross from [his]123-baudoin breast , and held it up , and spake : [Maiden]139-maiden , [thou]139-maiden sayest well , and never shall [we]2432-we forget [thee]139-maiden , or cease to love [thee]139-maiden ; and here [I]0-i swear by [God]120-god upon the Tree , that it shall be a light thing for [me]0-i to die for [thee]139-maiden , if in any need [I]0-i find [thee]139-maiden . [Brethren]2433-brethren , will [ye]2433-brethren not swear the same ? And this is but [thy]139-maiden due , [maiden]1117-maiden , for [I]0-i declare unto [thee]139-maiden , that when [thou]139-maiden didst enter [the hall e'en]2435-the hall e'en now , it was as if the very sun of heaven was coming in unto [us]2432-we .
