Thereon [the other two]2291-the other two took the Rood and swore upon it : and [Hugh]124-hugh was hushed and meek and sad - faced after [he]124-hugh had sworn ; but [Arthur the Black Squire]125-arthur bowed down [his]125-arthur head and wept , and [[his]125-arthur fellows]2437-his fellows marvelled nought thereat , neither did [Birdalone]101-birdalone ; and all [her]101-birdalone body yearned toward [him]125-arthur to solace [him]125-arthur .

Now turned [Sir Baudoin]123-baudoin to [the castellan]2000-the castellan and said : [Sir Aymeris]138-sir aymeris , [I]0-i will now swear [thee]138-sir aymeris to guard [this lady]2439-this lady as the apple of thine eye whiles [we]2432-we three be away , and therein to spare neither [thyself]2440-thyself nor [others]2441-others . For [thou]2442-thou seest well what grief it would be to [us]2432-we if [she]2439-this lady came to any harm .

And to [me]0-i also , said [the castellan]2000-the castellan . And therewith [he]2000-the castellan swore upon [the Rood]140-the rood , and then came round the table , and knelt before [Birdalone]101-birdalone , and kissed [her]101-birdalone hands .

Thereafter were [they]2432-we all silent a space ; and then came [Birdalone]101-birdalone to the inner side of the table and sat betwixt [Baudoin]123-baudoin and [Hugh]124-hugh . But [the Black Squire]125-arthur took up the word and spake : [Birdalone]101-birdalone , [sweet child]910-sweet child , one thing is to be said , to wit , that it were well that [thou]2442-thou keep within walls while [we]2432-we be away ; or at least that [thou]2442-thou go but a little beyond [the castle]1838-the castle , and never but within a half bowshot , save [thou]2442-thou be well accompanied . For there be [men of violence dwelling no great way off]2446-men of violence dwelling no great way off , [reivers and rovers]2447-reivers and rovers , who would be well pleased to take from [us]2432-we anything which [we]2432-we deem dear ; besides [others who would think the lifting of such a jewel good hap]2448-others who would think the lifting of such a jewel good hap indeed . [Sir Aymeris]138-sir aymeris , have a care of [the Red Knight]141-the red knight ; and if [thou]2442-thou mightest come by [a few more stout lads]2449-a few more stout lads , to wage [them]2449-a few more stout lads , it were well .

[Birdalone]101-birdalone heeded not what [the castellan]2000-the castellan answered , such a shaft of joy went to [her]101-birdalone heart when [she]101-birdalone heard [that friend]2451-that friend speak [her]101-birdalone own name in such wise as [he]2451-that friend had never done erst , and that before [them]2452-them all . [She]101-birdalone but murmured some yeasay to that which [Arthur]125-arthur had spoken unto [her]101-birdalone , and then [she]101-birdalone held [her]101-birdalone peace for the sweetness of that moment .

So there [they]2452-them sat and talked a while in dear and pleasant converse ; and [Hugh]124-hugh fell to asking [her]101-birdalone of [her]101-birdalone life in [the House under [the Wood]348-the wood]2453-the house under the wood , and [she]101-birdalone answered all frankly and simply , and the more [she]101-birdalone told [the dearer]2455-the dearer [she]101-birdalone seemed to [them]2452-them .

Thus drew night in , till [folk]1529-folk came flockmeal into [the hall]1202-the hall ; for needs must be feast and banquet for triumph of the furtherance of the Quest ; and [the most of [men]219-men]2458-the most of men were merry ; but somewhat sober were all [the three Champions]2360-the three champions , so that whoso ran might read it in [their]2452-them faces . As for [Birdalone]101-birdalone , [she]101-birdalone showed cheerful to all that folk which loved [her]101-birdalone and praised [her]101-birdalone ; but inwardly sorrow had come home to [her]101-birdalone heart .

CHAPTER X. [THE CHAMPIONS]2382-the champions GO [THEIR]2382-the champions WAYS IN THE SENDING BOAT

When the sun was arisen on the morrow [the three Champions]2360-the three champions went down to [the landing - place]1948-the landing - place , and there was none with [them]2360-the three champions ; for [they]2360-the three champions had given command that [no man]545-no man should pry into [their]2360-the three champions doings . [Thither]142-thither to [them]2360-the three champions cometh [Birdalone]101-birdalone , clad no more in [her]101-birdalone gay attire , but in a strait black coat and with unshod feet ; and [she]101-birdalone looked no sorrier than [she]101-birdalone was .

By [Birdalone]101-birdalone 's rede [the Champions]2382-the champions bore down in [their]2382-the champions own hands the victual and weapons and armour that [they]2382-the champions needed for the voyage ; for [she]101-birdalone knew not but that [the Sending Boat]832-the sending boat might take it amiss that any should touch [her]101-birdalone save [the senders]2467-the senders . And when [they]2360-the three champions had done lading [her]101-birdalone , then [all four]2468-all four stood together by [the water]361-the water 's edge , and [Birdalone]101-birdalone spake to [[her]101-birdalone friends]1314-her friends , and again bade [them]1314-her friends beware of the wiles of [the Isle of Nothing]2471-the isle of nothing ; and again [she]101-birdalone told [them]1314-her friends of the woful images of [the Isle of Kings]2472-the isle of kings and [the Isle of Queens]2473-the isle of queens , and [the strange folk of [the Isle of [the Young and the Old]2476-the young and the old]2475-the isle of the young and the old]2474-the strange folk of the isle of the young and the old . Then [she]101-birdalone said : Now when [ye]2477-ye come to [the Isle of Increase Unsought]22-the isle of increase unsought , what think [ye]2477-ye to do ? Said [the Green Knight]1331-the green knight : If [I]0-i might rule , [we]2479-we should go straight up to [the witch sitting in [[her]2480-the witch sitting in her hall hall]2481-her hall]2480-the witch sitting in her hall , as [thou]2482-ye toldest [us]2479-we , [[my]0-i dear]2256-my dear , and then and there smite the head from off [her]2480-the witch sitting in her hall . [His]1331-the green knight eyes flashed and [his]1331-the green knight brow knitted , and so fierce [he]1331-the green knight looked that [Birdalone]101-birdalone shrank back from [him]1331-the green knight ; but [the Black Squire]1334-the black squire smiled and said : It may come to the smiting off of heads in the end ; yet must [we]2479-we so fashion [our]2479-we carving , that it avail [us]2479-we for the freeing of [[our]2479-we friends]2302-our friends ; else may [the witch]407-the witch die , and the secret of [the prison - house]2487-the prison - house die with [her]407-the witch . How sayest [thou]2482-ye , dear [Birdalone]101-birdalone ?

[She]101-birdalone reddened at the caress of [his]1331-the green knight voice , and answered : By [my]0-i rede [ye]2482-ye shall seek and find [[your]2482-ye speech - friends]2296-your speech - friends ere [ye]2482-ye make open war upon [the witch]407-the witch ; else may [her]407-the witch malice destroy [them]2296-your speech - friends ere [ye]2482-ye undo [her]407-the witch . [Her]101-birdalone face flushed yet more as [she]101-birdalone spake again : But concerning all things , [I]0-i deem that [Atra]117-atra may give [you]2482-ye the best rede , when [ye]2482-ye have met [the loves]2490-the loves ; for that [she]117-atra knoweth more of [the isle]642-the isle and its guiles than the others .

[Quoth Baudoin]143-baudoin : Herein is wisdom , [sweet maiden]2492-sweet maiden , for as guileless as [thou]2493-thou mayst be ; and so far as [we]2494-we may [we]2494-we shall follow [thy]2493-thou rede ; but all lieth in the fathom of the coming time . And now this moment is the moment of sundering and farewell .

Came [he]2495-he then to [Birdalone]101-birdalone and took [his]2495-he two hands about [her]101-birdalone head , and lifted [her]101-birdalone face unto [him]2495-he , and kissed it kindly , as [a father]916-a father might kiss [a daughter]2497-a daughter , and said : Farewell , [dear child]1676-dear child , and take heed to the word that [Arthur]125-arthur spake yesterday , and go not from [the castle]1838-the castle even a little way save with good and sure company .

Then came [Hugh]124-hugh to [her]101-birdalone , and took [her]101-birdalone hand somewhat timidly ; but [she]101-birdalone put up [her]101-birdalone face to [him]2495-he in simple wise , and [he]2495-he kissed either cheek of [her]101-birdalone , and said no more than : Farewell , [Birdalone]101-birdalone !

Lastly came [Arthur]125-arthur , and stood before [her]101-birdalone a little ; and then [he]125-arthur knelt down on the stones before [her]101-birdalone and kissed [her]101-birdalone feet many times , and [she]101-birdalone shuddered and caught [her]101-birdalone breath as [they]2500-they felt [his]125-arthur kisses ; but neither [he]125-arthur nor [she]101-birdalone spake a word , and [he]125-arthur stood up and turned away at once toward [the Sending Boat]832-the sending boat , and boarded [her]101-birdalone first of the three ; and [the others]1301-the others followed straightway .

Thereafter [the Champions]2382-the champions bared each an arm , and let blood flow thence into a bowl , and reddened stem and stern of [[their]2382-the champions barge]2504-their barge , and then [all three]1245-all three spake the spell together thus , as [Birdalone]101-birdalone had taught [them]2382-the champions :

The red raven - wine now Hast [thou]2506-thou drunk , stern and bow : Wake then , and awake , And the northern way take ! The way of the Wenders forth over the flood , For the will of [the Senders]2467-the senders is blent with the blood .

Went all as before thereafter , that the Sending Boat stirred under [them]2382-the champions , and then turned about and pointed [her]101-birdalone bows to the northward , and sped swiftly over [the waters]636-the waters . It was a fair sunny day , with no cloud , nought save the summer haze lying on [the lake]369-the lake far away . [Birdalone]101-birdalone stood watching the speeding of [the boat]859-the boat , till [she]101-birdalone could see it no longer , not even as a fleck on the face of [the waters]636-the waters . Then [she]101-birdalone turned away and went toward [[her]101-birdalone chamber]2512-her chamber , saying to [herself]101-birdalone that the sundering was easier to bear than [she]101-birdalone had deemed it would be , and that [she]101-birdalone had a many things to do that day . But when [she]101-birdalone came into [[her]101-birdalone chamber]2512-her chamber , and shut the door , [she]101-birdalone looked about [her]101-birdalone on the things which had grown so familiar to [her]101-birdalone in these few latter days , and [she]101-birdalone stood watching the bright sunshine that streamed across the floor and lay warm upon [her]101-birdalone feet ; then [she]101-birdalone took three steps toward the window , and saw [the lake]369-the lake lying all a - glitter under the sun , and [her]101-birdalone heart failed [her]101-birdalone withal , and [she]101-birdalone had no might so much as to think about [her]101-birdalone sorrow and caress it , but fell down where [she]101-birdalone was swooning on to the floor , and lay there , while all [the house]325-the house began to stir about [her]101-birdalone .

Here ends the Third Part of [the Water of [the Wondrous Isles]1-the wondrous isles]1065-the water of the wondrous isles , which is called Of [the Castle of the Quest]1931-the castle of the quest , and begins the fourth Part of the said tale , which is called Of [the Days of Abiding]38-the days of abiding .

THE FOURTH PART : OF THE DAYS OF ABIDING

CHAPTER I. OF [BIRDALONE]101-birdalone 'S GRIEF ; AND OF LEONARD THE CHAPLAIN[101-birdalone]

Now came [Birdalone]101-birdalone to [herself]101-birdalone , and that was but little joy unto [her]101-birdalone , and [she]101-birdalone yet lay still on the floor for a while , for [she]101-birdalone loathed the hour that was to come . Then the life stirred in [her]101-birdalone , and whereas [she]101-birdalone would not that [[her]101-birdalone women]2518-her women should find [her]101-birdalone there , [she]101-birdalone stood up , and clad [herself]101-birdalone somewhat more seemly ; yet [she]101-birdalone did on [her]101-birdalone black raiment ; and determined in [her]101-birdalone mind that nought would [she]101-birdalone wear save black unadorned while [[her]101-birdalone friends]1314-her friends were away .

[She]101-birdalone betook [her]101-birdalone now to [the chamber where [[her]101-birdalone women]2518-her women were gathered together]2520-the chamber where her women were gathered together , and watched [them]2518-her women working a while , but spake nought . Then [she]101-birdalone went [her]101-birdalone ways into the pleasance , and paced [the plashed alley]2201-the plashed alley up and down , letting the tears run down from [her]101-birdalone as they would . Then [she]101-birdalone turned back into [the castle]1838-the castle , and went out - a - gates and walked over [the meadow]510-the meadow a little , and might well have gone further than wisdom would . But [the castellan]2000-the castellan espied [her]101-birdalone from a window , and came hurrying out after [her]101-birdalone , and with many prayers for pardon , brought [her]101-birdalone back again , babbling to [her]101-birdalone by the way ; but not a word might [he]2000-the castellan get from [her]101-birdalone ; and when [he]2000-the castellan came into [the hall]1202-the hall with [her]101-birdalone , and , after [his]2000-the castellan wo nt , knelt down to kiss [her]101-birdalone hands , [she]101-birdalone caught them away from [him]2000-the castellan peevishly , and was sorry for it thereafter .

Long [she]101-birdalone sat in [the hall]1202-the hall , scarce moving , till [she]101-birdalone heard [one entering from the screen]2528-one entering from the screen , and lo it was [Leonard]137-leonard [the chaplain]2413-the chaplain . [He]2000-the castellan came [her]101-birdalone way , and showed [her]101-birdalone rueful countenance ; and pity of [him]2000-the castellan smote [her]101-birdalone , and [she]101-birdalone remembered therewith how [they]2530-they first went out of [gates]2531-gates together ; and at the thought thereof [her]101-birdalone tears brake forth again , but [she]101-birdalone made [him]2000-the castellan a sign with [her]101-birdalone hand to sit down beside [her]101-birdalone , and [he]2000-the castellan did so ; and when [she]101-birdalone might for [her]101-birdalone weeping , [she]101-birdalone looked kindly on [him]2000-the castellan , and [he]2000-the castellan fell to talk , making as if [he]2000-the castellan noted not [her]101-birdalone tears and sorrow ; but [she]101-birdalone answered [him]2000-the castellan little , for [she]101-birdalone had shame to begin the talk concerning [the Champions]2382-the champions and [their]2382-the champions Quest , and [their]2382-the champions departure ; yet might [she]101-birdalone not bring [her]101-birdalone tongue to make any speech else . But presently [he]2000-the castellan took up the word , and asked [her]101-birdalone how long a while [she]101-birdalone deemed [they]2533-they would be away , and [she]101-birdalone answered , smiling on [him]2000-the castellan for thanks , and having reckoned the days on [her]101-birdalone fingers : If all go better than well , [they]2533-they may be back in ten days ' time . Said [the chaplain]2413-the chaplain : There be longer whiles of waiting in [most men]7094-most men 's lives . [Yea]7095-yea , [she]101-birdalone said , but this is the delay at the best ; it may be far longer ; for how may [we]2534-we tell what haps may be ?[137-leonard]

Yea , said [Leonard]137-leonard , shall [we]2534-we then call it twenty days , or thirty ? Forsooth , that may be long for [thee]2535-thee ; though there be [some who must needs endure hope]2536-some who must needs endure hope deferred a deal longer . But it may run out longer than even thirty days , [thy]2535-thee waiting - tide .

[She]101-birdalone answered not , and [he]2000-the castellan said : Whenso the time hangs heavy on hand with [thee]2535-thee , if [thou]2535-thee hast will to fare abroad out of [the castle]1838-the castle , [I]0-i shall be ever at hand to guide [thee]2535-thee . Indeed , [I]0-i wot that [the castellan]2000-the castellan will be loth to let [thee]2535-thee go ; but [he]2000-the castellan is old and straitlaced : and yet withal [he]2000-the castellan wotteth , as do [we]2534-we all , that there is now little peril or none were [we]2534-we to fare a five miles or more , whereas [we]2534-we are as good as at peace for the last five days with all save [the Red Knight]2539-the red knight , and of [him]2000-the castellan [we]2534-we wot that [he]2000-the castellan is gone into another land with as many of [[his]2000-the castellan folk]1337-his folk as be not needed for the warding of [his]2000-the castellan hold .

[I]0-i thank [thee]2535-thee , said [Birdalone]101-birdalone , but it is like to be [my]0-i will not to fare out - a - gates till [the Champions]2382-the champions come back [home]387-home . [I]0-i was glad e'en now when [the castellan]2000-the castellan fetched [me]0-i in again : to say sooth , fear of peril had just entered [my]0-i heart when [he]2000-the castellan came up with [me]0-i .

[The priest]1984-the priest seemed somewhat chapfallen at [her]101-birdalone answer . [He]1984-the priest spake little more , and presently [he]1984-the priest stood up , made [his]1984-the priest obeisance , and departed .

CHAPTER II . [BIRDALONE]101-birdalone LEARNETH LORE OF [THE PRIEST]1984-the priest . TEN DAYS OF WAITING WEAR

Wore that day and the next , and [Birdalone]101-birdalone fell to talking with [[her]101-birdalone women]2518-her women , whereof were five now left ; and [four of [them]2518-her women]2547-four of them were young , [the eldest scarce of thirty summers]2548-the eldest scarce of thirty summers , and [the fifth]2549-the fifth was [a woman of sixty , both wise and kind]2550-a woman of sixty , both wise and kind . All these told [her]101-birdalone somewhat of [their]2518-her women own lives when [she]101-birdalone asked [them]2518-her women ; and [some withal]2551-some withal told of [folk whom [they]2518-her women had known or heard tell of]2552-folk whom they had known or heard tell of . And well pleased was [Birdalone]101-birdalone to hear [thereof]2553-thereof , and learn more of the ways of [the world]430-the world , and quick - witted [she]101-birdalone was at the lesson , so that [she]101-birdalone needed not to ask many questions .

Furthermore , [she]101-birdalone took to [her]101-birdalone broidering again , and fell to doing a goodly pair of shoon for [Atra]117-atra , since [she]101-birdalone had worn those borrowed ones somewhat hardly . And [the women]2418-the women wondered at [her]101-birdalone needlework , so marvellous fine as it was , and how that in little space of time were come flowers and trees , and birds and beasts , all lovely ; and [they]2418-the women said that [the faery]7087-the faery must have learned [her]101-birdalone that craft . But [she]101-birdalone laughed and reddened , and thought of [the wood - mother]934-the wood - mother ; and , sitting there within the four walls , [she]101-birdalone longed for the oak - glades , and the wood - lawns , and for the sight of the beasts that dwelt therein .

Again [she]101-birdalone fell in with [Leonard]137-leonard [the priest]1984-the priest , and [he]137-leonard asked [her]101-birdalone could [she]101-birdalone read in a book , and when [she]101-birdalone said nay , [he]137-leonard offered to teach [her]101-birdalone that lore , and [she]101-birdalone yeasaid that joyously ; and thenceforth would [she]101-birdalone have [him]137-leonard with [her]101-birdalone every day a good while ; and [an apt scholar]2559-an apt scholar [she]101-birdalone was , and [he]137-leonard [no ill master]2560-no ill master , and [she]101-birdalone learned [her]101-birdalone A B C speedily .

Now it was the ninth day since [the Champions]2382-the champions were gone , and all that time [she]101-birdalone had not been out - a - gates ; and after the first two days , had enforced [herself]101-birdalone to fill up [her]101-birdalone time with [her]101-birdalone work as aforesaid : but this last day [she]101-birdalone might do but little , for [she]101-birdalone could not but take it for sure that the morrow would be the day of return ; nay , even [she]101-birdalone deemed that they might come in the night - tide ; so that when [she]101-birdalone went to bed , though [she]101-birdalone was weary , [she]101-birdalone would wake if [she]101-birdalone might , so that it was nigh dawn ere [she]101-birdalone fell asleep .

Some three hours after [she]101-birdalone woke up , and heard a sound of [folk]1529-folk stirring in [the house]325-the house , and the clashing of weapons ; and the heart leapt in [her]101-birdalone , and [she]101-birdalone said : [They]2564-they are come , [they]2564-they are come ! Nevertheless [she]101-birdalone durst not get out of bed , lest [her]101-birdalone hope had beguiled [her]101-birdalone ; and [she]101-birdalone lay awake another hour , and no tidings came to [her]101-birdalone ; and then [she]101-birdalone wept [herself]101-birdalone to sleep ; and when [she]101-birdalone awoke once more , [she]101-birdalone found that [she]101-birdalone must have wept sleeping , for the pillow beside [her]101-birdalone face was all wet with the tears .

The sun was high now , and [his]2565-his beams were cast back from the ripple of [the lake]369-the lake , and shone wavering on the wall of [the chamber]306-the chamber , the window whereof gave on to [the water]361-the water . Then came a hand on the latch of the door , and [she]101-birdalone started , and [her]101-birdalone heart grieved [her]101-birdalone ; but it was one of [the women who opened , and came in]2569-the women who opened , and came in , and [Birdalone]101-birdalone rose up sitting in [her]101-birdalone bed , and said faintly , for [she]101-birdalone could scarce speak : Is any tiding toward , [Catherine]144-catherine ? [The maid]602-the maid said : Yes , [[my]0-i lady]615-my lady ; for early after sunrise came [weaponed men]2107-weaponed men to the gate , and would sell [us]2573-us beeves ; and [[my]0-i lord]2574-my lord , [Sir Aymeris]138-sir aymeris , must needs go forth and chaffer with [them]2107-weaponed men , though belike [they]2107-weaponed men had been lifting what was neither [ours]2573-us , nor [theirs]2573-us , nor [the neighbours]2575-the neighbours ' . Maybe [Sir Aymeris]138-sir aymeris looked to buy tidings from [them]2107-weaponed men as well as [beef]7096-beef . Anyhow [they]2107-weaponed men departed when [they]2107-weaponed men had gotten [their]2107-weaponed men money and drunk a cup . And now it is said that [the Red Knight]2539-the red knight hath been hurt in some fray , and keepeth [his]2539-the red knight bed ; wherefore [the land]213-the land shall have peace of [him]2539-the red knight awhile . Said [Birdalone]101-birdalone : [I]252-the woman thank [thee]252-the woman , good [Catherine]144-catherine ; [I]252-the woman shall lie a little longer ; depart now .[252-the woman]

[The woman]252-the woman went [her]252-the woman ways ; and when [she]252-the woman was gone , [Birdalone]101-birdalone wept and sobbed , and writhed upon [her]101-birdalone bed , and found no solace to [her]101-birdalone grief . But [she]101-birdalone arose and paced [the chamber]306-the chamber , and sithence looked out of the window over the empty water , and wept again . Then [she]101-birdalone said : Yet [they]2578-they may come ere noon , or it may be ere evening , or perchance to- morrow morning . And [she]101-birdalone stayed [her]101-birdalone weeping , and was calmer . But still [she]101-birdalone walked the floor , and whiles looked out of window , and whiles [she]101-birdalone looked on [her]101-birdalone limbs , and felt the sleekness of [her]101-birdalone sides , and [she]101-birdalone said : O [my]0-i body ! how [thou]2579-thou longest !

But at last [she]101-birdalone clad [herself]101-birdalone in haste , and went stealthily from [the chamber]306-the chamber , as if [she]101-birdalone feared to meet [anyone]2581-anyone ; and [she]101-birdalone stole up to the tower - top that was nighest , and looked through the door on to the leads , and saw [no one there]2582-no one there ; so [she]101-birdalone went out , and stood by the battlement , and gazed long over [the water]361-the water , but saw [neither boat]2584-neither boat nor burning mountain coming towards [her]101-birdalone .

CHAPTER III . NOW WOULD [BIRDALONE]101-birdalone RIDE ABROAD

After a while [she]101-birdalone came down again , and went to [the women]2418-the women , and sat working with [them]2418-the women a while , and so wore away two hours . Then [she]101-birdalone sent for [the priest]1984-the priest and had [her]101-birdalone lesson of [him]1984-the priest ; and when [she]101-birdalone had been at it another two hours , [she]101-birdalone bade [him]1984-the priest begin and learn [her]101-birdalone writing ; and nought loth [he]1984-the priest was thereto ; forsooth [he]1984-the priest had been longing to pray [her]101-birdalone to suffer [him]1984-the priest learn [her]101-birdalone , but durst not . For in such teaching needs must [he]1984-the priest sit full nigh to [her]101-birdalone , and watch [her]101-birdalone hands , and [her]101-birdalone fingers striving to shape the letters ; nay , whiles must [he]1984-the priest touch [her]101-birdalone hand with [his]1984-the priest , and hold it . Wherefore now [he]1984-the priest promised [himself]1984-the priest a taste of Paradise . Withal [he]1984-the priest was full meet to learn [her]101-birdalone , whereas [he]1984-the priest was [one of the best of [scribes]2588-scribes]2587-one of the best of scribes , and [a fair - writer full handy]2589-a fair - writer full handy .

So [they]2590-they fell to the lesson , and [she]101-birdalone became eager thereover , and learned fast , and clave to the work , while [his]1984-the priest soul was tormented with longing for [her]101-birdalone . And thus wore a three hours , and then suddenly [she]101-birdalone looked up wearily from [her]101-birdalone work , and [her]101-birdalone trouble was awake , and the longing for [[her]101-birdalone speech - friend]2591-her speech - friend , and [she]101-birdalone gave [the priest]1984-the priest leave for that day , but suffered [him]1984-the priest to kiss [her]101-birdalone hand for wages .

Then [she]101-birdalone hurried up to [the tower - top]2593-the tower - top , when the afternoon was wearing into evening ; and abode there a long while looking over [the waters]636-the waters , till it began to dusk , and then came down miserably and went to [[her]101-birdalone women]2518-her women .

The next day was like unto this ; nought betid , and [she]101-birdalone wore the hours whiles going up to [the tower - top]2593-the tower - top and looking over [the lake]369-the lake , whiles broidering amidst [[her]101-birdalone maids]2598-her maids , whiles learning [[her]101-birdalone clerk]2599-her clerk 's work with [Sir Leonard]145-birdalone , but ever eating [her]101-birdalone heart out with [her]101-birdalone longing .

On the third of these days [she]101-birdalone called [the castellan]2000-the castellan to [her]101-birdalone for a talk , and asked [him]2000-the castellan what [he]2000-the castellan thought of it , this delay of [[his]2000-the castellan lords]2601-his lords ' return . Quoth [the greyhead]7099-the greyhead : [[My]2000-the castellan lady]615-my lady , [we]7101-we may not wonder if [they]2601-his lords be tarried for a few days ; for this is an adventure on which [they]2601-his lords have gone , and many haps betide in such tales . Now [I]2000-the castellan beseech [thee]615-my lady torment not [thyself]7102-thyself ; for the time is not yet come for [thee]615-my lady even to doubt that [they]2601-his lords have miscarried .[2000-the castellan]

[His]2000-the castellan words solaced [her]101-birdalone much for that time , whereas [she]101-birdalone saw that [he]2000-the castellan spake but the sooth ; so [she]101-birdalone thanked [him]2000-the castellan , and smiled upon [him]2000-the castellan kindly ; and [he]2000-the castellan was ravished thereat , and was for kneeling before [her]101-birdalone at once and kissing [her]101-birdalone hands after [his]2000-the castellan wo nt ; but [she]101-birdalone smiled again and refrained [him]2000-the castellan , and said : Nay , not yet , [fair friend]546-fair friend ; that is for the departure , and [I]0-i have yet a word to say unto [thee]546-fair friend : to wit , that [I]0-i long to go out - a - gates , and it will solace [me]0-i and give [me]0-i patience to abide the coming of [[my]0-i friends]2100-my friends . For [thou]2604-thou must know , [Sir Aymeris]138-sir aymeris , that [I]0-i was reared amidst [the woods]463-the woods and [the meadows]2079-the meadows , with the burning of the sun , and the buffets of the wind ; and now for lack of some deal of that am [I]0-i waxing white and faint . And [thou]2604-thou wouldst not have [me]0-i falling sick on thine hands now , wouldst [thou]2604-thou ?

Nay , surely , [lady]504-lady , said [Sir Aymeris]138-sir aymeris ; this very day [I]0-i will ride out with [thee]504-lady ; and [two score or more of weaponed men]2608-two score or more of weaponed men shall ride with [us]2609-us for fear of mishaps . Said [Birdalone]145-birdalone , knitting [her]504-lady brows : Nay , [knight]2610-knight , [I]0-i need not [[thy]2610-knight men - at - arms]2611-thy men - at - arms ; [I]0-i would fain go free and alone . For hast [thou]2604-thou not heard how that [the Red Knight]2539-the red knight is hurt and keepeth [his]2539-the red knight bed ? So what peril is there ? Said [Sir Aymeris]138-sir aymeris : [Yea]2613-yea , [lady]504-lady ; but [the Red Knight]2539-the red knight is not the only foe , though [he]2539-the red knight be the worst : but it may well be that the story is but feigned , for [the said enemy]2616-the said enemy hath many wiles . And look [you]504-lady , [kind lady]2617-kind lady , it is most like that by now [he]2539-the red knight hath heard how in [[my]0-i poor castle]2618-my poor castle is kept a jewel , a pearl of great price , that hath not its like in [the world]430-the world , and will encompass the stealing of it if [he]2539-the red knight may .

Laughed [Birdalone]145-birdalone , and said : But how if the said jewel hath a will , and legs and feet thereto , and is ready to take the peril on [her]504-lady , and will wend out - a - gates if [she]504-lady will ? What wilt [thou]2604-thou do then , [lord]2620-lord ? Then , said [the castellan]2000-the castellan , [I]0-i shall fetch [thee]2604-thou back , and , though it be a grief to [me]0-i , shall have [thee]2604-thou borne back perforce if nought else may do . For so the oath sworn to [[my]0-i lords]2037-my lords compelleth [me]0-i .

Again laughed [Birdalone]145-birdalone , and said : Hearken , whereto cometh all this kneeling and hand - kissing ! But bear in mind , [fair lord]2623-fair lord , how once on a time [thou]2604-thou wouldst have [me]0-i out - a - gates , would [I]0-i , would [I]0-i not , and now , will [I]0-i , will [I]0-i not , [thou]2604-thou wouldst keep [me]0-i within ; so have times changed , and mayhappen [they]2624-they may change yet again . But tell [me]0-i , am [I]0-i mistress over [[my]0-i women]2625-my women to bid [them]2625-my women what [I]0-i will ? [Certes]146-certes , said [he]2626-he , and over [all of [us]2627-all of us]2627-all of us . Said [she]2628-thee : If then [I]0-i bade [them]2625-my women , some two or three , come with [me]0-i into [the meadows]2079-the meadows and woods a half day 's journey for [our]2627-all of us disport , how then ? For that once , said [Sir Aymeris]138-sir aymeris , [I]0-i should bid [them]2625-my women disobey [[their]2625-my women lady]1592-their lady . Said [Birdalone]145-birdalone : And how if [they]2625-my women disobeyed [thee]2628-thee , and obeyed [me]0-i ? [Quoth Sir Aymeris]138-sir aymeris : If [they]2625-my women bring [thee]2628-thee back safe , [they]2625-my women may chance to sing to the twiggen fiddle - bow , that [they]2625-my women may be warned from such folly ; but if [they]2625-my women come back without [thee]2628-thee , by All - hallows the wind of wrath shall sweep [their]2625-my women heads off [them]2625-my women !

[Birdalone]145-birdalone flushed red at [his]145-birdalone word , and was silent a while ; then [she]2631-she said , making cheerful countenance again : [Thou]2628-thee art [a hard master]2632-a hard master , [lord castellan]2633-lord castellan ; but [I]0-i must needs obey [thee]2628-thee . Therefore [I]0-i will take [thy]2628-thee bidding , and ride abroad in such wise that [I]0-i shall scare [the land]213-the land with [an army]2635-an army , since [no otherwise]2636-no otherwise may [I]0-i look on [the summer land]2637-the summer land . But to - day [I]0-i will not go , nor to - morrow belike ; but some day soon . And in good sooth [I]0-i thank [thee]2628-thee for [thy]2628-thee heedful care of [me]0-i , and wish [I]0-i were better worth it . Nay , nay , [thou]2628-thee shalt not kneel to [me]0-i , but [I]0-i to [thee]2628-thee : for [thou]2628-thee art verily [the master]2638-the master .

Therewith [she]0-i rose from beside [him]2638-the master , and knelt down before [him]2638-the master and took [his]2638-the master hand and kissed it , and went [her]0-i ways , leaving [him]2638-the master ravished with love of [her]0-i . But now [she]0-i had no scorn of [him]2638-the master , but deemed , as was true , that [he]2638-the master was both valiant and trusty and kind , and [she]0-i thanked [him]2638-the master in [her]0-i heart as well as in words .

CHAPTER IV . OF [BIRDALONE]145-birdalone 'S FARING ABROAD[145-birdalone]

Indeed [Birdalone]145-birdalone longed on any terms to be out - a - gates and to have some joy of the summer ; for now [she]0-i began to see that [she]0-i might have to abide some while ere [[her]0-i friends]1314-her friends should come to [her]0-i in [the Castle of the Quest]1931-the castle of the quest ; and [she]0-i was angry with [herself]0-i that [her]0-i longing was thus wasting [her]0-i , and [she]0-i rebuked [herself]0-i and said : Where is now [that Birdalone who let but few days go by without some joyance of [the earth]445-the earth and its creatures]2641-that birdalone who let but few days go by without some joyance of the earth and its creatures ? [she]2641-that birdalone who let but few days go by without some joyance of the earth and its creatures who bore [lightly the toil of a thrall , and gibes and mocking and stripes]2643-lightly the toil of a thrall , and gibes and mocking and stripes ? Surely this is grievous folly , that [I]0-i should be worsened since [I]0-i have come to be [the friend of [gentle ladies]2645-gentle ladies]2644-the friend of gentle ladies , and [noble champions]2646-noble champions , and [mighty warriors]2647-mighty warriors . Had it not been better to have abided under [the witch - wife]349-the witch - wife 's hand ? For not every day nor most days did [she]349-the witch - wife torment [me]0-i . But now for many days there has been pain and grief and heart - sickness hour by hour ; and every hour have [I]0-i dreaded the coming of the next hour , till [I]0-i know not how to bear it .

So [she]0-i strove with [herself]0-i , and became of better heart , and set [herself]0-i strongly to the learning of the clerkly lore ; [she]0-i gathered [her]0-i wits together , and no longer looked for every day and every hour to bring about the return of [the Champions]2382-the champions , nor blamed the day and the hour because [they]2650-they failed therein , and in all wise [she]0-i strove to get through the day unworn by vain longing .

Wherefore , on a day when three whole weeks were gone since the day of departure , [she]0-i was glad when [the castellan]2000-the castellan came to [her]0-i and said : [Lady]504-lady , these two days [I]0-i have had [men]219-men out to spy [the land]213-the land , and [their]219-men word goes that nought is stirring which a score of [us]2655-they well - armed might have cause to fear ; wherefore to - morrow , if it be [thy]2656-thy will , [we]2655-they shall bring [thee]2656-thy out - a - gates , and so please [thee]2656-thy , shall be in no haste to come back , but may lie out in [the wildwood]523-the wildwood one night , and come back at [our]2655-they leisure on the morrow of to - morrow . How sayest [thou]2656-thy of [thy]2656-thy pleasure herein ?

[She]0-i thanked [him]2000-the castellan , and yeasaid it eagerly , and next morning [they]2655-they set forth ; and [Birdalone]145-birdalone had with [[her]0-i three of [the women]2418-the women]2658-her three of the women , and [they]2655-they had sumpter - beasts with [them]2655-they , and tents for [Birdalone]145-birdalone and [[her]0-i maids]2598-her maids .

So [they]2655-they rode by pleasant ways and fair meadows , and the weather was good , for it was now the first days of July , and all was as lovely as might be ; and for that while [Birdalone]145-birdalone cast off all [her]0-i cares , and was merry , and of many words and sweet ; and [all the folk]2661-all the folk rejoiced thereat , for [all]889-all loved [her]0-i in [the Castle of [the Quest]31-the quest]1931-the castle of the quest , besides those one or two that loved [her]0-i overmuch .

Rode [they]2655-they thus a twelve miles or more , and then [they]2655-they came , as [their]2655-they purpose was , to the beginning of [a woodland plenteous of venison]2664-a woodland plenteous of venison , and [they]2655-they hunted here , and [Birdalone]145-birdalone took [her]0-i part therein , and [all]889-all praised [her]0-i woodcraft ; albeit because of [her]0-i went a head or two free that had fallen else , whereas of [the carle hunters]2666-the carle hunters were [some who deemed the body of [her]0-i better worth looking on than [the quarry]2668-the quarry]2667-some who deemed the body of her better worth looking on than the quarry .

Howsoever , [they]2655-they slew of hind and roe and other wood - cattle what [they]2655-they would , some deal for [their]2655-they supper in [the wilderness]2669-the wilderness , some to bear [home]387-home to [the castle]1838-the castle . But when night was nigh at hand [they]2655-they made stay in [a fair wood - lawn]2672-a fair wood - lawn about which ran a clear stream , whereby [they]2655-they pitched [[the ladies]2309-the ladies ' tent]7103-the ladies ' tent ; and [Birdalone]145-birdalone and [hers]145-birdalone went down into [the water]361-the water and washed the weariness off [them]2655-they ; and [[her]7105-her ladies]7106-her ladies wondered at the deftness of [Birdalone]145-birdalone 's swimming ; for [they]2655-they bathed in [a pool somewhat great into which [the stream]2085-the stream]7107-a pool somewhat great into which the stream widened , so that there was space enough for [her]7105-her therein .[2655-they]

By then [they]2655-they were washen and clad goodly in raiment which [they]2655-they had brought on the sumpters , [the men]2426-the men had lighted fires and were cooking the venison , and anon there was supper and banquet in the wildwood , with drinking of wine and pleasant talk and the telling of tales and singing of minstrelsy ; and so at last , when night was well worn , and out in [the open meadows]2675-the open meadows the eastern sky was waxing grey , then [Birdalone]145-birdalone and [[her]2676-her ladies]7106-her ladies went to bed in [[their]2655-they fair tents]2678-their fair tents , and [the men - at - arms]2679-the men - at - arms lay down on [the greensward under the bare heaven]2680-the greensward under the bare heaven .

CHAPTER V. [SIR AYMERIS]138-sir aymeris SHOWETH [BIRDALONE THE MOUNTAINS]147-birdalone AFAR OFF

When it was morning and [they]2655-they arose , the day was as fair as yesterday , and [folk]1529-folk were even as joyous as [they]1529-folk had been then , all but [Birdalone]147-birdalone , and [she]147-birdalone was silent and downcast , even when [she]147-birdalone came forth from the fresh water into the sweetness of [the midsummer wood]2682-the midsummer wood . [She]147-birdalone had dreamed in the night that [she]147-birdalone was all alone in [the Castle of [the Quest]31-the quest]59-the castle of the quest , and that [[her]147-birdalone old mistress]2683-her old mistress came to [her]147-birdalone from out of [the Sending]40-the sending [Boat]2684-boat to fetch [her]147-birdalone away , and brought [her]147-birdalone aboard , and stripped [her]147-birdalone of [her]147-birdalone rich garments and sat facing [her]147-birdalone , drawing ugsome grimaces at [her]147-birdalone ; and [she]147-birdalone thought [she]147-birdalone knew that [[her]147-birdalone friends]1314-her friends were all dead and gone , and [she]147-birdalone had none to pity or defend [her]147-birdalone . Then somehow were [they]2686-they two , [the witch]407-the witch and [she]147-birdalone , amidmost of [the Isle of Nothing]41-the isle of nothing , and [the witch]407-the witch drew close anigh [her]147-birdalone , and was just going to whisper into [her]147-birdalone ear something of measureless horror , when [she]147-birdalone awoke ; and the sun was bright outside the shaded whiteness of [[her]147-birdalone tent]2689-her tent ; the shadows of the leaves were dancing on the ground of it ; the morning wind was rustling the tree- boughs , and the ripple of [the stream]2085-the stream was tinkling hard by . At first was [Birdalone]147-birdalone joyous that what [she]147-birdalone had awakened from was but a dream ; but presently [she]147-birdalone felt the burden of [her]147-birdalone longing , and [she]147-birdalone said to [herself]147-birdalone that when [they]2686-they came back to [the castle]1838-the castle [they]2686-they should find tidings , and that [she]147-birdalone should know either that [[her]147-birdalone friends]1314-her friends were indeed dead , or that [they]2686-they were come back again alive and well . And then [she]147-birdalone thought within [herself]147-birdalone , suppose [the three Champions]2360-the three champions and [their]2360-the three champions loves were dead and gone , how would [she]147-birdalone do with those that were left [her]147-birdalone , as [Sir Aymeris]138-sir aymeris , and [Leonard]145-birdalone [the priest]1984-the priest , and [[her]147-birdalone women]2518-her women ? and [her]147-birdalone soul turned with loathing from a life so empty as that would be ; and yet [she]147-birdalone blamed [herself]147-birdalone that [she]147-birdalone was so little friendly to [these lesser friends]2696-these lesser friends , whom forsooth [she]147-birdalone loved because of [her]147-birdalone love for [the greater ones]2697-the greater ones . So , as abovesaid , [she]147-birdalone was troubled and silent amongst the joy of [the others]1301-the others .

That saw [Sir Aymeris]138-sir aymeris [the castellan]2000-the castellan ; and when [they]2700-we had broken fast and were getting to horse , [he]2000-the castellan came to [her]147-birdalone and said : [Lady]504-lady , the day is yet young , and if [we]2700-we fetch a compass by a way that [I]0-i wot of [we]2700-we shall see places new to [thee]147-birdalone , and mayhappen somewhat wonderful , and yet come [home]387-home timely to [the castle]1838-the castle . Wilt [thou]147-birdalone ?

[Birdalone]145-birdalone was still somewhat distraught , but [she]147-birdalone knew not how to naysay [him]2000-the castellan , though at heart [she]147-birdalone would liefer have gone back to [the castle]1838-the castle by the shortest way . [So folk]2705-so folk brought [her]147-birdalone [her]147-birdalone palfrey , and [they]2705-so folk rode [their]2705-so folk ways , [the castellan]2000-the castellan ever by [her]147-birdalone side . And by fair ways indeed [they]2705-so folk went , and so joyous was all about [them]2705-so folk , that little by little [Birdalone]145-birdalone 's gladness came back to [her]147-birdalone , and [she]147-birdalone made the most of it to be as merry of seeming as [she]147-birdalone might be .

Now [they]2705-so folk rode fair and softly by thicket and copse and glade of [the woodland]669-the woodland , following up [the stream aforesaid]2708-the stream aforesaid for the more part , till at last the trees failed [them]2705-so folk suddenly , and [they]2705-so folk came forth on to [a wide green plain]2709-a wide green plain , all unbuilded , so far as [their]2705-so folk eyes could see , and beyond it the ridges of [the hills]2710-the hills and blue mountains rising high beyond [them]2705-so folk .

When [Birdalone]145-birdalone 's eyes beheld this new thing , of a sudden all care left [her]147-birdalone , and [she]147-birdalone dropped [her]147-birdalone rein , and smote [her]147-birdalone palms together , and cried out : Oh ! but [thou]2711-thou art beautiful , [O earth]2712-o earth , [thou]2711-thou art beautiful ! Then [she]147-birdalone sat gazing on it , while [the greyhead]7099-the greyhead turned and smiled on [her]147-birdalone , well pleased of [her]147-birdalone pleasure .

After a while [she]147-birdalone said : And might [we]2705-so folk go nigher ? [Yea]2714-yea , certes , said [he]7099-the greyhead , yet [I]0-i doubt if [thou]2711-thou wilt like it the better , the nigher [thou]2711-thou art . Ah ! [she]147-birdalone said , but if [I]0-i were only amidst it , and a part of it , as once [I]0-i was of [the woodland]669-the woodland !

So thitherward [they]2705-so folk rode over the unharvested mead , and saw hart and hind thereon , and wild kine , and of smaller deer great plenty , but of tame beasts none ; and [the hills]2710-the hills were before [them]2705-so folk like a wall . But as [they]2705-so folk drew nigher , [they]2705-so folk saw where the said wall of [the hills]2710-the hills was cloven by [a valley]2718-a valley narrow and steep - sided , that went right athwart [the lie of [the hills]2710-the hills]2719-the lie of the hills ; [the said valley]2721-the said valley was but little grassed , and the bare rocks were crow - black . When [they]2705-so folk had gone a little further , [they]2705-so folk could see that the ground near [the foot of [the hills]2710-the hills]2722-the foot of the hills rose in little knolls and ridges , but these were lower and fewer about the entry into [that valley]2724-that valley . Also presently [they]2705-so folk came upon [a stream which ran out of [the said valley]2721-the said valley]2725-a stream which ran out of the said valley , and [Sir Aymeris]138-sir aymeris said that this was the water whereby [they]2705-so folk had lain last night ; albeit here it was little indeed .

Now when [they]2705-so folk had ridden some five miles over [the plain]2727-the plain , [they]2705-so folk came amongst those knolls at [the mouth of [the valley]2729-the valley]2728-the mouth of the valley , and [Sir Aymeris]138-sir aymeris led [Birdalone]145-birdalone up to the top of [one of the highest of [them]2710-the hills]2730-one of the highest of them , and thence [they]2705-so folk could look into [that dale]2731-that dale and see how [it]2731-that dale winded away up toward [the mountains]215-the mountains , like to [a dismal street]2733-a dismal street ; for not only was it but little grassed , but withal there was neither tree nor bush therein . Moreover , scattered all about [the bottom of the dale]2734-the bottom of the dale were great stones , which looked as if they had once been set in some kind of order ; and that the more whereas they were not black like the rocks of [the dale]2735-the dale - side , but pale grey of hue , so that they looked even as huge sheep of the giants feeding down [the dale]2735-the dale .

Then spake [Birdalone]145-birdalone : Verily , [sir knight]2737-sir knight , [thou]2738-thou saidst but sooth that [I]0-i should see things new and strange . But shall [we]2705-so folk go a little way into [this valley]2739-this valley to - day ? Nay , [lady]504-lady , said [Sir Aymeris]138-sir aymeris , nor to - morrow , nor any day uncompelled ; neither shall [we]2705-so folk go nigher unto it than now [we]2705-so folk be . Wherefore not ? said [Birdalone]145-birdalone , for meseemeth it is as the gate of [the mountains]215-the mountains ; and fain were [I]0-i in [the mountains]215-the mountains .

[Lady]504-lady , said [the castellan]2000-the castellan , overmuch perilous it were to ride [the valley]2729-the valley , which , as [thou]2738-thou sayest , is the very gate of [the mountains]215-the mountains . For [the said dale]2747-the said dale , which hight [the Black Valley of the Greywethers]2748-the black valley of the greywethers , hath a bad name for the haunting of unmanlike wights , against which even [[our]2705-so folk men]1381-our men - at - arms might make no defence . And if any might escape [them]2750-them , and win through the gates and up into [the mountains]215-the mountains , [I]0-i wot not if suchlike devils and things unkent be there in [the mountain - land]2752-the mountain - land , but of a sooth there be [fierce and wild men , like enough to devils , who know no peace]2753-fierce and wild men , like enough to devils , who know no peace , and slay whatsoever cometh unto [them]2750-them , but if [they]2750-them [themselves]2750-them be slain of [them]2750-them .

Well , said [Birdalone]145-birdalone , then to - day , at least , [we]2705-so folk go not into [the dale]2735-the dale ; but knowest [thou]2738-thou any tales of [these wild places]2755-these wild places ? Many have [I]0-i heard , said [he]145-birdalone , but [I]0-i am [an ill minstrel]2756-an ill minstrel and should spoil [them]2750-them in the telling . Ask [them]2750-them of [Sir Leonard]145-birdalone [[our]2705-so folk priest]2757-our priest , [he]145-birdalone knoweth of [them]2750-them better than [others]2441-others , and hath a tongue duly shapen for telling [them]2750-them .

[Birdalone]145-birdalone answered nought thereto ; [she]2759-she but turned [her]2759-she horse 's head and rode down [the knoll]2760-the knoll ; and so [they]2750-them came unto [their]2750-them company , and all went [their]2750-them ways toward [the Castle of [the Quest]31-the quest]1931-the castle of the quest .

Nought befell [them]2750-them on [their]2750-them way [home]387-home ; but the nigher [they]2750-them came to [the castle]1838-the castle [the more pensive waxed Birdalone]2764-the more pensive waxed birdalone , and , though [she]2759-she hid it , when [they]2750-them were come to the gate [she]2759-she scarce had [her]2759-she wit ; for it was as if [she]2759-she thought to have [one rushing out and crying : Tidings , tidings]2765-one rushing out and crying : tidings , tidings ! [they]2750-them are come .

Nowise it so befell ; [they]2750-them were no more come than was the Day of Doom . And a little after [they]2750-them were within gates ; it was night , and [Birdalone]145-birdalone crept wearily up to [[her]2759-she chamber]2512-her chamber , and gat to bed , and so tired was [she]2759-she that [she]2759-she fell asleep at once and dreamed not .

CHAPTER VI . [BIRDALONE]145-birdalone HEARETH TELL TALES OF THE BLACK VALLEY OF THE GREYWETHERS

On the morrow was [Birdalone]145-birdalone heavier of heart than ever yet , and wearier for tidings ; and [she]2759-she wondered how [she]2759-she could have been so joyous that day in the wildwood . Yet [she]2759-she thought much of [the Valley]2729-the valley of [the Greywethers]42-the greywethers , and that solaced [her]2759-she somewhat after a while , so sore [she]2759-she longed to go thither ; and , as ' tis said , one nail knocks out the other . So that morning , when [she]2759-she had had [her]2759-she lesson of [priest Leonard]145-birdalone , [she]2759-she spake thereof to [him]2769-he , and told [him]2769-he what [Sir Aymeris]138-sir aymeris had said concerning [his]2769-he knowledge thereof ; and [she]2759-she asked [him]2769-he what [he]2769-he knew .[2769-he]

[I]0-i have been [there]232-there , said [he]2769-he . [She]2759-she started at that word and said : Did aught of evil befall [thee]0-i ?

Nay , said [he]2769-he , but a great fear and dread hung about [me]0-i ; and ' tis said that [they]2772-those greywethers try [their]2772-those greywethers luck overmuch who go thither twice .[2769-he]

[Birdalone]145-birdalone said : Tell [me]0-i now of the tales that be told of [that valley]2724-that valley . Quoth Leonard : [They]2771-they be many ; but the main of them is this : that [those Greywethers]2772-those greywethers be [giants of yore agone]2773-giants of yore agone , or landwights , carles , and [queans , who have been turned into stone]2774-queans , who have been turned into stone by [I]0-i wot not what deed ; but that whiles [they]2772-those greywethers come alive again , and can walk and talk as erst [they]2772-those greywethers did ; and that if [any man]2089-any man may be so bold as to abide the time of [their]2772-those greywethers awakening , and in the first moment of [their]2772-those greywethers change may frame words that crave the fulfilment of [his]2769-he desire , and if therewith [he]2769-he be both wise and constant , then shall [he]2769-he have [his]2769-he desire fulfilled of [these wights]2776-these wights , and bear [his]2769-he life back again from out [the dale]2735-the dale . And thus must [he]2769-he speak and no otherwise : O Earth , [thou]2778-thou and [[thy]2778-thou first children]2779-thy first children , [I]0-i crave of [you]2779-thy first children such and such a thing , whatsoever it may be . And if [he]2769-he speak more than this , then is [he]2769-he undone . [He]2769-he shall answer no question of [them]2776-these wights ; and if [they]2776-these wights threaten [him]2769-he [he]2769-he shall not pray [them]2776-these wights mercy , nor quail before [their]2776-these wights uplifted weapons ; nor , to be short , shall [he]2769-he heed them more than if they still were stones unchanged . Moreover , when [he]2769-he hath said [his]2769-he say , then shall [these wights]2776-these wights throng about [him]2769-he and offer [him]2769-he gold and gems , and all the wealth of [the earth]445-the earth ; and if that be not enough , [they]2776-these wights shall bring [him]2769-he the goodliest of [women]433-women , with nought lacking in [her]433-women shape , but lacking all raiment , so that [he]2769-he shall see [her]433-women as [she]433-women is verily shapen . But whoso shall take any one of all these gifts is lost for ever , and shall become [one of that Stony People]2783-one of that stony people ; and whoso naysayeth [them]2776-these wights all until the cock crow , and abideth steady by [his]2769-he one craving , shall win fulfilment thereof , and , as some say , all those gifts aforesaid ; for that [the Stony People]2784-the stony people may not abide the day to take [them]2776-these wights back again .

[He]2769-he was silent therewith , and nought spake [Birdalone]145-birdalone , but looked down on the ground , and longing encompassed [her]433-women soul . Then [the priest]1984-the priest spake again : This were a fair adventure , [lady]504-lady , for [a hapless one]2787-a hapless one , but for the happy it were [a fool]493-a fool 's errand . [She]504-lady answered not , and [they]2789-they parted for that time .

But the next week , there being yet no tidings come to hand , [Birdalone]145-birdalone prayed [the castellan]2000-the castellan to take [her]504-lady out - a - gates again , that [she]504-lady might once more behold [the mountains]215-the mountains , and the gates thereof ; and [he]2000-the castellan yeasaid [her]504-lady asking , and went with [her]504-lady , well accompanied , as before ; but this time , by [Birdalone]145-birdalone 's will , [they]2789-they rode straight to [the plain aforesaid]2792-the plain aforesaid , and again [she]504-lady looked into [that dale of the Greywethers from [the knoll]2760-the knoll]2793-that dale of the greywethers from the knoll . Somewhat belated [they]2789-they were , so that [they]2789-they might not get back to [the castle]1838-the castle before dusk , wherefore again [they]2789-they lay out in [the wildwood]523-the wildwood , but there lacked somewhat of the triumph and joyance which [they]2789-they had had that other day . [They]2789-they came back to [the castle]1838-the castle on the morrow somewhat after noon , and found no news there ; nor , to say sooth , did [Birdalone]145-birdalone look for any ; and [her]504-lady heart was heavy .

CHAPTER VII . [BIRDALONE]145-birdalone BEGUILETH [THE PRIEST]1984-the priest TO HELP [HER]504-lady TO OUTGOING

Now had the time so worn that the season was in the first days of August , and weariness and heartsickness increased on [Birdalone]145-birdalone again , and [she]504-lady began to look pined and pale . Yet when [she]504-lady spake of the tarrying of the Champions both to [the castellan]2000-the castellan and [Sir Leonard]145-birdalone [the priest who was [the wiser man of the two]2801-the wiser man of the two]2800-the priest who was the wiser man of the two , [each]1584-each said the same thing , to wit , that it was no marvel if [they]2789-they were not yet come , seeing whatlike the adventure was ; and [neither of those two]2803-neither of those two seemed in anywise to have lost hope .

Thrice in these last days did [Birdalone]145-birdalone go out - a - gates with [Sir Aymeris]138-sir aymeris and [[his]138-sir aymeris company]2804-his company ; and the last of the three times the journey was to [the knoll that looked into [the Black Valley]43-the black valley]2805-the knoll that looked into the black valley ; but now was [Birdalone]145-birdalone 's pleasure of the sight of it afar off marred by [her]504-lady longing to be amidst thereof ; yet [she]504-lady did not show that [she]504-lady was irked by the refraining of [her]504-lady desire to enter therein , and [they]2789-they turned , and came [home]387-home safely to [the castle]1838-the castle .

On the morrow [she]504-lady sat with [Sir Leonard]145-birdalone [the priest]1984-the priest over the writing lesson , and [she]504-lady let it be long , and oft [he]145-birdalone touched [her]504-lady hand , so that the sweetness of unfulfilled desire went deep to [his]145-birdalone heart .

At last [Birdalone]145-birdalone looked up and said : [Friend]2809-friend , [I]0-i would ask [thee]2809-friend if [thou]2809-friend seest any peril in [my]0-i entering [the Black Valley of the Greywethers]2748-the black valley of the greywethers by daylight if [I]0-i leave [it]2748-the black valley of the greywethers by daylight ? Alone ? quoth [he]145-birdalone . [Yea]2811-yea , [she]504-lady said , alone . [He]145-birdalone pondered a little , and then said : Sooth to say [I]0-i deem the peril little in [the valley]2729-the valley itself , if [thou]2809-friend be not overcome by terror there . [Yea]2811-yea , for [my]0-i part [I]0-i am not all so sure that [thou]2809-friend shalt see the wonder of [the Stony Folk]148-the stony folk coming alive ; for ' tis not said that [they]148-the stony folk quicken save on certain nights , and chiefly on Midsummer Night ; unless it be that the trier of the adventure is some one fated above others thereto ; as forsooth [thou]2809-friend mayst be . And as for peril of [evil men]7109-evil men , there are [few who be like to be as venturesome]7110-few who be like to be as venturesome as [thou]2809-friend or [I.]0-i [They]7110-few who be like to be as venturesome durst not enter [that black street]7111-that black street , save sore need compel [them]7110-few who be like to be as venturesome . But forsooth , going thither , and coming back again , some peril there may be therein . And yet for weeks past there has been no word of any unpeace ; and the Red Knight it is said for certain is not riding .[2809-friend]

[Birdalone]145-birdalone was silent a while ; then [she]504-lady said : [Fair and kind friend]2813-fair and kind friend , [I]0-i am eating [my]0-i heart out in longing for the coming back of [[my]0-i friends]2100-my friends , and it is like , that unless [I]0-i take to some remedy , [I]0-i shall fall sick thereby , and then when [they]2100-my friends come back there shall be in [me]0-i but sorry cheer for [them]2100-my friends . Now the remedy [I]0-i know , and it is that [I]0-i betake [me]0-i alone to this adventure of [the Black Valley]43-the black valley ; for [meseemeth]2815-meseemeth that [I]0-i shall gain health and strength by [my]0-i going thither . Wherefore , to be short , if [thou]2816-thou wilt help [me]0-i , [I]0-i will go to - morrow . What sayest [thou]2816-thou , wilt [thou]2816-thou help [me]0-i ?

[He]2817-he turned very red and spake : [Lady]2818-lady , why shouldest [thou]2816-thou go , as [thy]2816-thou name is , [birdalone]145-birdalone ? [Thou]2816-thou hast called [me]0-i just now [[thy]2816-thou kind friend]2819-thy kind friend , so kind as it was of [thee]2816-thou ; now therefore why should not [[thy]2816-thou friend]2239-thy friend go with [thee]2816-thou ?

Kindly indeed [she]2818-lady smiled on [him]2817-he , but shook [her]2818-lady head : [I]0-i call [thee]2817-he trusty and dear friend again , said [she]2818-lady ; but what [I]0-i would do [I]0-i must do [myself]0-i . Moreover to what end shouldst [thou]2816-thou go ? If [I]0-i fall in with ghosts , [a score of [men]219-men]1953-a score of men would help [me]0-i nought ; and if [I]0-i happen on [weaponed men who would do [me]0-i scathe , of what avail were one man against [them]2823-weaponed men who would do me scathe , of what avail were one man against them]2823-weaponed men who would do me scathe , of what avail were one man against them ? And look [thou]2816-thou , [Sir Leonard]145-birdalone , there is this avail in thine abiding behind ; if [I]0-i come not back in two days ' space , or three at the most , [thou]2816-thou wilt wot that [I]0-i have fared amiss , and then mayst [thou]2816-thou let it be known whither [I]0-i went , and [men]219-men will seek [me]0-i and deliver [me]0-i maybe .[0-i]

Therewith [she]0-i stayed [her]0-i words suddenly , and turned very pale , and laid [her]0-i hand on [her]0-i bosom , and said faintly : But O [my]0-i heart , [my]0-i heart ! If [they]2824-they should come while [I]0-i am away ! And [she]0-i seemed like to swoon .

[Leonard]145-birdalone was afraid thereat , and knew not what to do ; but presently the colour came into [her]0-i face again , and in a little while [she]0-i smiled , and said : Seest [thou]2825-thou not , [friend]2809-friend , how weak [I]0-i am gotten to be , and that [I]0-i must now beyond doubt have the remedy ? Wilt [thou]2825-thou not help [me]0-i do it ?

[Yea]2827-yea verily , said [he]145-birdalone ; but in what wise wilt [thou]2825-thou have it ? [He]145-birdalone spake as [a man distraught and redeless]2828-a man distraught and redeless ; but [she]0-i smiled on [him]145-birdalone pleasantly , and said : Now by this time shouldst [thou]2825-thou have devised what was to do , and spared [me]0-i the pain thereof . Two things [I]0-i need of [thee]2825-thou : the first and most , to be put out of [the castle privily betimes]2829-the castle privily betimes in the morning when nought is stirring ; the second , to have [[my]0-i palfrey]2830-my palfrey awaiting [me]0-i somewhat anigh the gate , so that [I]0-i may not have to go afoot : for [I]0-i am become soft and feeble with all this house - life .

[Leonard]145-birdalone seemed to wake up with that word , and said : [I]0-i have the key of [the priest]1984-the priest 's door of [the chapel]2832-the chapel , and the postern beyond [it]2833-it ; that shall be thine out - gate , [lady]504-lady . [I]0-i will come and scratch at [[thy]504-lady chamber]312-thy chamber - door much betimes , and [I]0-i will see to it that [thy]504-lady palfrey is bestowed in the bower wherein [thou]504-lady didst rest the first night [thou]504-lady camest amongst [us]2836-us . [She]504-lady said : [I]0-i trust [thee]145-birdalone , [friend]2809-friend . And [she]504-lady thanked [him]145-birdalone sweetly , and then rose up and fell to pacing [the hall]1202-the hall up and down . [Leonard]145-birdalone hung about watching [her]504-lady a while , [she]504-lady nought forbidding [him]145-birdalone , for [her]504-lady thoughts were elsewhere , and [she]504-lady had forgotten [him]145-birdalone ; and at last [he]145-birdalone went [his]145-birdalone ways to set about doing what [she]504-lady would .

CHAPTER VIII . [BIRDALONE]145-birdalone FARES ON [HER]2839-her ADVENTURE

Dawn was but just beginning when [Birdalone]145-birdalone awoke , and though [she]504-lady had not heard [Leonard]145-birdalone at the door , [she]504-lady sprang out of bed and clad [herself]504-lady , doing on [her]504-lady black gown ; and [she]504-lady had a scrip with some bread therein , and a sharp knife at [her]504-lady girdle . Then even as [she]504-lady had done [she]504-lady heard [the priest]1984-the priest 's nail on the door , and [she]504-lady turned thereto ; but as [she]504-lady went , [her]504-lady eye caught [her]504-lady bow and quiver of arrows where they hung on the wall , so [she]504-lady took the bow in [her]504-lady hand and slung the quiver over [her]504-lady shoulder ere [she]504-lady opened the door and found [Leonard]145-birdalone standing there . Neither of [them]2841-they spake aught , but [they]2841-they stole [downstairs]1556-downstairs , and so to [the chapel]2832-the chapel and out by [the priest]1984-the priest 's door and the postern in the wall - nook , and were presently out in the fresh morning air ; and [Birdalone]145-birdalone was joyous and lightfoot , and scarce felt the earth beneath [her]504-lady soles for pleasure of [her]504-lady hope , whereas [she]504-lady deemed [she]504-lady had a thing to crave of [the Stony Folk]148-the stony folk , if [they]148-the stony folk should come alive before [her]504-lady . Fain were [she]504-lady , if [she]504-lady might withal , to give a joy to [some other]2845-some other ; so that when [they]2841-they were gone but a little way from [the castle]1838-the castle [she]504-lady reached out [her]504-lady hand to [Leonard]145-birdalone and took [his]145-birdalone , and said : Hand in hand [we]2847-we walked when first [I]0-i went this way , and [I]0-i deemed [thee]145-birdalone kind and friendly then , and even so hast [thou]145-birdalone been sithence .

[He]145-birdalone was dumbfoundered at first for joy of the touch of [her]504-lady hand and the sweetness of [her]504-lady words ; but presently [he]145-birdalone spake to [her]504-lady confused and stammering , and praised [her]504-lady that [she]504-lady had thought to take [her]504-lady bow and arrows ; for , said [he]145-birdalone , that [they]2841-they might stand [her]504-lady in stead for defence or for getting of food , or for an excuse for wending [the woods]463-the woods . [She]504-lady nodded [yeasay]2849-yeasay unto [him]145-birdalone , and bade [him]145-birdalone again to bide three days for [her]504-lady , and if [she]504-lady came not again in that time , to make a clean breast of it to [Sir Aymeris]138-sir aymeris .

Yea , said [the priest]1984-the priest , and then . . . Why , what then ? [He]145-birdalone can but shove [me]0-i out by the shoulders , and then [I]0-i can seek to [the little house of canons that is at [Gate Cross]44-gate cross on [the road]2103-the road to [Greenford]45-greenford]2851-the little house of canons that is at gate cross on the road to greenford .

Ah , [[my]0-i friend]318-my friend ! said [Birdalone]145-birdalone , how [[we]2854-we women]2855-we women think of nothing at all but [ourselves]2854-we ! And wilt [thou]2856-thee be thrust out of [thine [home]387-home]2857-thine home for helping [me]0-i herein ? Why did [I]0-i not look to [[my]0-i palfrey]2830-my palfrey [myself]0-i ? And the keys [I]0-i might have stolen from [thee]2856-thee , always with [thy]2856-thee good will . But now [I]0-i see that [I]0-i have done [thee]2856-thee a hurt .

Said [Sir Leonard]145-birdalone : [Lady]504-lady , [a priest]2861-a priest hath [a home]2862-a home wheresoever is [an house of religion]2863-an house of religion . There is no harm done , save [Sir Aymeris]138-sir aymeris bethink [him]138-sir aymeris of hanging [me]0-i over the battlements ; as [I]0-i doubt [he]138-sir aymeris will not with [a priest]2861-a priest . Moreover , [I]0-i pray [thee]2856-thee believe , that [wert]2865-wert [thou]2856-thee gone from [the castle]1838-the castle , [house]928-house and [home]387-home were none for [me]0-i [there]232-there . And [he]145-birdalone looked upon [her]504-lady piteously , as if [he]145-birdalone were beseeching .

But [she]504-lady knew not what to say , and hung [her]504-lady head adown ; and presently [they]2870-us were come to the bower in the copse , which this time was [a stable for [Birdalone]145-birdalone 's palfrey]2871-a stable for birdalone 's palfrey instead of [a chamber for [herself]145-birdalone]2872-a chamber for herself . So [Leonard]145-birdalone went in and fetched out the comely beast ; and [Birdalone]145-birdalone stood with [him]145-birdalone just in the cover of the copse waiting to put [her]504-lady foot in the stirrup ; but [she]504-lady might not but abide to look upon [the priest]1984-the priest , who stood there as if [he]1984-the priest were striving with [his]1984-the priest words .

So [she]504-lady said : Now is need of haste to be gone . Yet one word , [[my]0-i friend]318-my friend : Is there aught betwixt [us]2870-us wherein [I]0-i have done [thee]318-my friend wrong ? If so it be , [I]0-i pray [thee]318-my friend to say out what it is ; for it may be though [I]0-i think it not [thou]318-my friend shalt not see [me]0-i again from henceforth .

[He]145-birdalone caught [his]145-birdalone breath , as if [he]145-birdalone had much ado to refrain the sobbing ; but [he]145-birdalone mastered it , and said : [Lady]504-lady and [dear friend]1232-dear friend , if [I]0-i see [thee]1232-dear friend not again , [I]0-i heed not what shall befall [me]0-i . [Thou]318-my friend hast done [me]0-i no wrong . There is this only betwixt [us]2870-us , that [I]0-i love [thee]318-my friend , and [thou]318-my friend lovest not [me]0-i .

[She]1232-dear friend looked on [him]145-birdalone sweetly and pitifully , and said : [I]0-i may not choose but understand [thy]145-birdalone word , to wit , that [thy]145-birdalone love for [me]0-i is the desire of [a man]234-a man toward [a woman]250-a woman ; and that is unhappy ; for [I]0-i love [thee]318-my friend indeed , but not as [a woman]250-a woman loveth [a man]234-a man . It is best to say thus much to [thee]318-my friend downright . But [I]0-i feel in [my]0-i heart that when [I]0-i have said it , it is as much as to say that [I]0-i can not help [thee]318-my friend , and therefore am [I]0-i sorry indeed .

[He]145-birdalone stood before [her]1232-dear friend abashed , but [he]145-birdalone said at last : Now art [thou]318-my friend so sweet , and so kind , and so true , that [I]0-i must perforce love [thee]318-my friend yet more ; and this maketh [me]0-i bold to say that [thou]318-my friend mayst help [me]0-i a little , or so meseemeth . How so ? said [Birdalone]145-birdalone . Quoth [he]145-birdalone : If [thou]318-my friend wouldst suffer [me]0-i to kiss [thy]318-my friend face this once . [She]1232-dear friend shook [her]1232-dear friend head , and spake : How may it avail [thee]145-birdalone , when it is for once , and once only , as forsooth it must be ? Yet it is [thy]318-my friend choice , not [mine]0-i , and [I]0-i will not naysay [thee]318-my friend .

And therewith [she]1232-dear friend put up [her]1232-dear friend face to [him]145-birdalone , and [he]145-birdalone kissed [her]1232-dear friend cheek without touching [her]1232-dear friend otherwise , and then [he]145-birdalone kissed [her]1232-dear friend mouth ; and [she]1232-dear friend knew that [he]145-birdalone was both timorous and sad , and [she]1232-dear friend was ashamed to look on [him]145-birdalone , or to speak to [him]145-birdalone any more , lest [she]1232-dear friend should behold [him]145-birdalone ashamed ; so [she]1232-dear friend but said : Farewell , [friend]2809-friend , till to - morrow at least .

And therewith [her]1232-dear friend foot was in the stirrup , and anon [she]1232-dear friend sat in the saddle , and [her]1232-dear friend palfrey was ambling briskly on the way [she]1232-dear friend would .

CHAPTER IX . [BIRDALONE]101-birdalone COMES TO [THE BLACK VALLEY]43-the black valley

Little is to tell of [Birdalone]145-birdalone 's journey unto the knoll above [the Black Valley of [the Greywethers]42-the greywethers]2748-the black valley of the greywethers . It was about noon when [she]101-birdalone came [there]232-there , and had met but [few folk]2884-few folk on the way , and [those few]2885-those few were [husbandmen]2886-husbandmen , or carlines , or maidens wending afield betimes not far from [the Castle of [the Quest]31-the quest]1931-the castle of the quest .

Now [she]101-birdalone sat on [her]101-birdalone horse and looked down into [the dale]2735-the dale and [[its]2735-the dale stony people]2889-its stony people once more , and saw nought stirring save three ravens who , not far off , were flapping about from stone to stone of [the Greywethers]42-the greywethers , and croaking loud to each other as if some tidings were toward . [She]101-birdalone watched [their]2890-their play for a little , and then gat off [her]101-birdalone horse , and sat down on [the grass of [the knoll]2760-the knoll]2891-the grass of the knoll , and drew forth [her]101-birdalone victual , and ate and drank ; for [she]101-birdalone deemed it happier to eat and drink there than in [the very jaws of [the Black Valley]43-the black valley]2893-the very jaws of the black valley .

Soon was [her]101-birdalone dinner done , and then [she]101-birdalone got to [her]101-birdalone saddle again , and rode slowly down to [the little stream]2894-the little stream , and along [it]2894-the little stream toward [the valley]2729-the valley and the gates of [the mountains]215-the mountains , which [she]101-birdalone had been fain to pass through ; but now , as had happed with [her]101-birdalone that morning when [she]101-birdalone was boun for [the Sending Boat]832-the sending boat , somewhat [she]101-birdalone hung back from the adventure , and when [she]101-birdalone lacked but some five score yards from [the very dale]2898-the very dale itself , [she]101-birdalone lighted down again , and let [her]101-birdalone way - beast bite the grass , while [she]101-birdalone sat down and watched the rippling water .

In a while [she]101-birdalone drew off shoon and hosen , and stood in [the shallow ripple]2899-the shallow ripple , and bathed [her]101-birdalone hands and face withal , and stooped up [- stream]2900-- stream and drank from the hollow of [her]101-birdalone hands , and so stepped ashore and was waxen hardier ; then [she]101-birdalone strung [her]101-birdalone bow and looked to the shafts in [her]101-birdalone quiver , and did on [her]101-birdalone foot - gear , and mounted once more , and so rode a brisk amble right on into [the dale]2735-the dale , and was soon come amongst [the Greywethers]2902-the greywethers ; and [she]101-birdalone saw that [they]2902-the greywethers were [a many]2903-a many , and that [all the bottom of [the dale]2735-the dale]2904-all the bottom of the dale was besprinkled with them on either side of [the stream]2085-the stream , and some stood in [the very stream]2907-the very stream itself , the ground whereof was black even as [the rest of [the valley]2729-the valley]2908-the rest of the valley , although the water ran over [it]2907-the very stream as clear as glass .

As for [the dale]2735-the dale , now [she]101-birdalone was fairly within [it]2735-the dale , [she]101-birdalone could see but a little way up it , for it winded much , and at first away from [her]101-birdalone left hand , and the sides of it went up in somewhat steep screes on either side , which were topped with mere upright staves and burgs of black rock ; and these were specially big and outthrusting on the right hand of [her]101-birdalone ; and but a furlong ahead of where [she]101-birdalone was , one of these burgs thrust out past the scree and came down sheer into [the dale]2735-the dale , and straitened it so much that there was but little way save by [the stream]2085-the stream itself , which ran swift indeed , but not deep , even there where it was straitened by [the sheer rocks]2913-the sheer rocks .

But up [the dale]2735-the dale would [she]101-birdalone go , whatever was before [her]101-birdalone ; and now [she]101-birdalone told [herself]101-birdalone [her]101-birdalone very purpose , as forsooth [she]101-birdalone scarce had heretofore ; to wit , that [she]101-birdalone would abide in [the dale]2735-the dale the night over and see what should betide , and if [those wights]2916-those wights should chance to come alive , then [she]101-birdalone looked to have valiance enough to face [them]2916-those wights and crave the fulfilment of [her]101-birdalone desire .

So [she]101-birdalone took the water and rode [the stream]2085-the stream till [she]101-birdalone was past [the said sheer rock]2918-the said sheer rock , and then [the valley]2729-the valley widened again , and presently was wider than it was in the beginning ; and here again were the Greywethers grown many more and closer together , and , as [she]101-birdalone deemed , were set in rings round about one very big one , which , forsooth , was somewhat in the shape of [a man]234-a man sitting down with [his]234-a man hands laid on [his]234-a man knees .

[Birdalone]145-birdalone reined up for a minute , and looked about [her]101-birdalone , and then went up on to the grass , and rode straight to the said big stone , and there lighted down from off [her]101-birdalone horse again , and stood by the stone and pondered . Presently [she]101-birdalone deemed that [she]101-birdalone saw something dark moving just beyond the stone , but if it were so , it was gone in a twinkling ; nevertheless [she]101-birdalone stood affrighted , and stared before [her]101-birdalone long , and saw no more , but yet for a while durst not move hand nor foot .

At last [her]101-birdalone courage came again , and [she]101-birdalone thought : Yet how if [this great chieftain]2921-this great chieftain be inwardly stirring and will come awake ? Shall [I]0-i say the word now , lest hereafter it be of no avail ? Therewith [she]101-birdalone stretched out [her]101-birdalone right hand and laid it on the stone , and spake aloud : O Earth , [thou]2922-thou and [[thy]2922-thou first children]2779-thy first children , [I]0-i crave of [you]2922-thou that [he]2921-this great chieftain may come back now at once and loving [me]0-i . And [her]101-birdalone voice sounded strange and unkent to [her]101-birdalone in that solitude , and [she]101-birdalone rued it that [she]101-birdalone had spoken .
