CHAPTER X. HOW [BIRDALONE]145-birdalone FELL IN [WITH]46-with [A MAN]234-a man IN [THE BLACK VALLEY]43-the black valley OF [THE GREYWETHERS]149-the greywethers

Came new tidings therewithal ; for the moment after [she]101-birdalone had spoken , [a tall man]1809-a tall man drew out from behind the big stone , and stood before [her]101-birdalone ; and at first it was in [her]101-birdalone mind that this was the very chieftain come alive for [her]101-birdalone , and for terror [she]101-birdalone was like to swoon this time ; but [he]1809-a tall man spake nought a while , but looked on [her]101-birdalone eagerly and curiously .

[She]101-birdalone came to [herself]101-birdalone presently , so much that [she]101-birdalone could see [him]1809-a tall man clearly , and was now growing more shamefast than afraid , when [she]101-birdalone saw beyond doubt that [the man]2926-the man was of [the sons of [Adam]103-adam]452-the sons of adam ; but what with [her]101-birdalone shame that was now , and [her]101-birdalone fear that had been , [she]101-birdalone yet had no might to move , but stood there pale and trembling like a leaf , and might scarce keep [her]101-birdalone feet .

Now [the new - comer]518-the new - comer bowed before [her]101-birdalone smiling , and said : [I]0-i ask [thy]101-birdalone pardon , [fair damsel]2929-fair damsel or indeed [I]0-i should say [fairest damsel]2930-fairest damsel , that [I]0-i have scared [thee]101-birdalone . But sooth to say [I]0-i beheld [thee]101-birdalone coming riding , and even from a little aloof [I]0-i could see that nought which might befall could ever make it up to [me]0-i for not seeing [thee]101-birdalone close at hand and hearing [thee]101-birdalone speak . Wherefore [I]0-i hid [myself]0-i behind [the king]1345-the king 's stone here ; and no harm is done thereby [I]0-i trow ; for now [I]0-i see that the colour is coming into [thy]101-birdalone cheeks again , and [thy]101-birdalone fear is gone . And as for [me]0-i , [thou]101-birdalone hast not fled away from [me]0-i , as [thou]101-birdalone wouldst have done had [I]0-i not hidden and come on [thee]101-birdalone suddenly ; and then [thou]101-birdalone being horsed and [I]0-i unhorsed , [thou]101-birdalone wouldst have escaped [me]0-i , whereas now [thou]101-birdalone art within reach of [my]0-i hand . Then [he]2932-his smiled , and said : Furthermore , [thou]101-birdalone hast told so little of [thy]101-birdalone secret to [this stony king]2933-this stony king here , that [I]0-i am little the wiser for [thy]101-birdalone word , and [thou]101-birdalone [the little more betrayed]2934-the little more betrayed . Only this [I]0-i will say , that if [He]2933-this stony king loveth [thee]101-birdalone not , [He]2933-this stony king is more of [a fool]493-a fool than [I]0-i be .

[He]2932-his reached out [his]2932-his hand to [hers]0-i , but [she]0-i drew it aback , and grew yet more ashamed , and could find no word for [him]2932-his . [His]2932-his voice was soft and full , and [he]2932-his spake deftly , but [she]0-i was not content with it for its kindness , as [she]0-i had been with [all the other men whom [she]0-i had met since [she]0-i left [the House under the Wood]2453-the house under the wood]2936-all the other men whom she had met since she left the house under the wood , and [she]0-i durst not trust [her]0-i hand to [him]2932-his .

As for [his]2932-his aspect , [she]0-i saw that [he]2932-his was tall and well - knit , and goodly of fashion ; dark - haired , with long hazel eyes , smooth - cheeked and bright - skinned ; [his]2932-his nose long , and a little bent over at the end , and coming down close to [his]2932-his lips , which were full and red ; [his]2932-his face was hairless save for a little lip - beard . [He]2932-his was so clad , that [he]2932-his had no helm on [his]2932-his head , but a little hat with a broad gold piece in the front thereof ; [he]2932-his was girt to a long sword , and had an anlace also in [his]2932-his belt , and [Birdalone]145-birdalone saw the rings of a fine hauberk at [his]2932-his collar and knees ; otherwise [he]2932-his was not armed . Over [his]2932-his hauberk [he]2932-his wore a black surcoat , without device of any kind , and [his]2932-his foot and leg gear were of the same hue ; wherefore may [we]2938-we call [him]2932-his [the Black Knight]150-the black knight . Sooth to say , for all [his]2932-his soft speech , [she]0-i feared [him]2932-his and rued the meeting of [him]2932-his .

Now [he]2932-his spake to [her]0-i again : [I]0-i see that [thou]2939-thou art wroth with [me]0-i , [lady]504-lady ; but mayhappen it is not so ill that [I]0-i have happened on [thee]0-i ; for [this dale]2941-this dale hath a bad name for more than one thing , and is scarce meet for [damsels]2942-damsels to wander in . But now since [thou]2939-thou hast [a weaponed man]2943-a weaponed man with [thee]2939-thou , and [thou]2939-thou , by [All - hallows]2944-all - hallows ! not utterly unarmed , [thou]2939-thou mayst well go up [the valley]2729-the valley and see something more thereof . So come now , mount thine horse again , and [I]0-i will lead [him]2932-his for [thee]0-i .

Now [Birdalone]145-birdalone found speech and said : [Knight]150-the black knight , for such [thou]2939-thou seemest to [me]0-i , [I]0-i deem now that [I]0-i have no need to fare further in [this dale]2941-this dale , but [I]0-i will get [me]0-i into the saddle and turn [my]0-i horse 's head outward again , giving [thee]0-i good day first and thanking [thee]0-i for [thy]0-i courtesy . And therewith [she]0-i turned to get to [her]0-i palfrey , but sore trembling the while ; but [he]145-birdalone followed [her]0-i and said , with brow somewhat knitted : Nay , [lady]504-lady , [I]0-i have left [my]0-i horse somewhat further up , and [I]0-i must go back to fetch [him]145-birdalone , that [we]2948-we may wend out of [the dale]2735-the dale together . For [I]0-i will not suffer [thee]0-i to flee from [me]0-i and fall into the hands of [evil wights]2950-evil wights , be [they]2950-evil wights ghosts or [living men]2951-living men , and that the less since [I]0-i have heard the speech in [thy]0-i mouth , as of honey and cream and roses . Therefore if [thou]0-i go out of [the dale]2735-the dale , [I]0-i shall go with [thee]0-i afoot , leading thine horse . And look to it if it be courteous to unhorse [a knight]1353-a knight , who is ready to be [[thy]0-i servant]2954-thy servant . Moreover , since [thou]0-i hast come to [this dale of wonder]2955-this dale of wonder , and mayst leave it safely , pity it were that [thou]0-i shouldst see nought thereof , for strange is it forsooth , and belike [thou]0-i shalt never seek thither again . Wherefore [I]0-i crave of [thee]0-i , once more , to mount thine horse and let [me]0-i lead [thee]0-i up [the dale]2735-the dale .

[He]1353-a knight spake these last words rather as one giving a command than making a prayer , and [Birdalone]145-birdalone feared [him]1353-a knight now sorely . Forsooth [she]0-i had [her]0-i bended bow in hand ; but let alone that [the knight]2120-the knight was over - near to [her]0-i that [she]0-i might get a shaft out of [her]0-i quiver and nock it , ere [he]2120-the knight should run in on [her]0-i , and let alone also that [he]2120-the knight was byrnied , [she]0-i scarce deemed that it behoved [her]0-i to slay or wound [the man]2926-the man because [she]0-i would be quit of [him]2120-the knight . Wherefore angrily , and with a flushed face , [she]0-i answered [him]2120-the knight : So shall it be then , [Sir Knight]124-hugh ; or rather so must it be , since [thou]2959-thee compellest [me]0-i .

[He]2120-the knight laughed and said : Nay , now [thou]2959-thee art angry . [I]0-i compel [thee]2959-thee not , [I]0-i but say that it will not do for [thee]2959-thee to compel [me]0-i to leave [thee]2959-thee . Go which way [thou]2959-thee wilt , up [the dale]2735-the dale , or down [it]2735-the dale and out of [it]2735-the dale ; it is all one unto [me]0-i , so long as [I]0-i am with [thee]2959-thee . [Forsooth]101-birdalone , [damsel]2961-damsel , [I]0-i have said harder words to ladies who have done [my]0-i pleasure and not deemed [themselves]2962-themselves compelled .

[She]2961-damsel paled but answered nought ; then [she]2961-damsel mounted [her]2961-damsel palfrey , and [the knight]2120-the knight went to [her]2961-damsel bridle - rein without more words , and so led [her]2961-damsel on up [the valley]2729-the valley by the easiest way amongst [the Greywethers]2902-the greywethers .

CHAPTER XI . [BIRDALONE]101-birdalone IS LED UP [THE BLACK VALLEY]2966-the black valley

As [they]2967-they went , [the knight]2120-the knight fell a - talking to [Birdalone]101-birdalone , and that without any of the covert jeering which [he]2120-the knight had used erewhile ; and [he]2120-the knight showed [her]101-birdalone places in [the dale]2735-the dale , as caverns under [the burgs]2970-the burgs , and little eyots in [the stream]2085-the stream , and certain stones amongst the Greywethers whereof stories ran ; and how this and [the other one]2972-the other one had fared in dealings with [the land - wights]2973-the land - wights , and how [one]515-one had perished , and another had been made happy , and so forth . Withal [he]2120-the knight told of [the mountain- folk]2975-the mountain- folk , and in especial how [they]2975-the mountain- folk of [the plains]2976-the plains , when [he]2120-the knight was scarce more than [a boy]2977-a boy , had met [them]2975-the mountain- folk in battle in [that same dale]2978-that same dale , and how fierce the fight was ; whereas [the mountain - men]2979-the mountain - men were fighting for a life of desires accomplished , which hitherto had been but a dream unto [them]2979-the mountain - men ; and [the men of [the plain]2727-the plain]2980-the men of the plain fought for dear life itself , and for all that made it aught save death in life . Wherefore up and down [the dale]2735-the dale [they]2979-the mountain - men fought , at first in ordered ranks and then in knots , and lastly sword to sword and [man]548-man to [man]548-man , till there was no foot of grass or black sand there which had not its shower of blood ; and [the stream]2085-the stream was choked with the dead , and ran red out of [the dale]2735-the dale ; till at last well - nigh [all the host of the mountain - men]2987-all the host of the mountain - men was fallen , and scarce less of [the folk of [the plains]2976-the plains]2988-the folk of the plains , but [these men]2990-these men held [the field]763-the field and had the victory .

All this [he]2120-the knight told [her]2992-she deftly and well , and though [he]2120-the knight said not so right out , yet let [her]2992-she wot that , youth as [he]2120-the knight was , [he]2120-the knight was of the battle ; and [his]2120-the knight voice was clear and good , and [Birdalone]101-birdalone 's wrath ran off [her]2992-she , and [she]2992-she hearkened [his]2120-the knight tale , and even asked [him]2120-the knight a question here and there ; and so courteous was this [Black Knight]124-hugh now become , that [Birdalone]101-birdalone began to think that [she]2992-she had fallen short of courtesy to [him]2120-the knight , because of [her]2992-she fear and the weariness of the waiting which so oppressed [her]2992-she ; and that shamed and irked [her]2992-she , for [she]2992-she would fain be of all courtesy . Wherefore now [she]2992-she deemed that perchance [she]2992-she had erred in deeming [him]2120-the knight [an evil man]2993-an evil man ; and [she]2992-she looked on [him]2120-the knight from time to time , and deemed [him]2120-the knight goodly of fashion ; [she]2992-she thought [his]2120-the knight eyes were deep , and [his]2120-the knight face sober and fair of aspect , but that [his]2120-the knight nose turned down at the end , and was over thin at the bridge , and moreover [his]2120-the knight lips looked over - sweet and licorous .

Now when [the knight]2120-the knight was silent of [his]2120-the knight tales , [Birdalone]101-birdalone fell to asking [him]2120-the knight questions sweetly concerning this Stony People which was all about [them]2995-them ; and [he]2120-the knight told [her]101-birdalone all [he]2120-the knight knew , soberly enough at first , yet indeed ended by mocking [them]2995-them somewhat , but mocked not at [her]101-birdalone any more . At last [he]2120-the knight said : [Fair lady]2265-fair lady , that [thou]2997-thou hast not come here all for nought [I]0-i partly know by those words which [I]0-i heard come from [thy]2265-fair lady mouth at [the King 's Stone]2998-the king 's stone ; wherefore [I]0-i marvelled indeed when [I]0-i heard [thee]2265-fair lady say that [thou]2997-thou wouldst go straight out of [the dale]2735-the dale ; for [I]0-i had deemed [thee]2265-fair lady desirous of trying the adventure of waking [this Stony People]3000-this stony people a - night - tide . Forsooth was this [thy]2265-fair lady mind when [thou]2997-thou soughtest hither to [the dale]2735-the dale ?

[She]101-birdalone reddened at [his]2120-the knight word , and yeasaid [him]2120-the knight shortly . Then said [he]2120-the knight : Is it not [thy]2265-fair lady mind still ? [Sir]7091-sir , said [she]101-birdalone , as now [I]0-i have got to fear it . [Yea]3003-yea ? and that is strange , said [he]2120-the knight , for [thou]2997-thou wouldst have waked [the dale]2735-the dale alone ; and now [thou]2997-thou art no longer alone , but hast [me]0-i to watch and ward [thy]2997-thou waking , [thou]2997-thou art more afeard .

[She]101-birdalone looked on [his]2120-the knight face steadily , to wot if there were no half - hidden smile therein ; but herseemed that [he]2120-the knight spake in all soberness ; and [she]101-birdalone had nought to say to [him]2120-the knight save this : [Sir]7091-sir , [I]0-i am now become afraid of the waking . And [he]2120-the knight said no more thereof .

Now [they]3006-they went thus , and [Birdalone]101-birdalone not without pleasure , since [her]101-birdalone fear of [the knight]2120-the knight was minished , some three hours up [the dale]2735-the dale , and still were the Greywethers everywhere about [them]3006-they , so that there were well - nigh as many hours as miles in [their]3006-they wending .

At last [they]3006-they seemed to be drawing nigh to [the head of [the dale]2735-the dale]3009-the head of the dale , and the burgs and the rocks were before [them]3006-they all round [it]2735-the dale as a wall , though yet about a mile aloof at the further end ; and this end [it]2735-the dale was wider than elsewhere .

Came [they]3006-they then to [a level space of greensward clear of the grey stones]3011-a level space of greensward clear of the grey stones , which were drawn all around [it]2735-the dale in ordered rings , so that it was as some doom - ring of [an ancient people]3012-an ancient people ; and within [the said space]3013-the said space [Birdalone]101-birdalone beheld a great black horse tethered and cropping the grass . [The knight]2120-the knight led [her]101-birdalone into the ring , and said : Now are [we]3006-they come [home]387-home for the present , [[my]0-i lady]615-my lady , and if it please [thee]101-birdalone to light down [we]3006-they shall presently eat and drink , and sithence talk a little . And [he]2120-the knight drew nigh to help [her]101-birdalone off [her]101-birdalone horse , but [she]101-birdalone suffered [him]2120-the knight not , and lighted down of [herself]101-birdalone ; but if [she]101-birdalone suffered not [his]2120-the knight hand , [his]2120-the knight eyes [she]101-birdalone must needs suffer , as [he]2120-the knight gazed greedily on the trimness of [her]101-birdalone feet and legs in [her]101-birdalone sliding from [her]101-birdalone horse .

Howsoever , [he]2120-the knight took [her]101-birdalone hand , and led [her]101-birdalone to [a little mound on the other side of the ring]3017-a little mound on the other side of the ring , and bade [her]101-birdalone sit down there , and so did [she]101-birdalone , and from under the nighest of the stones [he]2120-the knight drew forth a pair of saddle - bags , and took victual and wine thence , and [they]3018-they ate and drank together like [old companions]3019-old companions . And now [Birdalone]101-birdalone told [herself]101-birdalone that [the knight]2120-the knight was frank and friendly ; yet forsooth [she]101-birdalone wotted that [her]101-birdalone heart scarce trowed what it feigned , and that [she]101-birdalone yet feared [him]2120-the knight .

CHAPTER XII . HOW THOSE TWAIN GET [THEM]3021-them FROM OUT OF [THE BLACK VALLEY]43-the black valley OF THE GREYWETHERS

When [they]3018-they had dined , and had sat a while talking , [the knight]2120-the knight said : [I]0-i will ask [thee]101-birdalone once more wherefore [thou]101-birdalone must needs depart from [this dale]2941-this dale leaving [the Greywethers]149-the greywethers unwaked ? Yet this must [I]0-i tell [thee]101-birdalone first , that this ring at [the dale]2735-the dale 's end is the only one due place where [the Greywethers]149-the greywethers can be rightly waked , and that there be [few who wot this]3025-few who wot this . Wilt [thou]101-birdalone not tell [me]0-i then what is in [thy]101-birdalone mind ?

[Birdalone]101-birdalone gazed down on the ground a while ; then [she]101-birdalone lifted up [her]101-birdalone head and looked on [the Black Knight]150-the black knight , and said : [Sir Knight]2737-sir knight , [we]3018-they have been brought so close together to - day , and as [meseemeth]119-meseemeth [I]0-i am so wholly in [thy]101-birdalone power , that [I]0-i will tell [thee]2737-sir knight the very truth as it is . [My]0-i mind it was to wake [the dale]2735-the dale here to - night , and take what might befall [me]0-i . And well indeed might [I]0-i fear the adventure , which [few]3028-few , [meseemeth]119-meseemeth , would not fear . But so strong is [my]0-i longing for that which [I]0-i would crave of [these wights]2776-these wights , that it overmastered [my]0-i fear , and [my]0-i purpose held when [I]0-i entered [the dale]2735-the dale . Then [I]0-i met [thee]101-birdalone ; and here again is the truth , take it how [thou]101-birdalone wilt , that presently [I]0-i feared [thee]101-birdalone , and yet [I]0-i fear [thee]101-birdalone ; for [I]0-i have noted [thee]101-birdalone closely all this while , and have seen of [thee]101-birdalone , that [thou]101-birdalone art over heedful of [my]0-i poor body , and wouldst have it for thine own if [thou]101-birdalone mightest . And there is this in [thee]101-birdalone also , as [I]0-i deem , though [thou]101-birdalone [thyself]101-birdalone mayst not know it , that [thou]101-birdalone wouldst have [thy]101-birdalone pleasure of [me]0-i whether it pleasure [me]0-i or grieve [me]0-i ; and this [thy]101-birdalone pleasure must [I]0-i needs gainsay ; for though [thou]101-birdalone mayest hereafter become [[my]0-i friend]318-my friend , yet are there [other friends of [mine]0-i]3032-other friends of mine , who be such , that [my]0-i grief would mar any pleasure [they]3032-other friends of mine might have . Hast [thou]101-birdalone heard and understood ?

[She]0-i looked on [his]3033-thou face steadily as [she]0-i spake , and saw that it flushed , and darkened , and scowled , and that [his]3033-thou hands were clenched , and [his]3033-thou teeth set hard together . And again [she]0-i spake : [Sir]7091-sir , [thou]3033-thou shalt know that beside these shot - weapons , [I]0-i have a thing here in [my]0-i girdle that may serve either against [thee]101-birdalone or against [me]0-i , if need drive [me]0-i thereto ; wherefore [I]0-i will pray [thee]101-birdalone to forbear . Forsooth , [thou]3033-thou shalt presently happen on other women , who shall be better unto [thee]101-birdalone than [I]0-i can be .

By then [Birdalone]101-birdalone had spoken the word , [the knight]2120-the knight 's face had cleared , and [he]3033-thou laughed aloud and said : As to [thy]3033-thou last words , therein at least [thou]3033-thou liest , [[my]0-i lady]615-my lady . But for the rest , [I]0-i see that it must all be as [thou]3033-thou wiliest . Yea , if such be [thy]3033-thou will , [we]3037-we shall presently to horse and ride down [the dale]2735-the dale again , and at the end thereof [I]0-i shall leave [thee]101-birdalone to go [home]387-home alone at [thy]3033-thou will . [She]615-my lady said : For that [I]0-i can [thee]101-birdalone thanks with all [my]0-i heart . But why hast [thou]3040-thou not asked [me]0-i of whence [I]0-i am , and whither [I]0-i would go [home]387-home ?

Again [he]3042-he laughed and said : Because [I]0-i know already . [I]0-i have had more than two or three tales from [them]3043-them who have seen [thee]0-i , or spoken unto others who have seen [thee]0-i , how [the gay Champions of the Castle of [the Quest]31-the quest]3044-the gay champions of the castle of the quest had fished up a wondrous pearl of price from out of [the Great Water]30-the great water ; and when [I]0-i set eyes on [thy]0-i beauty , [I]0-i knew that the said pearl could be nowhere else than under [mine]0-i eyes .

Let that pass , [she]0-i said , and blushed not ; but now tell [me]0-i the truth as [I]0-i have told [thee]3042-he , why [thou]3045-thou art so instant with [me]0-i to wake the Greywethers to - night ? [He]3042-he kept silence a while , and , as [she]0-i looked on [him]3042-he , [she]0-i thought [she]0-i saw confusion in [his]3042-he face ; but at last [he]3042-he said : [Thou]3045-thou wert wrong in saying that [I]0-i heeded not [thy]3045-thou pleasure , and solace , and welfare . Meseemed , and yet doth , that it might be to thine avail to wake the Greywethers to - night ; and never again mayst [thou]3045-thou have a chance of the waking , as erst [I]0-i said . [I]0-i say [I]0-i wish [thee]3045-thou to have fulfilment of [thy]3045-thou craving . Nor hast [thou]3045-thou aught to fear of [them]3045-thou , seeing that it is but dastards and [fools]3046-fools that [they]3045-thou undo .

[He]3042-he broke off [his]3042-he speech , and [Birdalone]101-birdalone yet looked on [him]3042-he , and after a little [he]3042-he said : [Thou]3045-thou drawest the truth out of [me]0-i ; for moreover [I]0-i would have [thee]3045-thou with [me]0-i longer than [thou]3045-thou wouldst be if [we]3047-we but rode together down [the water]361-the water and out of [the dale]2735-the dale , and [thou]3045-thou to fare away alone .

[Birdalone]101-birdalone spake in a while , and that while [he]3042-he gazed upon [her]101-birdalone eagerly ; [she]101-birdalone said : [I]0-i shall now tell [thee]3042-he that [I]0-i shall abide the adventure of the waking to - night , whatever befall . And [I]0-i , said [he]3042-he , will so do that [thou]3045-thou mayst fear [me]0-i the less ; for [I]0-i will unarm [me]0-i when the night cometh , and [thou]3045-thou [thyself]3045-thou shalt keep [mine]0-i hauberk and sword and anlace .

[She]101-birdalone said : It is well ; [I]0-i will take that , lest desire overmaster [thee]3042-he .

[They]3050-they spake no more of it at that time , and it was now five hours after noon . [Birdalone]101-birdalone arose , for [she]101-birdalone found it hard to sit still and abide nightfall : [she]101-birdalone went without the two first rings of the Greywethers , which were set in more open order beyond that , and [she]101-birdalone looked all about [her]101-birdalone , to the black rocks on either side , and to the great black wall at [the dale]2735-the dale 's ending , and [the blue mountains]3052-the blue mountains aloof beyond it ; then down toward [the plain of the dale]3053-the plain of the dale came [her]101-birdalone eyes , and [she]101-birdalone looked through the tangle of the grey stones . Now [she]101-birdalone seemed to be looking more intently upon some one thing ; with that [she]101-birdalone called to [her]101-birdalone [the Black Knight]2114-the black knight , who was hanging about watching [her]101-birdalone , and [she]101-birdalone said to [him]2114-the black knight : Fair sir , art [thou]2114-the black knight clear - seeing and far - seeing ? [I]0-i am not thought to be purblind , quoth [he]2114-the black knight . Then [Birdalone]101-birdalone reached out [her]101-birdalone hand and pointed and said : Canst [thou]2114-the black knight see [aught]3055-aught which [thou]2114-the black knight didst not look to see , there , up [the dale]2735-the dale as [I]0-i point ? Said [he]2114-the black knight : All too clear [I]0-i see the hand and the wrist of [thee]101-birdalone , and that blinds [me]0-i to aught else . [I]0-i pray [thee]2114-the black knight fool not , [she]101-birdalone said , but look heedfully , and [thou]2114-the black knight mayst see what [I]0-i see , and then tell [me]0-i what it means . Though forsooth [I]0-i am exceeding in far sight .

[He]2114-the black knight looked under the sharp of [his]2114-the black knight hand heedfully , then [he]2114-the black knight turned unto [her]101-birdalone and said : By [All - hallows]2944-all - hallows ! there is in [thee]101-birdalone every excellency ! [Thou]2114-the black knight art right ; [I]0-i see a bay horse up there feeding on the bites of grass amongst [the Greywethers]42-the greywethers . Look again ! [she]101-birdalone said ; what else canst [thou]2114-the black knight see ? Is there aught anigh to the bay horse which is like to the gleam and glitter of metal . Christ ! said [he]2114-the black knight , once more [thou]2114-the black knight art right . There be [weaponed men in [the dale]2735-the dale]3058-weaponed men in the dale . Tarry not , [I]0-i beseech [thee]2114-the black knight , but get to horse forthright , and [I]0-i will do no less .

There goeth the waking of [the dale]2735-the dale for this time , said [Birdalone]101-birdalone , laughing . But art [thou]2114-the black knight not in haste , [fair sir]2215-fair sir ? may not these be [friends]416-friends ?

[The knight]2120-the knight laid [his]2120-the knight hand upon [her]101-birdalone shoulder , and thrust [her]101-birdalone on toward [her]101-birdalone palfrey , and spake fiercely , but not loud : [Thee]2114-the black knight [I]0-i pray not to fool now ! There is not a minute to spare . If [thou]2114-the black knight deemest [me]0-i evil , as [I]0-i think [thou]2114-the black knight dost , there are worser than [I]0-i , [I]0-i tell [thee]2114-the black knight , there are worser . But [we]3064-we will talk of it when [we]3064-we be in the saddle , and clear of [this accursed dale]3065-this accursed dale .

[Birdalone]101-birdalone knew not what to do save obey [him]2120-the knight , so [she]101-birdalone lightly gat into [her]101-birdalone saddle , and followed [him]2120-the knight , for [he]2120-the knight was mounted in a twinkling , and riding on . [He]2120-the knight led out of the ring , and fell to threading the maze of the Greywethers , keeping ever toward [the steep side of [the dale]2735-the dale]3066-the steep side of the dale , which was on that hand that looked toward [the Castle of [the Quest]31-the quest]1931-the castle of the quest , that is to say , [the eastern bent]3069-the eastern bent . [Birdalone]101-birdalone wondered at this leading , and when [she]101-birdalone was come up with [the knight]2120-the knight [she]101-birdalone spake to [him]2120-the knight breathlessly , and said : But , [fair sir]2215-fair sir , why wend [we]3064-we not down [the dale]2735-the dale ? [He]2120-the knight answered : First , [lady]504-lady , because [we]3064-we must hide [us]3064-we from [them]3074-they straightway ; and next because [they]3074-they be more than [we]3064-we , many more , and [their]3074-they horses be fresh , while thine at least is somewhat spent ; and if [they]3074-they were to spur down [the dale]2735-the dale in chase , [they]3074-they would soon be upon [us]3064-we ; for think not that [I]0-i would escape and leave [thee]504-lady behind .

Said [Birdalone]101-birdalone : But [thou]504-lady knowest [them]3074-they , then , what [they]3074-they be ? since [thou]504-lady wottest of [their]3074-they numbers and [their]3074-they riding . Hearken now ! Upon [thy]504-lady soul and [thy]504-lady salvation , be [they]3074-they more friends unto [thee]504-lady than unto [me]0-i ?

[He]3076-he said , as [be]3077-be rode on a little slower than erst : Upon [my]0-i soul and [my]0-i salvation [I]0-i swear it , that [the men yonder be of the worst unfriends to [thee]504-lady that may be in [the world]430-the world]3078-the men yonder be of the worst unfriends to thee that may be in the world . And now , [lady]504-lady , [I]0-i promise [thee]504-lady that [I]0-i will unravel [thee]504-lady the riddle , and tell [thee]504-lady the whole truth of these haps , whatsoever may come of [my]0-i words , when [we]3081-we be in a safer place than this ; and meantime [I]0-i beseech [thee]504-lady to trust in [me]0-i thus far , as to believe that [I]0-i am leading [thee]504-lady out of the very worst peril that might befall [thee]504-lady . Nay , [thou]504-lady must needs trust [me]0-i ; for [I]0-i tell [thee]504-lady , that though [I]0-i now love [thee]504-lady better than all [the world]430-the world and all that is in it , [I]0-i would slay [thee]504-lady here in [this dale]2941-this dale rather than suffer [thee]504-lady to fall into the hands of [these men]2990-these men .

[Birdalone]101-birdalone heard [him]3085-thee with a sick heart ; but such passion went with [his]3085-thee words that [she]101-birdalone believed what [he]3085-thee said ; and [she]101-birdalone spake softly : Sir , [I]0-i will trust [thee]3085-thee thus far ; but [I]0-i beseech [thee]3085-thee to have pity upon [a poor maiden who hath had but little pity shown unto [her]3086-a poor maiden who hath had but little pity shown unto her until these latter days until these latter days]3086-a poor maiden who hath had but little pity shown unto her until these latter days ; and then : O woe 's [me]0-i , to have fallen out of the kindness and love once more !

[The Black Knight]150-the black knight spake to [her]101-birdalone in a little while , and said : What pity [I]0-i can to [thee]101-birdalone , that [I]0-i will . Once more [I]0-i tell [thee]101-birdalone , that if [thou]101-birdalone but knew it [thou]101-birdalone wouldst thank [me]0-i indeed for what [I]0-i have done for [thee]101-birdalone in this hour ; and henceforth [I]0-i will do and forbear with [thee]101-birdalone to the uttermost that love will suffer [me]0-i . But lo [thou]101-birdalone ! here are [we]3087-they safe for this present ; but [we]3087-they must nowise tarry .

[Birdalone]101-birdalone looked and saw that [they]3087-they were come to the wall of [the dale]2735-the dale , and that [there]232-there [it]3090-it went down sheer to [the plain thereof]3091-the plain thereof , and that before [them]3087-they was a cleft that narrowed speedily , and over which the rocks well - nigh met , so that it was indeed almost a cave . [They]3087-they rode into [it]3092-it straightway , and when that [they]3087-they had gone but a little , and because it had winded somewhat , [they]3087-they could but see [the main valley]3093-the main valley as a star of light behind [them]3087-they , then it narrowed no more , but was as [a dismal street of the straitest]3094-a dismal street of the straitest , whiles lighter and whiles darker , according as the rocks roofed it in overhead or drew away from it . Long [they]3087-they rode , and whiles came trickles of water from out the rocks on one hand or the other ; and now and again [they]3087-they met [a stream which covered all the ground of [the pass]3096-the pass]3095-a stream which covered all the ground of the pass from side to side for the depth of a foot or more . Great rocks also were strewn over [their]3087-they path every here and there , so that whiles must [they]3087-they needs dismount and toil afoot over the rugged stones ; and in most places the way was toilsome and difficult . [The knight]2120-the knight spake little to [Birdalone]101-birdalone , save to tell [her]101-birdalone of the way , and warn [her]101-birdalone where it was perilous ; and [she]101-birdalone , for [her]101-birdalone part , was silent , partly for fear of [the strange man]3098-the strange man , or , it might be , even for hatred of [him]3098-the strange man , who had thus brought [her]101-birdalone into such sore trouble , and partly for grief . For , with all torment of sorrow , [she]101-birdalone kept turning over and over in [her]101-birdalone mind whether [[her]101-birdalone friends]1314-her friends had yet come [home]387-home to [the Castle of the Quest]1931-the castle of the quest , and whether [they]1314-her friends would go seek [her]101-birdalone to deliver [her]101-birdalone . And such shame took hold of [her]101-birdalone when [she]101-birdalone thought of [their]1314-her friends grief and confusion of soul when [they]1314-her friends should come [home]387-home and find [her]101-birdalone gone , that [she]101-birdalone set [her]101-birdalone mind to asking if it had not been better had [she]101-birdalone never met [them]1314-her friends . Yet in good sooth [her]101-birdalone mind would not shape the thought , howsoever [she]101-birdalone bade it .

CHAPTER XIII . NOW [THEY]1314-her friends REST FOR THE NIGHT IN [THE STRAIT PASS]47-the strait pass

At last , when [they]1314-her friends had been going a long while , it might be some six hours , and it had long been night in [the world]430-the world without , but moon - lit , and [they]1314-her friends had rested but seldom , and then but for short whiles , [the knight]2120-the knight drew rein and spake to [Birdalone]101-birdalone , and asked [her]101-birdalone was [she]101-birdalone not weary . O yea , [she]101-birdalone said ; [I]0-i was at point to pray [thee]2120-the knight suffer [me]0-i to get off and lie down on [the bare rock]3105-the bare rock . To say sooth , [I]0-i am now too weary to think of any peril , or what [thou]3106-thou art , or whither [we]1314-her friends be going . [He]2120-the knight said : By [my]0-i deeming [we]1314-her friends be now half through [this mountain highway]3107-this mountain highway , and belike there is little peril in [our]1314-her friends resting ; for [I]0-i think not that [any one of [them]3109-them]1387-any one of them knoweth of [this pass]3110-this pass , or would dare it if [he]2120-the knight did ; and [they]3109-them doubtless came into [the dale]2735-the dale by [the upper pass]3112-the upper pass , which is strait enough , but light and open .

As [he]2120-the knight spoke , [Birdalone]101-birdalone bowed forward on [her]101-birdalone horse 's neck , and would have fallen but that [he]2120-the knight stayed [her]101-birdalone . Then [he]2120-the knight lifted [her]101-birdalone off [her]101-birdalone horse , and laid [her]101-birdalone down in [the seemliest place [he]2120-the knight might find]3113-the seemliest place he might find ; and the pass there was much widened , and such light as there was in [the outer world]3114-the outer world came down freely into [it]3110-this pass , though it were but of the moon and the stars ; and [the ground]1690-the ground was rather sandy than rocky . So [he]2120-the knight dight [Birdalone]101-birdalone 's bed as well as [he]2120-the knight might , and did off [his]2120-the knight surcoat and laid it over [her]101-birdalone ; and then stood aloof , and gazed on [her]101-birdalone ; and [he]2120-the knight muttered : It is an evil chance ; yet the pleasure of it , the pleasure of it ! Yea , said [he]2120-the knight again , [she]101-birdalone might well be wearied ; [I]0-i [myself]0-i am ready to drop , and [I]0-i am not [the least tough of [the band]3117-the band]3116-the least tough of the band . And therewith [he]2120-the knight laid [him]2120-the knight down on the further side of [the pass]3096-the pass , and fell asleep straightway .

CHAPTER XIV . [THE BLACK KNIGHT]150-the black knight TELLS THE TRUTH OF [HIMSELF]150-the black knight

When the morning was come down into the straitness of [[their]3119-they secret road]3120-their secret road , [Birdalone]101-birdalone opened [her]101-birdalone eyes and saw [the Black Knight]150-the black knight busy over dighting [their]3119-they horses : so [she]101-birdalone arose and thrust [her]101-birdalone grief back into [her]101-birdalone heart , and gave [[her]101-birdalone fellow - farer]3121-her fellow - farer the sele of the day , and [he]2120-the knight brought [her]101-birdalone victual , and [they]3119-they ate a morsel , and gat to horse thereafter and departed ; and the way became smoother , and it was lighter overhead everywhere now , and [the rocks]3122-the rocks never again met overhead athwart the way ; and it seemed to [Birdalone]101-birdalone that now [they]3119-they were wending somewhat downward .

[The knight]2120-the knight was courteous unto [Birdalone]101-birdalone , and no longer for the present thrust [his]2120-the knight love upon [her]101-birdalone , so that now [she]101-birdalone had some solace of [his]2120-the knight fellowship , though [he]2120-the knight was but few - spoken to [her]101-birdalone .

It was betimes when [they]3119-they arose , and [they]3119-they rode all the morning till it was noon , which [they]3119-they might well wot of , because the way was much wider , and the cliff - walls of [the pass]3096-the pass much lower , so that the sun shone in upon [them]3119-they and cheered [them]3119-they .

Now [the Black Knight]150-the black knight drew rein and said : Shall [we]3119-they rest , [lady]504-lady , and eat ? And thereafter , if [thou]3126-he wilt , [I]0-i shall tell [thee]504-lady [my]0-i tale . Or rather , if [thou]3126-he wilt suffer [me]0-i , [I]0-i shall speak first and eat afterwards , or else the morsel might stick in [my]0-i throat . [Knight]150-the black knight , said [Birdalone]101-birdalone , smiling , [I]0-i hope [thou]3126-he hast no lie to swallow down before the meat . Nay , [lady]504-lady , said [he]3126-he ; no lie that is of moment at least .

So [they]3119-they lighted down , and [Birdalone]101-birdalone sat on the wayside under a birch- bush that came thrusting out from the rock , and [the knight]2120-the knight stood before [her]101-birdalone , hanging [his]2120-the knight head , as though [he]2120-the knight were [one accused who would plead [his]2120-the knight cause]3129-one accused who would plead his cause ; and [he]3126-he began :

[Lady]504-lady , [I]0-i must tell [thee]504-lady first of all , that to - day [I]0-i have done as [an unfaithful servant]3131-an unfaithful servant and [a traitor to [[my]0-i lord]2574-my lord]3132-a traitor to my lord . Said [Birdalone]101-birdalone simply : Shall [I]0-i tell [thee]504-lady the truth , and say that from the first [I]0-i seemed to see in [thee]504-lady that [thou]504-lady wert scarce trusty ? [He]3126-he said : Well , that mind [I]0-i saw in [thee]504-lady , and it went to [my]0-i heart that [thou]504-lady shouldest think it , and that it should be no less than true . But now [I]0-i must tell [thee]504-lady , that it is for [thy]504-lady sake that [I]0-i have been untrusty to [[my]0-i lord]2574-my lord . How so ? said [she]504-lady . Quoth [he]3126-he : Heardest [thou]504-lady ever of [the Red Knight]141-the red knight ? Yea , said [Birdalone]101-birdalone , [I]0-i have heard of [him]141-the red knight ever as [a tyrant and oppressor]3135-a tyrant and oppressor . Then [she]504-lady grew pale , and said : Art [thou]504-lady [he]141-the red knight ? Nay , said [the knight]2120-the knight , [I]0-i am but [a kinsman of [his]141-the red knight]3137-a kinsman of his , and [[his]141-the red knight best - trusted man]3138-his best - trusted man ; nor have [I]0-i failed [him]141-the red knight ever till yesterday .

[He]3126-he kept silence a while , and then said : This is the true tale : that [we]3139-we have had tidings of [thee]504-lady and of [thy]504-lady ridings abroad with [that old fool]3140-that old fool , [Sir Aymeris]138-sir aymeris , and how [thou]504-lady hadst been twice to look into [the Black Valley]43-the black valley . This [I]0-i say [hath]3141-hath [the Red One]151-the red one heard , and the heart of [him]151-the red one was touched by the mere hearsay of [thee]504-lady ; and moreover ' tis blessed bread to [him]151-the red one the doing of any grief to [the knights of [Quest Castle]48-quest castle]7113-the knights of quest castle ; wherefore [he]151-the red one hath sent [me]504-lady to hang about [the dale]2735-the dale , to lay hands on [thee]504-lady if [I]504-lady might for ; [he]151-the red one knew being wise , that [thou]504-lady wouldst hanker after it ; and moreover [he]151-the red one let one of [[his]151-the red one wise women]7115-his wise women sit out in spells on [thee]504-lady . So [I]504-lady espied , and happened on [thee]504-lady all alone ; and [mine]504-lady errand it was , since [I]504-lady came upon [thee]504-lady thus , to draw [thee]504-lady till [I]504-lady had [thee]504-lady safe at [home]387-home in [the Red Hold]49-the red hold . Forsooth [I]504-lady began [mine]504-lady errand duly , and fell to beguiling [thee]504-lady , so that [thou]504-lady mayst well have seen [the traitor]7117-the traitor in [me]504-lady . But then , and then [my]504-lady heart failed [me]504-lady , because [I]504-lady fell , not to desiring [thee]504-lady as coveting [[my]504-lady master]7118-my master 's chattel , but to loving [thee]504-lady and longing for [thee]504-lady as [[my]504-lady fellow and speech - friend]7119-my fellow and speech - friend . And [I]504-lady said to [myself]504-lady : Into [the Red Hold]49-the red hold [she]504-lady shall not go if [I]504-lady may hinder it .[504-lady]

[Birdalone]101-birdalone was very pale , but [she]101-birdalone refrained [her]101-birdalone from grief and fear , and said : But [those horsed and weaponed men]3142-those horsed and weaponed men up [the dale]2735-the dale , who were [they]3142-those horsed and weaponed men ? [He]3144-he said : [I]0-i will not lie now , not even a little ; [they]3142-those horsed and weaponed men came into [the dale]2735-the dale by that upper pass whereof [I]0-i told [thee]101-birdalone ; [they]3142-those horsed and weaponed men were of [[our]3146-we men]1381-our men ; [I]0-i brought [them]3142-those horsed and weaponed men . [I]0-i was never all alone in [the dale]2735-the dale ; [I]0-i was to have fetched [thee]101-birdalone to [them]3142-those horsed and weaponed men , so that [thou]101-birdalone mightest not see a rout of [folk]1529-folk and flee away ; and then would [we]3146-we all have gone [home]387-home together by [the upper pass]3112-the upper pass . But [we]3146-we two must have gone on unto [them]3142-those horsed and weaponed men in [the dale]2735-the dale 's head , whereas for all that [I]0-i could say [I]0-i might not bring [them]3142-those horsed and weaponed men down into that doom - ring where [we]3146-we ate and talked yesterday . [We]3146-we two have been valianter than [thou]101-birdalone mayst have deemed , to have done the deed of dining there ; for [all men]228-all men fear it . But as for [me]0-i , [I]0-i have been there more than twice or thrice , and thence have [I]0-i wandered , and found this pass wherein now [we]3146-we be ; concerning which [I]0-i have held [my]0-i tongue , deeming that it might one day serve [my]0-i turn ; as it hath done now abundantly , since it hath been a refuge unto [thee]3154-thee .

[Yea]3155-yea , but whither are [we]3146-we going now ? said [Birdalone]101-birdalone ; is it perchance to [the Red Hold]49-the red hold ? Nay , never , said [the knight]2120-the knight , so help [me]0-i God and [All- hallows]3157-all- hallows !

Whither then ? said [Birdalone]101-birdalone ; tell [me]0-i , that [I]0-i may at least trust [thee]3154-thee , even though [I]0-i owe [thee]3154-thee for all the pain and grief which [thou]3154-thee hast wrought [me]0-i . [He]2120-the knight reddened and said : Wait a while ; [I]0-i bring [thee]3154-thee to [no ill place]3158-no ill place ; there shall no harm befall [thee]3154-thee . And [he]2120-the knight fretted and fumed , and was confused of speech and look , and then [he]2120-the knight said : When [we]3159-we come [there]232-there [I]0-i shall belike crave a boon of [thee]3154-thee .

O , but [I]0-i crave a boon of [thee]3154-thee here and now , said [Birdalone]101-birdalone . Wipe away thine offence to [me]0-i and take [me]0-i back to [[my]0-i friends]2100-my friends and [the Castle of [the Quest]31-the quest]1931-the castle of the quest ! So mayst [thou]3154-thee yet be dear unto [me]0-i , though maybe not wholly as [thou]3154-thee wouldst have it . And [she]101-birdalone reached out [her]101-birdalone two hands toward [him]2120-the knight .

[His]2120-the knight breast heaved , and [he]2120-the knight seemed nigh to weeping ; but [he]2120-the knight said : Nay , [lady]504-lady , ask [me]0-i not here and now , but there and to - morrow . But again [I]0-i swear to [thee]504-lady by thine hands that to [the Red Hold]49-the red hold [I]0-i will not bring [thee]504-lady , nor suffer [thee]504-lady to be brought , if [I]0-i may hinder it ; nay , not though [I]0-i give [my]0-i life therefor .

[Birdalone]101-birdalone was silent awhile ; then [she]101-birdalone said : And what shall befall [me]0-i if [I]0-i come to [the Red Hold]49-the red hold ? What is [the Red Knight]2539-the red knight , and what would [he]2539-the red knight do with [me]0-i ? Said [he]2120-the knight : [The Red Knight]2539-the red knight is terrible and fierce and wise ; and [I]0-i fear [him]2539-the red knight , [I.]0-i [He]2539-the red knight held [his]2539-the red knight peace , and said : [I]0-i must needs say it , that to [thee]504-lady [he]2539-the red knight would have been as [Death]152-death and [the Devil]3166-the devil . [He]2539-the red knight would have bedded [thee]504-lady first . [She]0-i broke in : Nay , never ! and flushed very red . But [the knight]2120-the knight went on : And after , [I]0-i wot not ; that were according to [his]2120-the knight mood . And as to [thy]504-lady never , [lady]504-lady , [thou]504-lady wottest not the like of [him]2120-the knight or of the folk [he]2120-the knight hath about [him]2120-the knight . Such as [thou]504-lady ? [she]0-i said angrily . Nay , [he]2120-the knight said , far worse than [me]0-i ; [men who fare little afield , and are not sweetened by adventures and war - perils]3169-men who fare little afield , and are not sweetened by adventures and war - perils ; and [women]433-women worser yet ; and far worser were [they]3169-men who fare little afield , and are not sweetened by adventures and war - perils dealing with [a woman]250-a woman . [She]0-i was silent again awhile , and paled once more ; then [her]0-i colour came back to [her]0-i , and [she]0-i held out [her]0-i hand to [him]2120-the knight and said kindly : [Thou]2120-the knight being what [thou]2120-the knight art , [I]0-i thank [thee]2120-the knight for [thy]2120-the knight dealings with [me]0-i ; and now until to - morrow , when [I]0-i shall ask [thee]0-i of that again , [I]0-i am [friends]416-friends with [thee]0-i ; so come now , and let [us]3173-they eat and drink together .

[He]2120-the knight took [her]0-i hand and kissed it , and then came and sat down meekly beside [her]0-i , and [they]3173-they ate and drank in that wild place as though [they]3173-they had been [friends of long acquaintance]3174-friends of long acquaintance .

CHAPTER XV . [THE BLACK KNIGHT]2114-the black knight BRINGS [BIRDALONE]101-birdalone TO THE BOWER IN [THE DALE]50-the dale

When [they]3173-they had made an end of [their]3173-they meal , [they]3173-they gat to horse again and rode on [their]3173-they ways ; and every mile now was [[their]3173-they road]3176-their road the easier , [the pass]3096-the pass wider , and [its]3096-the pass walls lower and now also more broken ; till at last [they]3173-they began to go down hill swiftly , and after a little [[their]3173-they road]3176-their road seemed to be swallowed in a great thicket of hornbeam and holly ; but [the knight]2120-the knight rode on and entered [the said thicket]3180-the said thicket , and ever found some way amidst the branches , though [they]3173-they were presently in the very thick of the trees , and saw no daylight between the trunks for well- nigh an hour , whereas the wood was thick and tangled , and [they]3173-they had to thread [their]3173-they way betwixt [its]3181-its mazes .

At last the wood began to grow thinner before [them]3173-they , and the white light to show between the trunks ; and [Birdalone]101-birdalone deemed that [she]101-birdalone heard the sound of falling water , and presently was sure thereof ; and [the knight]2120-the knight spake to [her]101-birdalone : Patience , [[my]0-i lady]615-my lady ; now are [we]3173-they near [home]387-home for to- day . [She]101-birdalone nodded kindly to [him]2120-the knight , and therewith [they]3173-they rode on to open ground , and were on the side of a steep bent , broken on [their]3173-they right hands into a sheer cliff as [Birdalone]101-birdalone saw when [the knight]2120-the knight led [her]101-birdalone to the edge and bade [her]101-birdalone look over . Then [she]101-birdalone saw down into [a fair dale lying far below]3186-a fair dale lying far below [them]3173-they , through the which ran [a little river]3187-a little river , clear and swift , but not riotous , after it had fallen over a force at [the upper end of [the dale]2735-the dale]3188-the upper end of the dale , and made the sound of water which [she]101-birdalone had heard . [The said dale]2747-the said dale was so , that whatsoever was on the other side thereof was hidden by tall and great trees , that stood close together some twenty yards aloof from [the stream]2085-the stream , and betwixt them and it was fair greensward with a few bushes and thorn - trees thereon .

Quoth [the knight]2120-the knight : Down there shall [we]3173-they rest till to - morrow , if it please [thee]101-birdalone , [lady]504-lady ; and since the sun will set in an hour , [we]3173-they were best on [our]3173-they way at once . It pleases [me]0-i well , said [Birdalone]101-birdalone , and [I]0-i long to tread the turf by [the river - side]3194-the river - side , for [I]0-i am weary as weary may be of the saddle and the pass .

So down the bent [they]3173-they rode , and it was but a little ere [they]3173-they had ridden it to an end , and had met [the river]2277-the river as it swept round [the cliff - wall of [the valley]2729-the valley]3196-the cliff - wall of the valley ; and [they]3173-they rode through [it]2277-the river , and came on to the pleasant greensward aforesaid under the trees ; and in a bight of [the wood]348-the wood was a bower builded of turf and thatched with reed ; and there , by the bidding of [the knight]2120-the knight , [they]3173-they alighted ; and [the knight]2120-the knight said : This is thine house for to - night , [[my]0-i lady]615-my lady ; and [thou]3202-thou mayest lie there in all safety after [thou]3202-thou hast supped , and mayst have [my]0-i weapons by [thy]3202-thou side if [thou]3202-thou wilt , while [I]0-i lie under the trees yonder . And if [thou]3202-thou wilt bathe [thee]3202-thou in [the cool water]3203-the cool water , to comfort [thee]3202-thou after the long ride and the weariness , [I]0-i swear by [thy]3202-thou hand that [I]0-i will take [myself]0-i out of eye - shot and abide aloof till [thou]3202-thou call [me]0-i .

Said [Birdalone]101-birdalone , smiling somewhat : Fair sir , [I]0-i will not have [my]0-i watch and ward unarmed ; keep [thou]3202-thou [thy]3202-thou weapons ; and [thou]3202-thou wilt not forget , perchance , that [I]0-i am not wholly unarmed , whereas [I]0-i have [my]0-i bow and arrows and [my]0-i knife here . And as to [my]0-i bathing , [I]0-i will take [thee]3202-thou at [thy]3202-thou word , and bid [thee]3202-thou go aloof a while now at once ; for [I]0-i will go down to [the water]361-the water ; and if [thou]3202-thou spy upon [me]0-i , then will it be [thy]3202-thou shame and not [mine]0-i .

[The knight]2120-the knight went [his]2120-the knight ways therewith , and [Birdalone]101-birdalone went down to [the water]361-the water and unclad [her]3202-thou ; but ere [she]3202-thou stepped into [the river]2277-the river , [she]3202-thou laid [her]3202-thou bow and three shafts on the lip thereof . Then [she]3202-thou took the water , and disported [her]3202-thou merrily therein ; and now , forsooth , [she]3202-thou was nowise downcast , for [she]3202-thou said to [herself]3202-thou , [this man]1976-this man is not all evil and [he]1976-this man lovest [me]0-i well , and [I]0-i look for it that to - morrow [he]1976-this man will bring [me]0-i on [my]0-i way toward [the Castle of the Quest]1931-the castle of the quest , for mere love of [me]0-i ; and then shall [he]1976-this man be [a dear friend to [me]0-i]3210-a dear friend to me , and [I]0-i will comfort [him]1976-this man what [I]0-i can for as long as [we]3211-they both live .

So [she]3202-thou came out of the water and clad [her]3202-thou , and then called aloud for [the knight]2120-the knight , and [he]2120-the knight came speedily unto [her]3202-thou , as if [he]2120-the knight had been not exceeding far away , though [he]2120-the knight swore with a great oath that [he]2120-the knight had nowise espied [her]3202-thou . [She]3202-thou answered [him]2120-the knight nought , and [they]3211-they went side by side to the bower ; and there [the knight]2120-the knight dight the victual , and [they]3211-they sat together and ate [their]3211-they meat like [old friends]3214-old friends ; and [Birdalone]101-birdalone asked [the knight]2120-the knight concerning [this valley]2739-this valley and the bower , if [he]2120-the knight had known it for long , and [he]2120-the knight answered : [Yea]3202-thou , [lady]504-lady , [I]0-i was but [a stripling when [I]0-i first happened on [the dale]2735-the dale]3218-a stripling when i first happened on the dale ; and [I]0-i deem that [few]3028-few know thereof save [me]0-i ; at least none of [[our]3211-they flock]3221-our flock knoweth thereof , and [I]0-i am fain thereof , and keep [them]3222-them unknowing , for if [[my]0-i lord]2574-my lord were to hear of [my]0-i having a haunt privy unto [me]0-i [he]2574-my lord would like it but ill .

[Birdalone]101-birdalone turned pale when [she]101-birdalone heard [him]2574-my lord speak of [[his]2574-my lord lord]3224-his lord ; for fear of [the Red Knight]141-the red knight had entered into [her]101-birdalone soul , so that now the flesh crept upon [her]101-birdalone bones . But [she]101-birdalone enforced [her]101-birdalone to smile , and said : [Yea]3225-yea , and what would [he]141-the red knight do to [thee]3225-yea were [he]141-the red knight ill - content with [thy]3225-yea ways ? Forsooth , [lady]504-lady , said [he]141-the red knight , if [he]141-the red knight could spare [me]0-i [he]141-the red knight would make an end of [me]0-i in some miserable way ; nay , if [he]141-the red knight were exceeding ill - content , [he]141-the red knight would do as much for [me]0-i whether [he]141-the red knight could spare [me]0-i or not ; otherwise [he]141-the red knight would watch [his]141-the red knight occasion , and so grieve [me]0-i that what [he]141-the red knight did would go to [my]0-i very heart . Woe 's [me]0-i ! said [Birdalone]101-birdalone , [thou]3227-thou servest [an evil master]3228-an evil master . [The knight]2120-the knight answered not , and [Birdalone]101-birdalone went on speaking earnestly : It is a shame to [thee]101-birdalone to follow [this fiend]3230-this fiend ; why dost [thou]101-birdalone not sunder [thee]101-birdalone from [him]3230-this fiend , and become wholly [an honest man]3231-an honest man ? Said [he]2120-the knight gruffly : It is of no use talking of this , [I]0-i may not ; to boot , [I]0-i fear [him]3230-this fiend . Then did [Birdalone]101-birdalone hold [her]101-birdalone peace , and [the knight]2120-the knight said : [Thou]3227-thou dost not know ; when [I]0-i part from [thee]101-birdalone [I]0-i must needs go straight to [him]3230-this fiend , and then must that befall which will befall . Speak [we]3233-we no more of these matters .

[Birdalone]101-birdalone flushed with hope and joy as [he]2120-the knight spake thus , for [she]101-birdalone took [him]2120-the knight to mean that [he]2120-the knight would lead [her]101-birdalone , on the morrow , on [her]101-birdalone way to [the Castle of [the Quest]3235-the quest]1931-the castle of the quest . But [the knight]2120-the knight spake in a voice grown cheerful again : As to [this bower]3237-this bower , [lady]504-lady , the tale thereof is soon told ; for with [mine]0-i own hands [I]0-i builded it some fifteen years ago ; and [I]0-i have come to [this place]3239-this place time and again when [my]0-i heart was overmuch oppressed with black burdens of evil and turmoil , and have whiles prevailed against the evil , and whiles not . Mayst [thou]2120-the knight prevail this time , then ! said [she]101-birdalone . [He]2120-the knight answered [her]101-birdalone not , but presently fell to talking with [her]101-birdalone of other matters , and [the two]3240-the two were frank and friendly together , till the August night grew dark about [them]3240-the two ; and then [spake Birdalone]101-birdalone : Now would [I]0-i rest , for [I]0-i can no longer keep [mine]0-i eyes open . Abide aloof from [me]0-i to - morrow morning till [I]0-i call to [thee]2120-the knight , as [thou]2120-the knight didst this evening ; and then , before [we]3240-the two eat together again , [thou]2120-the knight shalt tell [me]0-i what [thou]2120-the knight wilt do with [me]0-i . [He]2120-the knight stood up to depart , and [she]101-birdalone reached out [her]101-birdalone hand to [him]2120-the knight in the glimmer , and [he]2120-the knight saw it , but said : Nay , if [I]0-i take thine hand , [I]0-i shall take thine whole body . And therewith [he]2120-the knight departed , and [she]101-birdalone laid [her]101-birdalone down in [her]101-birdalone smock alone , and slept anon , and was dreamless and forgetting everything till the sun was up in the morning .

CHAPTER XVI . YET A DAY AND A NIGHT [THEY]3241-they TARRY IN [THE DALE]2735-the dale

[Birdalone]101-birdalone awoke when the sun came into the bower to [her]101-birdalone , and stood up at once , and went down to [the river]2277-the river and washed the night off [her]101-birdalone ; and then , when [she]101-birdalone was clad , called on [the knight]2120-the knight to come to [her]101-birdalone ; and [he]2120-the knight came , looking downcast and troubled ; so that [Birdalone]101-birdalone thought within [herself]101-birdalone : It is well , [he]2120-the knight will do [my]0-i will .

[She]101-birdalone stood before [him]2120-the knight , and gave [him]2120-the knight the sele of the day , and [he]2120-the knight looked on [her]101-birdalone sorrowfully . Then [she]101-birdalone said : Now is come the time when [I]0-i am to ask [thee]2120-the knight to take [me]0-i back to [the Castle of [the Quest]31-the quest and [[my]0-i own people]3246-my own people]3245-the castle of the quest and my own people . [He]2120-the knight was not hasty to answer [her]101-birdalone , and [she]101-birdalone spake again : This must [thou]2120-the knight do , or else take [me]0-i to the Red Hold and deliver [me]0-i to [the tyrant there]3247-the tyrant there ; and [I]0-i have heard it from [thine]3248-thine own mouth that will be nought else than casting [me]0-i into shame and torment and death . And [I]0-i deem [thou]2120-the knight canst not do it . Nay , [she]101-birdalone said , staying the words that were coming from [his]2120-the knight mouth , [I]0-i wot that [thou]2120-the knight canst do it if [thine]3248-thine heart can suffer it ; for [thou]2120-the knight art stronger than [I]0-i , and [thou]2120-the knight mayst break [my]0-i bow , and wrest this knife out of [mine]0-i hand ; and [thou]2120-the knight canst bind [me]0-i and make [me]0-i fast to the saddle , and so lead [my]0-i helpless body into thraldom and death . But [thou]2120-the knight hast said that [thou]2120-the knight lovest [me]0-i , and [I]0-i believe [thee]2120-the knight herein . Therefore [I]0-i know that [thou]2120-the knight canst not will to do this .

[He]2120-the knight answered in [his]2120-the knight surly voice : [Thou]2120-the knight art right , [lady]504-lady , [I]0-i can not . Nay , hearken [thou]2120-the knight this time . [I]0-i have been turning over night - long what [thou]2120-the knight didst say about leaving [[my]0-i lord]2574-my lord , that is , betraying [him]2574-my lord , for it comes to that ; and now [I]0-i have made up [my]0-i mind to do it , and [I]0-i will betray [him]2574-my lord for [thy]2120-the knight sake . Wherefore there is a third way to take which [thou]2120-the knight hast not seen ; [we]3251-we will ride out of [this dale]2941-this dale in an hour 's time , and [I]0-i will bring [thee]2120-the knight to [[them]3253-them who are only less [the mortal foes of [the Red Knight]141-the red knight]3255-the mortal foes of the red knight than are [[thy]2120-the knight fellows of [the Quest]31-the quest]3256-thy fellows of the quest , to wit , to [the captain and burgesses of [the good town of Greenford]3258-the good town of greenford by [the Water]7-the water]3257-the captain and burgesses of the good town of greenford by the water]3254-them who are only less the mortal foes of the red knight than are thy fellows of the quest , to wit , to the captain and burgesses of the good town of greenford by the water ; and [I]0-i will do [them]3253-them to wit that [I]0-i have rescued [thee]2120-the knight from the hands of [the Red Knight]141-the red knight , and am become [[his]141-the red knight foe]3259-his foe ; and will show [them]3253-them all [his]141-the red knight incomings and outgoings , and every whit of rede , and entrap [him]141-the red knight , so that [he]141-the red knight fall into [their]3253-them hands . Now , though were [I]0-i to be taken in battle by [them]3253-them , [I]0-i should be speedily brought to the halter , or may be to the bale - fire for [we]3260-we be wizards all in [the Red Hold]49-the red hold ; yet with this word in [my]0-i mouth , if [they]3253-them trow in it , [I]0-i shall be made [[their]3253-them captain]3261-their captain , and presently [[their]3253-them master]3262-their master . Trow in [my]0-i tale [they]3253-them will , if [thou]3263-thee bear [me]0-i out therein , and [they]3253-them will honour [thee]3263-thee , and suffer [thee]3263-thee to give [thyself]3264-thyself to [me]0-i in marriage ; and then [I]0-i know [thee]3263-thee , and [myself]0-i also , and that ere long [we]3265-we shall be both mighty and wealthy and beloved , and fair will be the days before [us]3265-we .

[His]3266-thou voice had grown softer as [he]3266-thou spake , and toward the end of [his]3266-thou words [he]3266-thou faltered , and at last brake out a - weeping , and cast [himself]3266-thou wordless on the grass before [her]3263-thee .

[She]3263-thee was pale , and [her]3263-thee brow was knitted , and [her]3263-thee face quivered ; but [she]3263-thee spake coldly to [him]3266-thou and said : This way [I]0-i can not take ; and [I]0-i wonder at [thee]3266-thou that [thou]3266-thou hast shown it unto [me]0-i , for [thyself]3266-thou [thou]3266-thou knowest that [I]0-i can not go with [thee]3266-thou . [I]0-i will go nowhere hence save to [the Castle of [the Quest]31-the quest]1931-the castle of the quest . If [thou]3266-thou wilt not lead [me]0-i thereto , or put [me]0-i on [the road]2103-the road , [I]0-i ask [thee]3266-thou straight , Wilt [thou]3266-thou stay [me]0-i if [I]0-i go seek the way thither [myself]0-i ?

[He]3266-thou rose up from the ground with a pale face full of anger as well as grief , and caught [her]0-i by the wrists and said , scowling the while : Tell [me]0-i now which of [them]3269-they it is ; is it [the stupid oaf Baudoin]3270-the stupid oaf baudoin , or [the light fool Hugh]3271-the light fool hugh , or [the dull pedant Arthur]3272-the dull pedant arthur ? But it matters not ; for [I]0-i know , and [all the country - side]3273-all the country - side knows , that [they]3269-they be vowed , [each man of [them]3269-they]3274-each man of them , to [[his]3274-each man of them own woman]3275-his own woman ; and if [they]3269-they find not [the women [themselves]3269-they]3276-the women themselves , such dolts [they]3269-they are , that [they]3269-they will ever be worshipping the mere shadows of [them]3269-they , and turn away from flesh and blood , were it the fairest in [the world]430-the world , as [thou]3278-thou art , as [thou]3278-thou art .

[She]3275-his own woman shrank away from [him]3274-each man of them what [she]3275-his own woman might , but [he]3274-each man of them still held [her]3275-his own woman wrists ; then [she]3275-his own woman spake in a quivering voice , [her]3275-his own woman very lips pale with fear and wrath : It is well seen that [thou]3278-thou art [a man of the Red Knight]3279-a man of the red knight ; and belike [thou]3278-thou wouldst do with [me]0-i as [he]3274-each man of them would . But one thing [I]0-i crave of [thee]3275-his own woman , if there is any grain of mercy in [thee]3275-his own woman , that [thou]3278-thou wilt draw [thy]3278-thou sword and thrust [me]0-i through ; [thou]3278-thou mayst leave [thine]3280-thine hold of [me]0-i to get at the blade , [I]0-i will not stir from where [I]0-i stand . O ! to think that [I]0-i deemed [thee]3275-his own woman well - nigh [a true man]3281-a true man .

[He]3274-each man of them dropped [her]3275-his own woman hands now and stood aloof from [her]3275-his own woman , staring at [her]3275-his own woman , and presently cast [himself]3274-each man of them on the ground , rolling about and tearing at the grass . [She]3275-his own woman looked on [him]3274-each man of them a moment or two , and then stepped forward and stooped to [him]3274-each man of them , and touched [his]3274-each man of them shoulder and said : Rise up , [I]0-i bid [thee]3275-his own woman , and be [a man]234-a man and not a wild beast .

So in a while [he]3274-each man of them arose , and stood before [her]3275-his own woman hang - dog - like ; then [she]3275-his own woman looked on [him]3274-each man of them pitifully , and said : [Fair sir and valiant knight]3283-fair sir and valiant knight , [thou]3275-his own woman hast gone out of [thy]3275-his own woman mind for a while , and thus hast [thou]3275-his own woman shamed both [me]0-i and [thyself]3284-thyself ; and now [thou]3275-his own woman wert best forget it , and therewithal [my]0-i last words to [thee]3275-his own woman .

Therewith [she]3275-his own woman held out [her]3275-his own woman hand to [him]3274-each man of them , and [he]3274-each man of them went on [his]3274-each man of them knees and took it , sobbing , and kissed it . But [she]3275-his own woman said , and smiled on [him]3274-each man of them : Now [I]0-i see that [thou]3275-his own woman wilt do what [I]0-i prayed of [thee]3274-each man of them , and lead [me]0-i hence and put [me]0-i on the road to [the Castle of [the Quest]31-the quest]1931-the castle of the quest . [He]3274-each man of them said : [I]0-i will lead [thee]3275-his own woman to [the Castle of the Quest]1931-the castle of the quest .

Said [Birdalone]101-birdalone : Then shall it be as [I]0-i promised , that [I]0-i will be [[thy]3275-his own woman dear friend]3287-thy dear friend while both [we]3288-we live . And now , if [thou]3275-his own woman canst , be a little merrier , and come and sit with [me]0-i , and let [us]3288-we eat [our]3288-we meat , for [I]0-i hunger .

[He]3274-each man of them smiled , but woefully , and presently [they]3288-we sat down to [their]3288-we meat ; and [he]3274-each man of them strove to be somewhat merry of mood , and to eat as one at a feast ; but whiles [his]3274-each man of them heart failed [him]3274-each man of them , and [he]3274-each man of them set [his]3274-each man of them teeth and tore at the grass , and [his]3274-each man of them face was fierce and terrible to look on ; but [Birdalone]101-birdalone made as if [she]101-birdalone heeded it nought , and was blithe and debonair with [him]3274-each man of them . And when [they]3288-we had done [their]3288-we meat [he]3274-each man of them sat looking at [her]101-birdalone a while , and at last [he]3274-each man of them said : [Lady]504-lady , dost [thou]101-birdalone deem that , when all is said , [I]0-i have done somewhat for [thee]101-birdalone since first [we]3288-we met the day before yesterday at [the lower end of [the Black Valley]43-the black valley]3290-the lower end of the black valley ? [Yea]3291-yea , [she]101-birdalone said , as erst [I]0-i spake , all things considered [I]0-i deem that [thou]3292-thou hast done much . And now , said [he]3274-each man of them , [I]0-i am to do more yet ; for [I]0-i am to lead [thee]101-birdalone to where henceforth [I]0-i shall have no more part or lot in [thee]101-birdalone than if [thou]3292-thou wert in [heaven]3293-heaven and [I]0-i in [hell]3294-hell . [I]0-i pray [thee]101-birdalone say not so , said [Birdalone]101-birdalone ; have [I]0-i not said that [I]0-i will be [[thy]101-birdalone friend]2239-thy friend ? [Lady]504-lady , said [the knight]2120-the knight , [I]0-i wot well that according to the sweetness of thine heart wilt [thou]3292-thou do what [thou]3292-thou canst do . And therewith [he]2120-the knight was silent a while and [she]504-lady also .

Then [he]2120-the knight said : [I]0-i would ask [thee]504-lady a grace if [I]0-i durst . Ask it , said [she]504-lady , and [I]0-i will grant it if [I]0-i may ; [I]0-i have gainsaid [thee]101-birdalone enough meseemeth .

[Lady]504-lady , [he]2120-the knight said , [I]0-i will ask this as a reward of [the way - leader]3299-the way - leader , to wit , that [thou]504-lady abide with [me]0-i here in [this dale]2941-this dale , in all honour holden , till to - morrow morning ; and let this place , which has helped [me]0-i aforetime , be hallowed by [[thy]504-lady dwelling here]3301-thy dwelling here ; and [I]0-i , [I]0-i shall have had one happy day at least , if never another . Canst [thou]504-lady grant [me]0-i this ? If [thou]504-lady canst not , [we]3302-we will depart in an hour .

[Her]504-lady countenance fell at [his]2120-the knight word , and [she]504-lady was silent a while ; for sore [she]504-lady longed to be speedily whereas [[her]504-lady friends]1314-her friends should find [her]504-lady if [they]1314-her friends came back to [the castle]1838-the castle . But [she]504-lady thought within [herself]504-lady how wild and fierce [the man]2926-the man was , and doubted if [he]2926-the man might not go stark mad on [her]504-lady hands and destroy [her]504-lady if [she]504-lady thwarted overmuch ; and , moreover , frankly [she]504-lady pitied [him]2926-the man , and would do what [she]504-lady might to ease [his]2926-the man pain and solace [his]2926-the man grief of heart . Wherefore [she]504-lady cleared [her]504-lady face of its trouble and let it be vexed no longer , but smiled upon [the knight]2120-the knight and said : [Fair sir]2215-fair sir , [this meseemeth]3308-this meseemeth but a little thing for [me]0-i to do , and [I]0-i grant it [thee]2120-the knight with a good will , and this shall now be the first day of the friendship if so [thou]3309-thou wilt take it ; and may it solace [thee]2120-the knight .

Who then was gleeful but [the knight]2120-the knight , and strange it was to see all [his]2120-the knight sorrow run off [him]2120-the knight ; and [he]2120-the knight became glad and gamesome as [a youth]3311-a youth , and yet withal exceeding courteous and kind with [her]504-lady , as though [he]2120-the knight were serving [a mighty queen]3312-a mighty queen .

So then [they]3313-they wore the day together in all good fellowship ; and first [they]3313-they went up [the dale]2735-the dale together and right to the foot of that great force , where [the stream]2085-the stream came thundering down from [the sheer rocks]2913-the sheer rocks ; and long [Birdalone]101-birdalone stood to look thereon , and much [she]101-birdalone marvelled at it , for no such thing had [she]101-birdalone seen before .

Thereafter [they]3313-they went afoot into the wood behind the green bower , and when [they]3313-they had gone some way therein for [their]3313-they pleasure , [they]3313-they fell to seeking venison for [their]3313-they dinner ; and [the knight]2120-the knight took [Birdalone]101-birdalone 's bow and shafts to strike the quarry withal , but [he]2120-the knight would have [her]2120-the knight gird [his]2120-the knight sword to [her]101-birdalone , that [she]101-birdalone might not be weaponless . So [they]3313-they gat [them]3313-they a roe and came back therewith to the bower , and [the knight]2120-the knight dight it and cooked it , and again [they]3313-they ate in fellowship and kindness ; and [Birdalone]101-birdalone had been to [the river]2277-the river and fetched thence store of blue- flowered mouse - ear , and of [meadow - sweet]3320-meadow - sweet , whereof was still some left from the early days of summer , and had made [her]101-birdalone garlands for [her]101-birdalone head and [her]101-birdalone loins ; and [the knight]2120-the knight sat and worshipped [her]101-birdalone , yet [he]2120-the knight would not so much as touch [her]101-birdalone hand , sorely as [he]2120-the knight hungered for the beauty of [her]101-birdalone body .

Next , when dinner was done , and [they]3313-they lay in the shadow of the trees , and hearkened the moor - hen crying from the water , and the moaning of the wood - doves in [the high trees]3322-the high trees , [she]101-birdalone turned to [him]2120-the knight and bade [him]2120-the knight tell [her]101-birdalone somewhat of the tale of [his]2120-the knight life and deeds ; but [he]2120-the knight said : Nay , [lady]504-lady , [I]0-i pray [thee]504-lady pardon [me]0-i , for little have [I]0-i to tell [thee]504-lady that is good , and [I]0-i would not have [thee]504-lady know of [me]0-i aught worse than [thou]504-lady knowest of [me]0-i already . Rather be [thou]504-lady kind to [me]0-i , and tell [me]0-i of [thy]504-lady days that have been , wherein [I]0-i know full surely shall be nought but good .

[She]504-lady smiled and blushed , but without more ado fell to telling [him]2120-the knight of [her]504-lady life in [the House under the Wood]2453-the house under the wood , and spared not even to tell [him]2120-the knight somewhat of [the wood - mother]934-the wood - mother . And [he]2120-the knight said no word to [her]504-lady thereover , save thanks and praises for the kindness of [her]504-lady story .

At last the day wore to its ending , and then [the knight]2120-the knight 's grief strode over [him]2120-the knight again , and [he]2120-the knight was moody and few - spoken ; and [Birdalone]101-birdalone was blithe with [him]2120-the knight still , and would have solaced [his]2120-the knight grief ; but [he]2120-the knight said : Let it be ; as for [thee]504-lady , [thou]504-lady shalt be happy to - morrow , but this happy day of [mine]2120-the knight is well - nigh worn , and it is as the wearing of [my]0-i life . And the dark night came , and [he]2120-the knight bade [her]504-lady good - night sorrowfully , and departed to [his]2120-the knight lair in [the wood]348-the wood . [Birdalone]101-birdalone lay in the bower , and might not sleep a long while for [her]504-lady joy of the morrow , which should bring [her]504-lady back to [the Castle of the Quest]1931-the castle of the quest .

But when morning was , and the sun was but just risen , [Birdalone]101-birdalone awoke , and stood up and did on [her]101-birdalone raiment , and called [[her]101-birdalone servant]3329-her servant [the knight]2120-the knight , and [he]2120-the knight came at once leading the two horses , and said : Now go [we]3331-they to [the Castle of [the Quest]31-the quest]59-the castle of the quest . And [he]2120-the knight was sober and sorrowful , but nought fierce or wild .

So [Birdalone]101-birdalone thanked [him]2120-the knight kindly and praised [him]2120-the knight , and [he]2120-the knight changed countenance no whit therefor .

Then [they]3331-they mounted and set forth , and [the knight]2120-the knight led straight into [the wood]348-the wood , and by roads that [he]2120-the knight wotted of , so that [they]3331-they went nowise slowly for wenders through [the thick woodland]3334-the thick woodland . Thus went [they]3331-they on [their]3331-they way together , [he]2120-the knight sorry and [she]101-birdalone glad .

But now leaves the tale to tell of [Birdalone]101-birdalone and [the knight on whom [she]101-birdalone happened in [the Black Valley]43-the black valley of the Greywethers]3335-the knight on whom she happened in the black valley of the greywethers , and turns to [the Castle of the Quest]1931-the castle of the quest and [the folk thereof]3337-the folk thereof , and what [they]3331-they did in this while and thereafter .

Here ends the Fourth Part of [the Water of [the Wondrous Isles]1-the wondrous isles]1065-the water of the wondrous isles , which is called Of [the Days of Abiding]3339-the days of abiding , and the Fifth Part now begins , which is called The Tale of [the Quest]31-the quest 's Ending .

THE FIFTH PART : THE TALE OF [THE QUEST]31-the quest 'S ENDING[145-birdalone]

CHAPTER I. OF [SIR LEONARD]145-birdalone 'S TROUBLE AND THE COMING OF [THE QUEST]31-the quest[145-birdalone]

Tells the tale that when [the chaplain]2413-the chaplain had departed from [Birdalone]145-birdalone at the bower in the copse , [he]2413-the chaplain went [home]387-home to [the castle]1838-the castle sadly enough , because of [his]2413-the chaplain love and longing for [her]101-birdalone , which well [he]2413-the chaplain wotted might never be satisfied . Moreover when [he]2413-the chaplain was come into [the castle]1838-the castle again , there fell fear upon [him]2413-the chaplain for what might betide [her]101-birdalone , and [he]2413-the chaplain rued it that [he]2413-the chaplain had done [her]101-birdalone will in getting [her]101-birdalone forth of [the castle]1838-the castle ; and in vain now [he]2413-the chaplain set before [himself]2413-the chaplain all the reasons for deeming that [her]101-birdalone peril herein was little or nothing , even as [he]2413-the chaplain had laid them before [her]101-birdalone , and which [he]2413-the chaplain then believed in utterly , whereas now himseemed there was an answer to [every one of [them]3346-them]3345-every one of them .
