Now hearken ; [I]0-i say that [thou]3828-thee hast made [thee]3828-thee [[my]0-i foe]3832-my foe , and [I]0-i have overcome [thee]3828-thee ; [thou]3828-thee art [my]0-i runaway thrall , and [I]0-i have caught [thee]3828-thee . As [my]0-i foe [I]0-i might slay [thee]3828-thee in any evil way it might like [me]0-i ; as [my]0-i thrall [I]0-i might well chastise [thee]3828-thee as sharply and as bitterly as [I]0-i would . But it is not [my]0-i pleasure to slay [thee]3828-thee , rather [I]0-i will bring [thee]3828-thee to the Red Hold , and there see what [we]3839-we may make of [thee]3828-thee ; whereas [I]0-i can not but deem that in [thee]3828-thee is the making of somewhat more than a thrall ; and if not , then a thrall must [thou]3828-thee needs be . Again as to the chastising of [thee]3828-thee , that also [I]0-i forgive [thee]3828-thee since [I]0-i have gotten the hope aforesaid . Yet forsooth some shame must [I]0-i do [thee]3828-thee to pay [thee]3828-thee back for the love that was betwixt [thee]3828-thee and [the slain man]3840-the slain man . [I]0-i will ponder what it shall be ; but take heed that whatsoever it shall be , it will not avail [thee]3828-thee to pray [me]0-i to forego it , though [thy]3828-thee speech be as fair and sweet as [thy]3828-thee body .

Therewith [he]3840-the slain man was silent a while , and [I]0-i stood there not daring to move , and [my]0-i heart was so downcast that all the sweetness of life seemed departed . Yet [I]0-i withheld lamentations or prayers , thinking within [myself]0-i , who knows what occasion may be between this and the Red Hold for [my]0-i escaping ; let [me]0-i keep [myself]0-i alive for that if it may be .

Presently [he]3840-the slain man arose and took [his]3840-the slain man sword , and went up to [the slain man]3840-the slain man 's body and smote the head from off it . Then [he]3840-the slain man went to [the two horses of [Sir Thomas]159-sir thomas and of [me]0-i]3842-the two horses of sir thomas and of me , and took from [them]3842-the two horses of sir thomas and of me such gear of girths and thongs as [he]3840-the slain man would , and therewith [he]3840-the slain man dight [me]0-i as [ye]3843-ye saw , doing a girth about [my]0-i middle and making [me]0-i fast to a line wherewith to hold [me]0-i in tow . And then [he]3840-the slain man did that other thing which sickens [my]0-i very soul to tell of , to wit , that [he]3840-the slain man took [the slain man]3840-the slain man 's head and tied a lace thereto , and hung it about [my]0-i neck ; and as [he]3840-the slain man did so , [he]3840-the slain man said : This jewel shalt [thou]3845-thee [thyself]3845-thee bear to [[mine]3840-the slain man house]3846-mine house ; and there belike shall [we]3847-we lay it in [earth]464-earth , since [the man]2926-the man was [[my]0-i trusty fellow]3850-my trusty fellow . [Lo]128-lo now , this is all the ill [I]0-i shall do [thee]3845-thee till it be tried of what avail [thou]3845-thee art . This is a shaming to [thee]3845-thee and not a torment , for [I]0-i will ride a foot's - pace , and the green way is both soft and smooth ; wherefore fear not that [I]0-i shall throw [thee]3845-thee down or drag [thee]3845-thee along . And to - morrow [thy]3845-thee shame shall be gone and [we]3847-we shall see what is to betide .

[Lo]128-lo , [friends]416-friends , this is the last word [he]2926-the man spake ere [he]2926-the man was slain , and the ending of [my]0-i tale ; for [we]3847-we had gone thus but a little way ere [ye]3852-ye brake out of the wood upon [us]3847-we ; and then befell the death of [one friend]3853-one friend , and the doubt , maybe , of the others , and all the grief and sorrow that [I]0-i shall never be quit of unless [ye]3852-ye forgive [me]0-i where [I]0-i have done amiss , and help [me]0-i in the days to come . And [she]3845-thee spread out [her]3845-thee hands before them , and bowed [her]3845-thee head , and the tears fell from [her]3845-thee eyes on to the floor .

[Viridis]116-viridis wept at [Birdalone]145-birdalone 's weeping , and [Aurea]116-viridis for [her]116-viridis own sorrow , which this other sorrow stirred . [Atra]117-atra wept not , but [her]117-atra face was sadder than weeping .

But [Arthur]157-arthur spake and said : Herein hath been the hand of [Weird]161-weird , and hath been heavy on [us]3847-we ; but no blame have [we]3847-we to lay on [[our]3847-we sister]2341-our sister [Birdalone]145-birdalone , nor hath [she]2341-our sister done light - mindedly by [us]3847-we ; though maybe [she]2341-our sister erred in not trusting to the good - hap of the Quest to bring [us]3847-we back in due time : and all that [she]2341-our sister saith do [we]3847-we trow as if it were written in the Holy Gospel . [They]3855-them all yeasaid this , and called on [her]2341-our sister to come amongst [them]3855-them ; but [she]2341-our sister thought of little at first save the joy of hearing the sweetness of those words as [Arthur]157-arthur spake them ; wherefore [she]2341-our sister hung back a little , and thought shame of it that [she]2341-our sister might not give more heed to the others of [them]3855-them . Then came [Viridis]116-viridis and took [her]2341-our sister by the hand and led [her]2341-our sister to [Sir Hugh]124-hugh , and [Birdalone]145-birdalone knelt down before [him]124-hugh and took [his]124-hugh hand to kiss it , but [he]124-hugh put both hands about [her]2341-our sister face and kissed [her]2341-our sister kindly and merrily on the lips . Then [she]2341-our sister knelt before [Aurea]116-viridis , and was hapless before [her]2341-our sister ; but [Aurea]116-viridis kissed [her]2341-our sister , and bade [her]2341-our sister be of better cheer , albeit the words came coldly from [her]2341-our sister mouth . Next [she]2341-our sister came to [Arthur]157-arthur , and knelt before [him]157-arthur and took [his]157-arthur hand and kissed it , and thanked [him]157-arthur kindly for [his]157-arthur kind words , looking into [his]157-arthur face meanwhile ; and [she]2341-our sister saw that it was pale and troubled now , and [she]2341-our sister longed to be alone with [him]157-arthur that [she]2341-our sister might ask [him]157-arthur wherefore .

As for [Atra]117-atra , [she]2341-our sister arose as [Birdalone]145-birdalone came before [her]2341-our sister , and cast [her]2341-our sister arms about [her]2341-our sister neck , and wept and sobbed upon [her]2341-our sister bosom , and then went hurrying from out [the solar]3715-the solar and into [the hall]1202-the hall , and walked to and fro there a while until the passion that tore [her]2341-our sister was lulled somewhat , and [she]2341-our sister might show [her]2341-our sister face to [them]3858-them calm and friendly once more . And as [she]2341-our sister entered [Arthur]157-arthur was speaking , and [he]157-arthur said :

To [you]2341-our sister , [ladies]1677-ladies , [I]0-i tell what [we]3860-our of [the castle]1838-the castle wot better than well , that [[our]3860-our dear friend]3862-our dear friend hath escaped so heavy a fate in escaping the Red Hold , that it were unmeet for [us]3860-our to murmur at [our]3860-our loss in [[our]3860-our fellow]3629-our fellow ; for [a warrior]3864-a warrior 's life , which is ever in peril of death , is nought over heavy a ransom for [such a friend , and so dear and lovely , from such a long and evil death]3865-such a friend , and so dear and lovely , from such a long and evil death . Whereas [ye]2341-our sister must wot that [the said Hold]3542-the said hold hath this long while been [a very treasure - house of woes]3867-a very treasure - house of woes and a coffer of lamentations ; for merciless was [the tyrant thereof]3868-the tyrant thereof , and merciless [all [his]3868-the tyrant thereof folk]3869-all his folk . Now another time , when [ye]2341-our sister are stronger in heart than now [ye]2341-our sister be , [I]0-i may tell [you]2341-our sister tales thereof closer and more nicely of those who did [his]3868-the tyrant thereof will ; as of [[his]3868-the tyrant thereof innermost band of [men - at - arms]2059-men - at - arms]3870-his innermost band of men - at - arms , called [the Millers]3872-the millers ; and of [[his]3868-the tyrant thereof fellow - worker]3873-his fellow - worker in [wizardry and venoms]3874-wizardry and venoms , called [the Apothecary]3875-the apothecary ; and the three hags , called [the Furies]3876-the furies ; and [the three young women]3877-the three young women , called [the Graces]3878-the graces ; and [his]3868-the tyrant thereof hounds that love [man]548-man 's flesh ; and the like tales , as evil as nightmares turned into deeds of the day . But now and here will [I]0-i say this , that when [we]3880-we have done the obsequies of [[our]3880-we dear fellow]3881-our dear fellow , it were good that [we]3880-we follow up the battle so valiantly begun by [him]3881-our dear fellow . [I]0-i mean that the Quest of [[our]3880-we ladies]3882-our ladies being now accomplished , [we]3880-we should turn what is left of [the fellowship]3883-the fellowship into a war against the Red Hold and its evil things ; and that so soon as the relics of [Baudoin]123-baudoin are laid in [earth]464-earth , [we]3880-we gather force and go thither in arms to live or die in the quarrel , and so sweeten [the earth]445-the earth , as did [the men of ancient days]3886-the men of ancient days when [they]3886-the men of ancient days slew the dragons and the giants , and [the children of hell]3887-the children of hell , and [the sons of [Cain]162-cain]3888-the sons of cain .

[His]3881-our dear fellow cheek flushed as [he]3881-our dear fellow spoke , and [he]3881-our dear fellow looked around till [his]3881-our dear fellow eyes fell on [Birdalone]145-birdalone , and [he]3881-our dear fellow saw that [her]3889-her face also glowed and [her]3889-her eyes gleamed ; but Viridis , [her]3889-her heart sank so that [she]3889-her paled , and [her]3889-her lips trembled .

But [Aurea]116-viridis spake and said : [I]0-i thank [thee]116-viridis for [thy]116-viridis word , [Black Squire]125-arthur , and [I]0-i know that [[my]0-i man]268-my man shall rejoice in [Paradise]55-paradise when [he]268-my man knoweth of it , and thereof shall [I]0-i tell [him]268-my man to - morrow when the mass is said for [him]268-my man .

And [Atra]117-atra said : Good is the word , and [we]3891-we look to it that the deed shall be better yet . Thus hath the evil arisen that shall destroy the evil , as oft hath been when [the valiant]3892-the valiant have been grieved , and the joy of the true - hearted hath been stolen from [them]3892-the valiant ; then the hand doth the doughty deed and the heart hath ease , and solaced is sorrow .

[They]3893-they looked on [her]3889-her and wondered , for [she]3889-her spake with [her]3889-her head upraised and [her]3889-her eyes glittering , as [she]3889-her had been [one of [the wise women of yore agone]3895-the wise women of yore agone]3894-one of the wise women of yore agone . And [Birdalone]145-birdalone feared [her]3889-her , though [she]3896-she loved [her]3889-her .

[Lastly]163-lastly spake [Hugh]124-hugh , and said : [Brother]164-brother , this is well thought of indeed , and [I]0-i marvel that [I]0-i did not prevent [thee]164-brother ; and [I]0-i am thine to live and die with [thee]164-brother . And the adventure is nought unlikely ; for if [we]3897-us have lost [a captain]3898-a captain [they]3898-a captain have lost [their]3898-a captain head devil , and [their]3898-a captain head little devil ; moreover , [the good men of [Greenford]45-greenford]3899-the good men of greenford shall join [them]3898-a captain to [us]3897-us , and that shall make [us]3897-us strong , whereas [they]3898-a captain have [men]219-men enough , and [those stout men - at - arms]3901-those stout men - at - arms ; and [artificers]3902-artificers [they]3898-a captain have to make [us]3897-us engines , and do other wisdom ; and therewithal money to buy or to wage what [they]3898-a captain will . Wherefore , to [my]0-i mind , [we]3897-us were best to make no tarrying , but send out [the messengers]2356-the messengers for the hosting straightway .

Straightway , said [the Black Squire]125-arthur ; and let [us]3897-us go now and find [Sir Aymeris]138-sir aymeris . So [they]2356-the messengers arose both and went [their]2356-the messengers ways , and left [the women there]3904-the women there alone , and were gone a good while .

CHAPTER VIII . [ATRA]117-atra AND [BIRDALONE]145-birdalone TALK TOGETHER WHILE [THE LORDS]165-the lords SIT AT THE MURDER - COUNCIL

Meanwhile of [their]2356-the messengers absence , [Viridis]116-viridis sat sad and silent and downcast , though [she]116-viridis wept not , for [her]116-viridis gladness , which erst had been so great , seemed now reft from [her]116-viridis ; and no merrier was [Aurea]116-viridis , as might have been looked for . But [Atra]117-atra came quietly unto [Birdalone]145-birdalone , and said softly : [I]0-i have a word for [thee]145-birdalone if [thou]145-birdalone wilt come forth with [me]0-i into [the hall]1202-the hall . [Birdalone]145-birdalone 's heart failed [her]117-atra somewhat , but [she]117-atra suffered [Atra]117-atra to take [her]117-atra hand , and [they]2356-the messengers went into [the hall]1202-the hall together , and [Atra]117-atra brought [her]117-atra into a shot - window , and [they]2356-the messengers sat down together side by side and were silent awhile . [Spake Atra]117-atra then , trembling and reddening : [Birdalone]145-birdalone , knowest [thou]145-birdalone what thought , what hope , was in [my]0-i heart when [I]0-i spake so proudly and rashly e'en now ? [Birdalone]145-birdalone kept silence , and trembled as [the other]265-the other did . This it was , said [Atra]117-atra : [he]3908-he will go to this battle valiantly , [he]3908-he may fall there , and that were better ; for then is life to begin anew : and what is there to do with these dregs of life ? Said [Birdalone]145-birdalone , with flushed face : If [he]3908-he die [he]3908-he shall die goodly , and if [he]3908-he live [he]3908-he shall live goodly . Yea , yea , said [Atra]117-atra ; forsooth [thou]3909-thou art [a happy woman]3910-a happy woman ! Dost [thou]3909-thou hate [me]0-i ? said [Birdalone]145-birdalone . Said [Atra]117-atra : Proud is [thy]117-atra word , but [I]0-i hate [thee]117-atra not . Nay , e'en now , when [I]0-i spake thus boastfully , [I]0-i thought : When [he]3908-he hath died as [a doughty knight]3911-a doughty knight should , then , when life begins again , [Birdalone]145-birdalone and [I]0-i shall be [friends]416-friends and [sisters]1144-sisters , and [we]3914-we two will talk together oft and call [him]3908-he to mind , and the kindness of [him]3908-he , and how [he]3908-he loved [us]3914-we . Woe 's [me]0-i ! that was when [he]3908-he was there sitting beside [me]0-i and [I]0-i could see [him]3908-he and [his]3908-he kindness ; and then it was as if [I]0-i could give [him]3908-he away ; but now [he]3908-he is gone and [I]0-i may not see [him]3908-he , it is clear to [me]0-i that [I]0-i have no part or lot in [him]3908-he , and [I]0-i call back [my]0-i thought and [my]0-i word , and now it is : O that [he]3908-he may live ! [O [thou]3916-thou happy woman]3915-o thou happy woman , that shall be glad whether [he]3908-he liveth or dieth !

Said [Birdalone]145-birdalone : And now [thou]3916-thou hatest [me]0-i , dost [thou]3916-thou not , and [we]3917-we are [foes]3918-foes ? [Atra]117-atra answered not , nor spake for a while ; then [she]117-atra said : Hard and bitter is it , and [I]0-i know not what to turn to . [I]0-i have seen once and again , on the wall of [[the Minorites]3919-the minorites ' church at [Greenford]45-greenford]7138-the minorites ' church at greenford , a fair picture of [the Blessed]7139-the blessed , and [they]7139-the blessed walking in [the meads of Paradise]7140-the meads of paradise , clad in like raiment , [men]219-men and [women]433-women ; [their]7139-the blessed heads flower - crowned , [their]7139-the blessed feet naked in the harmless blossomed grass ; hand in hand [they]7139-the blessed walk , with all wrath passed for ever , all desire changed into loving- kindness , all the anguish of forgiveness forgotten . And underneath the picture is it writ :[117-atra]

Bitter winter , burning summer , never more shall waste and wear ; Blossom of the rose undying brings undying springtide there .

O for the hope of it , that [I]0-i might hope it ! O for the days to be and the assuaging of sorrow : [I]0-i speak the word , and the hope springeth ; the word is spoken , and there abideth desire barren of hope ! And [she]117-atra bowed down [her]117-atra head and wept bitterly ; and [Birdalone]145-birdalone called to mind [her]117-atra kindness of the past and wept for [her]117-atra , [she]117-atra also .

After a while [Atra]117-atra lifted up [her]117-atra head , and thus [she]117-atra spake : [I]0-i hate [thee]0-i not , [Birdalone]145-birdalone ; nor doth one say such things to [a foe]3920-a foe . [Yea]3921-yea , furthermore , [I]0-i will crave somewhat of [thee]0-i . If ever there come a time when [thou]3922-thou mayst do something for [me]0-i , [thou]3922-thou wilt know it belike without [my]0-i telling [thee]0-i . In that day and in that hour [I]0-i bid [thee]0-i remember how [we]3923-we stood together erst at the stair - foot of the Wailing Tower in [the Isle of Increase Unsought]22-the isle of increase unsought , and [thou]0-i naked and fearful and quaking , and what [I]0-i did to [thee]0-i that tide to comfort [thee]0-i and help and save [thee]0-i . And then when [thou]3922-thou hast called it to mind , do [thou]3922-thou for [me]0-i what [thou]3922-thou canst do . Wilt [thou]3922-thou promise this ? [Yea]3924-yea , yea , said [Birdalone]145-birdalone ; and with all the better will , that oft and over again have [I]0-i called it to mind . Wherefore [I]0-i behight [thee]0-i to let [me]0-i serve [thee]0-i if [I]0-i may whenso the occasion cometh , even if it be to [my]0-i own pain and grief ; for this [I]0-i know [thou]0-i meanest .

See [thou]0-i to this then , said [Atra]117-atra coldly ; and [thou]0-i shalt be the better for it in the long run belike : for [thou]0-i art [a happy woman]3910-a happy woman .

[She]117-atra arose as [she]117-atra spake , and said : [Hist]3926-he ! here come [the lords from the murder - council]3927-the lords from the murder - council ; and lo , now that [he]3926-he cometh , [my]0-i heart groweth evil toward [thee]0-i again , and well - nigh biddeth [me]0-i wish that [thou]0-i wert naked and helpless before [me]0-i again . Lo [my]0-i unhap ! that [he]3926-he should mark [my]0-i face that it shows as if [I]0-i were fain to do [thee]0-i a mischief . And nought of that would [I]0-i do ; for how should it avail [me]0-i , and [thou]0-i [[my]0-i fellow]3737-my fellow and [the faithful messenger of the Quest]3929-the faithful messenger of the quest ?

Now little of [her]117-atra last words did [Birdalone]145-birdalone meet , as into [the hall]1202-the hall came [Hugh]124-hugh and [Arthur]125-arthur ; and though [she]117-atra strove to sober [her]117-atra mind and think of [[her]117-atra [she]3931-her she - friend - friend]3931-her she - friend and [her]117-atra unhappiness , yet [she]117-atra could not choose but to be full of joy in [her]117-atra inmost heart now [she]117-atra knew without doubt that [she]117-atra was so well - beloved of [[her]117-atra beloved]3932-her beloved : and [she]117-atra deemed that [Atra]117-atra was in the right indeed to call [her]117-atra [a happy woman]3910-a happy woman .

So now [they]3934-they all went into [the solar]3715-the solar together , and sat [them]3934-they down with [the two others]2153-the two others ; and [Hugh]124-hugh did [them]3934-they to wit , how [they]3934-they had ordered all the matter of [the messengers who were to summon [the knights and [chiefs of thereabouts]3939-chiefs of thereabouts]3938-the knights and chiefs of thereabouts , and [the aldermen of [Greenford]45-greenford]3940-the aldermen of greenford , to meet at [the Castle of [the Quest]31-the quest]1931-the castle of the quest]3937-the messengers who were to summon the knights and chiefs of thereabouts , and the aldermen of greenford , to meet at the castle of the quest , that [they]3934-they might set afoot the hosting to go against [the Red Hold]49-the red hold .

CHAPTER IX . [HUGH]124-hugh TELLS THE STORY OF THE QUEST 'S ENDING .[124-hugh]

When this was said , and there had been silence a while , [Birdalone]145-birdalone took up the word , and spake meekly and sweetly , saying : [Dear friends]1325-dear friends , how it fared with [you]1325-dear friends on [the isle]642-the isle from the time of [my]0-i leaving [you]1325-dear friends , and how with [you]1325-dear friends , [true knights]3944-true knights , from the time of [your]1325-dear friends departure , [I]0-i both were fain to know for the tale 's sake , and also [I]0-i would take the telling thereof as a sign of [your]1325-dear friends forgiveness of [my]0-i transgression ; so [I]0-i would crave the same of [you]1325-dear friends but if it weary [you]1325-dear friends overmuch .

All [they]3934-they yeasaid [her]0-i kindly , and [Hugh]124-hugh spake and said : By [your]1325-dear friends leave , [fellows]1323-fellows , [I]0-i will tell in few words what betid [us]3946-we on [our]3946-we way to [the Isle of [Increase]25-increase Unsought]22-the isle of increase unsought , and then shall [Viridis]116-viridis take up the tale from the time that [Birdalone]145-birdalone left [the said isle]2317-the said isle in [[the witch]407-the witch 's ferry]782-the witch 's ferry . None said aught against it , and [Hugh]124-hugh went on : Short is [my]0-i tale of the journey : [We]3946-we came to [the Isle of Nothing]41-the isle of nothing on the morrow 's morn of [our]3946-we departure , and being warned of [thee]3950-thee , [Birdalone]145-birdalone , [we]3946-we abode [there]232-there but a little while to rest [us]3946-we from [the boat]859-the boat , and went nowhither from [the strand]660-the strand , and so went on [our]3946-we way in a three hours ' space .[3946-we]

Thence again [we]3946-we took the water , and came to [the Isle of Kings]2472-the isle of kings , and that was in the middle of the night : [we]3946-we beheld the dead long and heedfully when the morning came , and departed again before noon , and came to [the Isle of Queens]2473-the isle of queens a little after nightfall . The next morning [we]3946-we deemed [we]3946-we needs must go see the images of [those ladies]1806-those ladies , lest aught might have befell since [thou]3957-thou wert there which might be of import to [the Quest]31-the quest , but all was unchanged , and [we]3946-we came away while the day was yet young .

[We]3946-we made [the Isle of [the Young]126-the young]28-the isle of the young and [the Old]1667-the old about sunset that day , and [the boy]1710-the boy and [the girl]3960-the girl came down to [the strand]660-the strand to behold [us]3946-we and wonder at [us]3946-we , and [we]3946-we sported with [them]1806-those ladies merrily a while ; and then [they]1806-those ladies brought [us]3946-we to [the house of [the old man]7080-the old man , who received [us]3946-we courteously and gave [us]3946-we to eat and drink]3962-the house of the old man , who received us courteously and gave us to eat and drink . [Forsooth]101-birdalone , when the night was somewhat spent , [he]7080-the old man brought out strong drink to [us]3946-we , and took it somewhat amiss that [we]3946-we drank not overmuch thereof , as forsooth [he]7080-the old man did , and so fell asleep . Before [he]7080-the old man was drunk [we]3946-we asked [him]7080-the old man many questions about [the isle]642-the isle and [its]642-the isle customs , but [he]7080-the old man knew nought to tell [us]3946-we of them . Of [thee]3965-thee also [we]3946-we asked , [sister]783-sister , but [he]7080-the old man had no memory of [thee]3965-thee .

On the morrow [he]7080-the old man fared down with [us]3946-we to [[our]3946-we ferry]3967-our ferry , and made many prayers to [us]3946-we to take [him]7080-the old man along with [us]3946-we ; for here , said [he]7080-the old man , is neither [lordship]3968-lordship nor [fair lady]2265-fair lady ; and if [here]259-here [I]0-i abide , soon shall [I]0-i come to [mine]0-i ending day , and sore [I]0-i yearn for joyance and a long term to [my]0-i years . Now [we]3946-we durst not take [him]7080-the old man aboard lest [we]3946-we should fare amiss with the wight of [the Sending Boat]832-the sending boat ; so [we]3946-we naysaid [him]7080-the old man courteously , thanked [him]7080-the old man for [his]7080-the old man guesting , and gave [him]7080-the old man gifts , to wit , a finger gold ring and an ouch of gold , so [he]7080-the old man turned away from [us]3946-we somewhat downcast as [we]3946-we deemed ; but ere [we]3946-we had given the word to [the Sending]3972-the sending [Boat]56-boat [we]3946-we heard [him]7080-the old man singing merrily in a high cracked voice as [he]7080-the old man went on [his]7080-the old man way .

Now on this last day betid somewhat of new tidings ; for scarce was [this isle]1498-this isle out of sight behind , ere [we]3946-we saw [a boat]688-a boat come sailing toward [us]3946-we from [the north - east]3975-the north - east , and it came on swiftly with a blue ripple of [the lake]369-the lake behind it . Thereat [we]3946-we marvelled , and yet more when [we]3946-we saw that [its]688-a boat sail was striped of gold and green and black ; next then were [we]3946-we betwixt fear and joy when , as it drew nigher , [we]3946-we saw three women in [the said boat]3977-the said boat , clad in gold , green , and black ; and it came so nigh unto [us]3946-we at last , that [we]3946-we could see [their]3978-their faces that [they]3978-their were verily those of [[our]3946-we lovelings]3626-our lovelings ; and [each]1584-each reached out [her]1584-each arms to [us]3946-we and called on [us]3946-we for help , each by [our]3946-we name : and there [we]3946-we were , oarless , sailless , at the mercy of [[our]3946-we unkenned ferry]3981-our unkenned ferry . Then would [Baudoin]123-baudoin and [I]0-i have leapt overboard to swim to [our]3946-we loves at all adventure ; but [Sir Arthur]157-arthur here stayed [us]3946-we , and bade [us]3946-we think of it , that [we]3946-we were now nearing [the Witch - land]3982-the witch - land , and if [we]3946-we might not look to be beset with guiles and gins to keep [us]3946-we from winning to [our]3946-we journey 's end ; wherefore [we]3946-we forbore , though in all wretchedness , and [the gay boat]3983-the gay boat ran down the wind away from [us]3946-we , and the breeze and the ripple passed away with it , and [the lake]369-the lake lay under the hot sun as smooth as glass ; and on [we]3946-we went , weary - hearted .

Came again another sail out of [the north - east]3975-the north - east , when the sun was getting low , and speedily it drew nigh , but this time it was [no small boat or [barge]3987-barge]3986-no small boat or barge , but [a tall ship with great sails , and goodly - towered [she]3988-a tall ship with great sails , and goodly - towered she was and shield - hung was and shield - hung]3988-a tall ship with great sails , and goodly - towered she was and shield - hung , and the basnets gleamed and the spears glittered from [her]3988-a tall ship with great sails , and goodly - towered she was and shield - hung castle - tops and bulwarks , and the sound of [her]3988-a tall ship with great sails , and goodly - towered she was and shield - hung horns came down the wind as [she]3988-a tall ship with great sails , and goodly - towered she was and shield - hung neared [us]3946-we . [We]3946-we two handled [our]3946-we weapons and did on [our]3946-we basnets , but [Arthur]157-arthur there , [he]157-arthur sat still , and said : Not over - wise is [the witch]407-the witch , that [she]407-the witch lets loose on [us]3946-we two sendings in one day so like unto [each other]580-each other . Hah , said [Baudoin]123-baudoin , be [we]3946-we wary though ; [they]3991-they are going to shoot . And sure enough [we]3946-we saw a line of [bowmen]3992-bowmen in [all the castles]3993-all the castles and even along , and a horn blew , and then forth flew the shafts , but whither [we]3946-we knew not , for [none]1226-none came anywhere anigh [us]3946-we ; and [Arthur]157-arthur laughed and said : A fair shot into the clouds ; but , by [[our]3946-we Lady]488-our lady ! if none shot better in [[our]3946-we country]3996-our country , [I]0-i would bear no armour for [their]3991-they shafts . But [we]3946-we two were confused and knew not what to think .

[The great ship]3997-the great ship flew past [us]3946-we on the wind as [the barge]3998-the barge had done , but when [she]3997-the great ship was about half a mile aloof [we]3946-we saw [her]3997-the great ship canvass fall to shivering and [her]3997-the great ship yards swaying round , and [Arthur]157-arthur cried out : [St. Nicholas]166-st. nicholas ! the play beginneth again ! [she]3997-the great ship is coming about !

Even so it was , and presently [she]3997-the great ship was bearing on [us]3946-we , and was ere long so close aboard that [we]3946-we could see [her]3997-the great ship every spar and rope , and [[her]3997-the great ship folk]3999-her folk all gathered to the windward , [knights]3601-knights , [sergeants]4001-sergeants , [archers]4002-archers , and [mariners]4003-mariners , to gaze at [us]3946-we and mock [us]3946-we ; and huge and devilish laughter arose from amongst [them]3999-her folk as [she]3997-the great ship ploughed the water so close beside [us]3946-we , that [one]515-one might well - nigh have cast a morsel of bread aboard [her]3997-the great ship ; for clear it was presently that [she]3997-the great ship had no mind to run [us]3946-we down .

Spake [Arthur]157-arthur then : There will be a fresh play presently , [[my]0-i mates]4005-my mates , but [ye]4005-my mates sit fast , for [meseemeth]4006-meseemeth this show is no more perilous than the other , though it be bigger .

Scarce were the words out of [his]157-arthur mouth , ere there was a stir amongst [the men gathered in the waist]4007-the men gathered in the waist , and lo , amidst a knot of [big and fierce mariners]4008-big and fierce mariners , [three women standing , pale , with flying hair]4009-three women standing , pale , with flying hair , and [their]4009-three women standing , pale , with flying hair hands bound behind [them]4009-three women standing , pale , with flying hair , and [one was clad in gold and another in green and the third in black]4010-one was clad in gold and another in green and the third in black ; and [their]4009-three women standing , pale , with flying hair faces were as the faces of [Aurea]116-viridis and [Viridis]116-viridis and [Atra]117-atra .

Then there came forth from [that ship]4011-that ship a huge cruel roar blent with mocking laughter that shamed [our]3946-we very hearts , and those evil things in the form of [mariners]4003-mariners took hold of [each one of [the ladies]2309-the ladies]4013-each one of the ladies and cast [them]4009-three women standing , pale , with flying hair overboard into [the gulf of the waters]4015-the gulf of the waters , first [Aurea]116-viridis , next [Viridis]116-viridis , and then [Atra]117-atra ; and [we]3946-we two stood up with [our]3946-we useless swords brandished and would have leapt over into [the deep]4016-the deep , but that [Arthur]157-arthur arose also and took hold of an arm of each of [us]3946-we and stayed [us]3946-we , and said : Nay , then , if [ye]4017-ye go , take [me]0-i with [you]4017-ye , and let [all the Quest]4018-all the quest sink down into [the deep]4016-the deep , and let [[our]3946-we lovelings]3626-our lovelings pine in captivity , and [Birdalone]101-birdalone lose [all [her]101-birdalone friends]4021-all her friends in one swoop , and [we]3946-we be known hereafter as [the fools of lovers]4022-the fools of lovers , [the unstable]4023-the unstable .

So [we]3946-we sat [us]3946-we down , but huge shrieking laughter rose up unblended from the keel of the evil thing , and then [they]4024-they let [her]101-birdalone go down the wind , and [she]101-birdalone went [her]101-birdalone way with flashing of arms , and streaming of banners and pennons , and blowing of horns , and the sun was setting over [the wide water]1087-the wide water .

But [Arthur]157-arthur spake : Cheer up , [brethren]2433-brethren ! see [ye]2433-brethren not how [this proud witch]4027-this proud witch is also but [an eyeless fool]4028-an eyeless fool to send [us]3946-we such a show , and the second time in one day to show [us]3946-we the images of [[our]3946-we dearlings]4029-our dearlings , who hours ago flitted past [us]3946-we in [the stripe - sailed boat]4030-the stripe - sailed boat ? Where , then , did [they]4024-they of [the ship]4031-the ship meet with [them]4024-they ? Nay , [lords]2319-lords , let not the anguish of love steal all [your]2433-brethren wits .

[We]3946-we saw [we]3946-we had been [fools to be so overcast by guile]4033-fools to be so overcast by guile , and yet were [we]3946-we exceeding ill at ease , and over - long the time seemed unto [us]3946-we until [we]3946-we should be come to [the Isle of Increase Unsought]22-the isle of increase unsought , and find [[our]3946-we lovelings]3626-our lovelings there .

Now was the night come , and [we]3946-we fell asleep , but belike were not often all asleep at once ; and at last it was , when [we]3946-we felt the dawn drawing near , though , the moon being down , it was the darkest of the summer night , that [we]3946-we were [all three]1245-all three awake , when all of a sudden [we]3946-we heard just astern the rushing of the water , as though some keel were cleaving it , and dimly in the dark [we]3946-we saw a sail as of [[a boat]688-a boat]688-a boat overhauling [us]3946-we . Close at hand there rang out a lamentable cry : O , are [ye]3946-we there , [fellows of the Quest]4038-fellows of the quest ? O , help [me]0-i , [friends]416-friends ! save [me]0-i and deliver [me]0-i , who am snatched away to be cast into the hands of [[my]0-i mistress]1415-my mistress that was . Help [me]0-i , [Baudoin]123-baudoin , [Hugh]124-hugh , [Arthur]157-arthur ! Help ! help !

Then all [we]3946-we knew the voice of [Birdalone]101-birdalone , and [Arthur]157-arthur leapt up , and would have been overboard in a trice had not [we]3946-we two held [him]157-arthur , and [he]157-arthur fought and cursed [us]3946-we well - favouredly , there is no nay thereto ; and meanwhile the wailing voice of [thee]4041-thee , [[my]0-i sister]1171-my sister , died out in the distance , and [the east]4043-the east grew grey , and dawn was come .

Then spake [Baudoin]123-baudoin : [Arthur]157-arthur , [[my]0-i brother]4044-my brother , dost [thou]4045-thou not mark that this also was of the same sort of show as [those two others]4046-those two others , and [thou]4045-thou who [wert]3946-we so wise before ? It is but beguilings to bring the Quest to nought ; wherefore call to mind [thy]4045-thou manhood and [thy]4045-thou much wisdom !

And [we]3946-we admonished [him]157-arthur and rebuked [him]157-arthur till [he]157-arthur became quiet and wise again , but was sad and downcast and silent . But [the Sending Boat]832-the sending boat sped on through the dawning , and when it was light [we]3946-we saw that [we]3946-we had [the Isle of [Increase]25-increase]1601-the isle of increase close aboard , and [we]3946-we ran ashore there just as the sun was rising . Fain were [we]3946-we then to get out of [the boat]859-the boat and feel earth under [our]3946-we feet . [We]3946-we took all [our]3946-we hards out of [the boat]859-the boat , and hid away under the roots of an old thorn a little mail wherein was [your]4051-ye raiment , [[my]0-i ladies]4052-my ladies , which [ye]4051-ye had lent to [Birdalone]101-birdalone ; then [we]3946-we did on [our]3946-we armour , and advised [us]3946-we of whereabout on [the isle]642-the isle [we]3946-we were , and [we]3946-we saw [the orchards and gardens]4054-the orchards and gardens before [us]3946-we , and [the great fair house]4055-the great fair house above all , even as [ye]4051-ye told [us]3946-we of [them]4054-the orchards and gardens , [Birdalone]101-birdalone .

Next , then , without more ado , [we]3946-we went [our]3946-we ways up through [the orchard]469-the orchard and [the gardens]4057-the gardens , and when [we]3946-we were well - nigh at the end of them , and in face of those many steps [ye]4051-ye spake of , [we]3946-we saw at the foot of [them]4054-the orchards and gardens [a tall woman clad in red scarlet , standing as if [she]4058-a tall woman clad in red scarlet , standing as if she abode our coming abode [our]3946-we coming]4058-a tall woman clad in red scarlet , standing as if she abode our coming . When [we]3946-we drew nigh [we]3946-we saw that [she]4058-a tall woman clad in red scarlet , standing as if she abode our coming was strong - looking , well - knit , white - skinned , yellow - haired , and blue - eyed , and might have been called [a fair woman]591-a fair woman , as to [her]4058-a tall woman clad in red scarlet , standing as if she abode our coming shaping , save that [her]4058-a tall woman clad in red scarlet , standing as if she abode our coming face was heavy , yet hard - looking , with thin lips and somewhat flagging cheeks , a face stupid , but proud and cruel .

[She]4058-a tall woman clad in red scarlet , standing as if she abode our coming hailed [us]3946-we as [we]3946-we came up , and said : [Men - at - arms]2059-men - at - arms , [ye]2059-men - at - arms be welcome to [[our]3946-we house]1679-our house , and [I]0-i bid [you]2059-men - at - arms to eat and drink and abide here .

Then [we]3946-we louted before [her]4058-a tall woman clad in red scarlet , standing as if she abode our coming , and bade [her]4058-a tall woman clad in red scarlet , standing as if she abode our coming Hail ; and [Baudoin]123-baudoin said : [Lady]504-lady , [thy]4058-a tall woman clad in red scarlet , standing as if she abode our coming bidding will [we]3946-we take ; yet have [we]3946-we an errand to declare ere [we]3946-we break bread with [thee]4058-a tall woman clad in red scarlet , standing as if she abode our coming , lest when it is told [we]3946-we be not so welcome as [ye]4058-a tall woman clad in red scarlet , standing as if she abode our coming tell [us]3946-we now . What is it ? said [she]4058-a tall woman clad in red scarlet , standing as if she abode our coming . Said [Baudoin]123-baudoin : [This man]1976-this man here is called [the Green Knight]1331-the green knight , and [this the Black Squire]4065-this the black squire , and [I]0-i am [the Golden Knight]1329-the golden knight ; and now will [we]3946-we ask [thee]4058-a tall woman clad in red scarlet , standing as if she abode our coming if [this isle]1498-this isle be called [the Isle of [Increase Unsought]32-increase unsought]2034-the isle of increase unsought ? Even so have [I]0-i called it , quoth [she]4058-a tall woman clad in red scarlet , standing as if she abode our coming , wherefore [I]0-i deem [none other]4069-none other will dare call it otherwise . It is well , quoth [Baudoin]123-baudoin ; but [we]3946-we have heard say that hereto had strayed [three dear friends of [ours]3946-we]4070-three dear friends of ours , [three maidens , who hight [Viridis]116-viridis , [the friend of [the Green Knight]124-hugh]4072-the friend of the green knight , and [Atra]117-atra , who is [the Black Squire]125-arthur 's , and [Aurea]116-viridis , who is [[mine]0-i own friend]4073-mine own friend , so [we]3946-we have come to take [them]4070-three dear friends of ours [home]387-home with [us]3946-we , since [they]4070-three dear friends of ours have been so long away from [[their]4070-three dear friends of ours land]1586-their land and [their]4070-three dear friends of ours loves]4071-three maidens , who hight viridis , the friend of the green knight , and atra , who is the black squire 's , and aurea , who is mine own friend , so we have come to take them home with us , since they have been so long away from their land and their loves . Now if [they]4070-three dear friends of ours be [[thy]0-i friends]2122-thy friends [thou]0-i wilt perchance let [them]4070-three dear friends of ours go for love 's sake and the eking of friendship ; but if [they]4070-three dear friends of ours be [[thy]0-i captives]4077-thy captives , then are [we]3946-we well willing to pay [thee]0-i ransom , not according to [their]4070-three dear friends of ours worth , for no treasure heaped up might come nigh it , but according to [thy]0-i desire , [lady]504-lady .

Laughed [the proud lady]4079-the proud lady scornfully and said : Big are [thy]0-i words , [Sir Knight]124-hugh : if [I]0-i had [these maidens]4080-these maidens in [my]0-i keeping [I]0-i would give [them]4080-these maidens unto [you]124-hugh for nothing , and deem that [I]0-i had the best of the bargain . But here are [they]4080-these maidens not . True it is that [I]0-i had here three thralls who were hight as [thou]0-i hast said ; but a while ago , not many days , [they]4080-these maidens transgressed against [me]0-i till [I]0-i chastised [them]4080-these maidens ; and then was [I]0-i weary of [them]4080-these maidens and would be quit of [them]4080-these maidens ; for [I]0-i need [no servants]4081-no servants [here]259-here , whereas [I]0-i [myself]0-i am enough for [myself]0-i . Wherefore [I]0-i sent [them]4080-these maidens away across [the water]361-the water to [[my]0-i sister]1171-my sister , who dwells in [a fair place hight [the House under [the Wood]6-the wood]2453-the house under the wood]4085-a fair place hight the house under the wood ; for [she]1171-my sister needeth [servants]1103-servants , because [the earth there]4088-the earth there yieldeth nought save to [the tiller]4089-the tiller and [the herdsman]4090-the herdsman and [the hunter]4091-the hunter , while here all cometh unsought . With [her]1171-my sister may [ye]4092-ye deal , for what [I]0-i know , and buy [the maidens whom [ye]4092-ye prize so high]4093-the maidens whom ye prize so high ; though belike [ye]4092-ye may have to give [her]1171-my sister other servants in [their]4093-the maidens whom ye prize so high place . For , indeed , a while ago [her]1171-my sister thrall fled from [her]1171-my sister and left [her]1171-my sister half undone , and it is said that [she]1171-my sister came hither in [her]1171-my sister shamelessness : but [I]0-i know not ; if [she]1171-my sister did , [she]1171-my sister slipped through [my]0-i fingers , or else [I]0-i would have made [her]1171-my sister rue [her]1171-my sister impudence . Now [meseemeth]4094-meseemeth , [Sir Knights]168-sir knights , here is enough of so small and foolish a matter ; and again [I]0-i pray [you]168-sir knights to enter [[my]0-i poor house]4095-my poor house , and take meat and drink along with [me]0-i , for [ye]168-sir knights be none the less welcome because of [your]168-sir knights errand , though it be a foolish one .

Now would [Sir Baudoin]123-baudoin have answered wrathfully , but [Arthur]125-arthur plucked at [his]125-arthur skirt , and [he]125-arthur yeasaid [the lady]1157-the lady 's bidding , though somewhat ungraciously ; but that [she]1157-the lady heeded nought ; [she]1157-the lady took [Sir Baudoin]123-baudoin by the hand and led [him]123-baudoin up [the stately perron]4097-the stately perron , and thence came [we]4098-we into [a pillared hall]4099-a pillared hall , as fair as might be . And there on the dais was a table dight with dainty meats and drinks , and [the lady]1157-the lady bade [us]4098-we thereto , and [we]4098-we sat to it .

Thereat was [the lady buxom and merry]4101-the lady buxom and merry : [Baudoin]123-baudoin scowled across the board ; [I]0-i was wary and silent ; but [Arthur]125-arthur was as blithe with [the lady]1157-the lady as [she]1157-the lady with [him]125-arthur ; nor did [I]0-i altogether marvel thereat , since [I]0-i knew [him]125-arthur wise of wit .

But when [we]4098-we were done with the meal , [the lady]1157-the lady stood up and said : Now , [Sir Knights]168-sir knights , [I]0-i will give [you]168-sir knights leave ; but [this house]4104-this house is as [your]168-sir knights own to roam through [all [its]4104-this house chambers]4105-all its chambers and pleasure [you]168-sir knights with its wonders and goodliness ; and when [ye]168-sir knights are weary of [the house]325-the house , then is [the orchard]469-the orchard and [the garden]1086-the garden free to [you]168-sir knights , and [all [the isle]642-the isle wheresoever [ye]168-sir knights will go]4109-all the isle wheresoever ye will go . And here in [this hall]4111-this hall is meat and drink for [you]168-sir knights whenso [ye]168-sir knights will ; but if [ye]168-sir knights would see [me]0-i again to - day , then shall [ye]168-sir knights meet [me]0-i where [ye]168-sir knights first happened on [me]0-i e'en now , at the foot of the great perron .

Then [she]0-i laid [her]0-i hand on [Arthur]125-arthur 's shoulder , and said : [[Thy]0-i big friend]4112-thy big friend may search out [every nook in [this house]4104-this house]4113-every nook in this house , and [every bush in [the whole island]4116-the whole island]4115-every bush in the whole island , and if [he]4112-thy big friend find there [the maidens [he]4112-thy big friend spake of]4117-the maidens he spake of , one or [all of [them]4117-the maidens he spake of]3481-all of them , then are [they]4117-the maidens he spake of a gift from [me]0-i unto [him]4112-thy big friend .

Therewith [she]0-i turned , and went out of [the hall]1202-the hall by a door in the side thereof ; and now already meseemed that though [the woman]252-the woman was hateful and thick - hearted and cruel , yet [she]252-the woman was become fairer , or seemed so , than when [we]4121-we first came on [her]252-the woman ; and for [my]0-i part [I]0-i pondered on what it might grow to , and fear of [her]252-the woman came into [my]0-i soul .

Now spake [Baudoin]123-baudoin : Fellows , let [us]4121-we get out into [the garden]1086-the garden at least ; for [this place]3239-this place is evil , and meseems it smells and tastes of tears and blood , and that evil wights that hate the life of [men]219-men are lurking in [the nooks thereof]4125-the nooks thereof . And lo , [[our]4121-we very [she]4126-our very she]4126-our very she - friend that was so kind and simple and dainty with [us]4121-we , there is , as it were , the image of [the dear maiden standing trembling and naked before the stupid malice of this lump of flesh]4127-the dear maiden standing trembling and naked before the stupid malice of this lump of flesh . So spake [he]4128-he , [Birdalone]101-birdalone .

But [I]0-i said to [Arthur]125-arthur in a soft voice : And when shall [we]4121-we slay [her]252-the woman ? Said [he]125-arthur : Not until [we]4121-we have gotten from [her]252-the woman all that may be gotten ; and that is the living bodies of [[our]4121-we friends]2302-our friends . But come [we]4121-we forth .

So did [we]4121-we , and came down to [the orchard]469-the orchard and did off [our]4121-we helms , and lay down under a big apple - tree which was clear of cover all round about , and so fell to [our]4121-we redes ; and [I]0-i asked [Arthur]125-arthur what [he]125-arthur deemed of the story of [our]4121-we loves having been carried to [the House under the Wood]2453-the house under the wood , and if it might not be tried seeking thither ; but [he]125-arthur laughed and said : Never would [she]252-the woman have told [us]4121-we thereof had it been sooth : doubtless [[our]4121-we friends]2302-our friends are here on [this isle]1498-this isle , but , as [I]0-i deem , not in [the house]325-the house , else had not [the witch]407-the witch left all the house free for [us]4121-we to search into . Yea , said [I]0-i , but how if [they]2302-our friends be in [[her]252-the woman prison]1234-her prison ? Said [he]125-arthur : It is not hard to find out which is [the prison of [so dainty a house]4138-so dainty a house as is yonder]4137-the prison of so dainty a house as is yonder ; and when [we]4121-we had found [it]4138-so dainty a house , soon should [we]4121-we have hit upon a way to break it , since [we]4121-we be three , and stout fellows enough . Nay , [I]0-i deem that [the lovelings]4139-the lovelings be stowed away in [some corner of [the isle]642-the isle]4140-some corner of the isle without [the house]325-the house , and that mayhappen [we]4121-we shall find [them]4139-the lovelings there ; and yet [I]0-i trow not before [we]4121-we have made guile meet guile , and overcome [the sorceress]4143-the sorceress . But come now , let [us]4121-we be doing , and begin to quarter [this little land as the kestrel doth [the water - meadow]4145-the water - meadow]4144-this little land as the kestrel doth the water - meadow ; and leave [we]4121-we [our]4121-we armour , lest [we]4121-we weary [us]4121-we , for [we]4121-we shall have no need for hard strokes .

[We]4121-we hung up there on the tree helm and shield and hauberk , and all [our]4121-we defences , and went [our]4121-we ways quartering [the isle]642-the isle ; and the work was toilsome , but [we]4121-we rested not till the time was come to keep tryst with [the lady]1157-the lady ; and all that while [we]4121-we found no sign of [the darling ones]4148-the darling ones : and [the isle]642-the isle was everywhere [a meadow]1632-a meadow as fair as [a garden]4151-a garden , with little copses of sweet - growing trees here and there , and goodly brooks of water , but no tillage anywhere : wild things , as hart and buck and roe , [we]4121-we came upon , and smaller deer withal , but all unhurtful to [man]548-man ; but of herding was no token .

Came [we]4121-we then back to [that lordly perron]4153-that lordly perron , and there , at the foot thereof , stood [the witch - wife]349-the witch - wife , and received [us]4121-we joyously ; clad was [she]349-the witch - wife all gloriously in red scarlet broidered and begemmed ; [her]349-the witch - wife arms bare and [her]349-the witch - wife feet sandalled , and [her]349-the witch - wife yellow hair hanging down from under its garland ; and certainly it was so that [she]349-the witch - wife had grown fairer , and was sleek and white and well - shapen , and well - haired ; yet by all that , the visage of [her]349-the witch - wife was little bettered , and unto [me]0-i [she]349-the witch - wife was loathsome .

Now the feast went much as the earlier meal had done ; and [Baudoin]123-baudoin was surly and Arthur blithe and buxom ; and nought befell to tell of , save that dishes and meats , and flasks and cups , and all things came upon the board as if they were borne thereon by [folk unseen]4155-folk unseen ; and thereat [we]4121-we wondered not much , considering in what [wonder - house]4156-wonder - house [we]4121-we were . But [the lady - witch]1168-the lady - witch looked on [us]4121-we and smiled , and said : [Knights]3601-knights , [ye]3601-knights marvel at the manner of [our]4121-we service , but call to mind that [we]4121-we told [you]3601-knights this morning that [we]4121-we were enough for [Ourselves]4121-we , and [we]4121-we have so dight [our]4121-we days here that whoso is [[our]4121-we friend on [this Isle of [Increase]25-increase]4160-this isle of increase]4159-our friend on this isle of increase shall lack nothing . Fear not , therefore , to see aught ugly in [[our]4121-we servants]4161-our servants as now unseen , if [their]4161-our servants shapes were made manifest unto [you]3601-knights .

All things were [we]4121-we heedful to note at this banquet ; but when it was over , then came music into [the hall]1202-the hall from [folk unseen]4155-folk unseen , but not as if [the musicians]4164-the musicians were [a many , only belike some three or four]4165-a many , only belike some three or four . And thereat [the lady spake]4166-the lady spake , saying : [Knights]3601-knights , [ye]3601-knights may deem [[our]4121-we minstrels]4168-our minstrels but few , but such is [our]4121-we mind that [we]4121-we love not [our]4121-we music overloud , and for the most part only three sing or play unto [us]4121-we at one time .

Thereafter [the lady]1157-the lady brought [us]4121-we to [fair chambers]3456-fair chambers , and [we]4121-we slept there in all ease , and [we]4121-we arose on the morrow and found [the lady]1157-the lady still blithe with [us]4121-we ; yet [I]0-i noted this , that [she]1157-the lady seemed to deal with [Arthur]125-arthur as if [she]1157-the lady saw [him]125-arthur now for the first time , and much [he]125-arthur seemed to be to [her]1157-the lady liking .

Again [we]4121-we fared forth , and were no less diligent in searching [the isle]642-the isle than erst , and found nought ; and all went that day as before .

On the morrow that is , the third day [the witch]407-the witch seemed to have somewhat more memory of [Arthur]125-arthur than erst , and even yet more liking of [him]125-arthur , so that [she]407-the witch reached out [her]407-the witch hand for [him]125-arthur to kiss , which needs must [he]125-arthur do , despite [his]125-arthur loathing of [her]407-the witch .

When [we]4121-we had lain under the apple - tree a little while , [Baudoin]123-baudoin spake and said : Yesterday and the day before [we]4121-we searched [the open land]4174-the open land and found nought ; now to - day let [us]4121-we search [the house]325-the house , and if [we]4121-we find nought , then at least it shall lie behind [us]4121-we . [We]4121-we yeasaid it , and presently went back , and from [chamber]4176-chamber to chamber , and all was fair and goodly as might be , and [we]4121-we marvelled what would betide to it when [the witch]407-the witch was undone and [her]407-the witch sorcery come to an end .

To [the Wailing Tower]4178-the wailing tower [we]4121-we came , and up the stairs , and found the door open of [the prison - chamber]4179-the prison - chamber , and all there as [thou]4180-thou hast told [us]4121-we , [Birdalone]101-birdalone ; only [we]4121-we opened the great coffer , whence [thou]4180-thou didst refrain [thee]4181-thee , and found [it]4182-it full of hideous gear truly , as fetters and chains , and whips and rods , and evil tools of [the tormentors]4183-the tormentors , and cursed it all and came away ; and [Arthur]125-arthur said : Lo [you]4181-thee , [this stupid one]4184-this stupid one ! How eager is [she]407-the witch to bid [us]4121-we what to do , and to tell [us]4121-we that [[our]4121-we ladies]3882-our ladies are not in [this evil house]4186-this evil house , since [she]407-the witch leaveth all open to [us]4121-we . Yet [we]4121-we went about [the house]325-the house without , and counted the windows heedfully to see that [we]4121-we had missed [no chamber]4188-no chamber , and found nought amiss ; and then [we]4121-we went in again and sought as low down as [we]4121-we might , to see if perchance some dungeon there were underground , but found nought save a very goodly undercroft below [the great hall]1785-the great hall , which was little less fair than that which was above [it]1785-the great hall . So came the evening and the banquet , and the end of that day ; but [the witch - wife]349-the witch - wife led [Arthur]125-arthur by the hand to the board , and afterwards to the chamber ere [we]4121-we slept .

On the fourth day and the fifth it was no otherwise than erst ; and when [I]0-i fared to bed [I]0-i felt confused in [my]0-i head and sick of heart .

The night of the next day the sixth , as [we]4121-we went to [[our]4121-we chambers]4191-our chambers , and [the witch - wife]349-the witch - wife and [Arthur]125-arthur hand - in - hand , [she]349-the witch - wife stayed [him]125-arthur a while , and spake eagerly to [him]125-arthur in a soft voice ; and as [he]125-arthur came up to [me]0-i afterwards [he]125-arthur said : To - night [I]0-i have escaped it , but there will not be escape for long . From what ? said I. [He]125-arthur said : From bedding [her]349-the witch - wife ; for now it has come to this , that presently [we]4121-we must slay [her]349-the witch - wife at once and have no knowledge of [[our]4121-we sweetlings]4193-our sweetlings , or [I]0-i must do [her]349-the witch - wife will .

In such wise passed four more days , and it was the twelfth morning of [our]4121-we sojourn [there]232-there , and [we]4121-we went forth on [our]4121-we search of [every mead and every covert of [the isle]642-the isle]4195-every mead and every covert of the isle , and all day [we]4121-we found nought to [our]4121-we purpose ; but as it grew toward sunset , and there grew great clouds in [the eastern ort]4197-the eastern ort , piled up and copper - coloured , [we]4121-we came over a bent on to [a little green dale watered by a clear brook]4198-a little green dale watered by a clear brook , and as [we]4121-we looked down into it [we]4121-we saw something shine amongst [its]4198-a little green dale watered by a clear brook trees ; so [we]4121-we hastened toward that gleam , and lo , amidst [the dale]2735-the dale , with [the brook]711-the brook running through it , a strange garth [we]4121-we saw . For there was [a pavilion]4201-a pavilion done of timber and board , and gaily painted and gilded , and out from [that house]1470-that house was , as [it]4201-a pavilion were , a great cage of thin gilded bars , both walls and roof , just so wide apart as [no one full - grown , carl or quean]4203-no one full - grown , carl or quean , could thrust through .

Thitherward then ran [we]4121-we , shouting , for [we]4121-we saw at once that in [the said cage]4204-the said cage were [three women whose aspect was that of [our]4121-we sweetlings]4205-three women whose aspect was that of our sweetlings , and presently [we]4121-we were standing by the said herse , reaching [our]4121-we hands out to [them]4205-three women whose aspect was that of our sweetlings to come to [us]4121-we and tell [us]4121-we [their]4205-three women whose aspect was that of our sweetlings tale , and that [we]4121-we would deliver [them]4205-three women whose aspect was that of our sweetlings . But [they]4205-three women whose aspect was that of our sweetlings stood together in the midst of [the said cage]4204-the said cage , and though [they]4205-three women whose aspect was that of our sweetlings gazed piteously on [us]4121-we thence , and reached out [their]4205-three women whose aspect was that of our sweetlings hands to [us]4121-we , [they]4205-three women whose aspect was that of our sweetlings neither spake nor came to the herse to [us]4121-we ; so [we]4121-we deemed that [they]4205-three women whose aspect was that of our sweetlings were bewitched , and [our]4121-we joy was dashed .

Then [we]4121-we went all about [the cage]4207-the cage and [the pavilion]1427-the pavilion to find ingate , and found it not ; and then [the three of [us]4121-we]4209-the three of us together strove with the bars of the herse , and shook and swayed them , but it was all to no purpose .

Moreover , while [we]4121-we were at this work the sun seemed to go out , and there came a heavy black mist rolling into [the dale]2735-the dale , and wrapped [us]4121-we about so that [we]4121-we saw not [each other]580-each other 's faces , and the bars of the herse were gone from [our]4121-we hands as [we]4121-we stood there . Then came rain and thunder and lightning on to the black night , and by the glare of the lightning [we]4121-we could see the leaves and grass of [the dale]2735-the dale , but neither herse nor [house]928-house nor [woman]1775-woman . So [we]4121-we abode there in the dark night , and the storm all bewildered [us]4121-we , till the rain and clouds drew off and it was calm fair starlight again , but clean gone was [the golden cage]4215-the golden cage and [they]4216-they that stood therein ; and [we]4121-we turned sadly , and went [our]4121-we ways toward [the witch - house]4217-the witch - house .

On the way said [Arthur]125-arthur : [Brethren]2433-brethren , [this meseemeth]3308-this meseemeth is but a - going on with the shows which were played [us]4121-we on [the water]361-the water as [we]4121-we came hither ; but whether [she]3308-this meseemeth doth this but for to mock and torment [us]4121-we , or that [she]3308-this meseemeth would beguile [us]4121-we into deeming that [[our]4121-we friends]2302-our friends are verily here , [I]0-i wot not ; but to - morrow , [meseemeth]119-meseemeth , [I]0-i shall can to tell [you]2433-brethren .

Now came [we]4121-we to [the perron of [the house]325-the house]4222-the perron of the house , and there stood [the witch- wife under the stars]4224-the witch- wife under the stars to meet [us]4121-we . And when [she]3308-this meseemeth saw [us]4121-we , [she]3308-this meseemeth took hold of [Arthur]125-arthur by the hand and the arm to caress [him]125-arthur , and found that [he]125-arthur and [we]4121-we were drenched with the rain and the storm , as might well be deemed ; then [she]3308-this meseemeth bade [us]4121-we up to [[our]4121-we chambers]4191-our chambers to do on raiment which [she]3308-this meseemeth had dight for [us]4121-we , and [we]4121-we went thither , and found [our]4121-we garments rich and dainty indeed ; but when [we]4121-we came down into [the hall]1202-the hall where [the witch]407-the witch abode [us]4121-we , [we]4121-we saw that [Arthur]125-arthur 's raiment was far the richest and daintiest . But [the witch]407-the witch ran to [him]125-arthur and cast [her]407-the witch arms about [him]125-arthur , and clipped and kissed [him]125-arthur before [the others]1301-the others , and [he]125-arthur suffered it . So sped the feast again .

But when [they]4230-they went to bed , [the said witch]4231-the said witch took [Arthur]125-arthur 's hand and spake a word unto [him]125-arthur , and led [him]125-arthur away , and [he]125-arthur went with [her]407-the witch as one nought loth ; but [we]4121-we twain were afraid lest [she]407-the witch should destroy [him]125-arthur when [she]407-the witch had had [her]407-the witch will of [him]125-arthur . Wherefore [we]4121-we waked through the more part of the night with [our]4121-we swords ready to hand .

But when [we]4121-we were clad in the morn [he]125-arthur came unto [us]4121-we , [he]125-arthur also clad , and was downcast and shamefaced indeed , but safe and sound ; and [he]125-arthur said : Speak no word about [our]4121-we matter till [we]4121-we be out in the open air , for [I]0-i fear all things about [us]4121-we .

So when [we]4121-we had gone forth and were under [the apple - tree]4232-the apple - tree once more , spake [Arthur]125-arthur : Now , [lords]2319-lords , am [I]0-i shamed for ever , for [I]0-i have become [the leman of this evil creature]4234-the leman of this evil creature ; but [I]0-i pray [ye]2319-lords not to mock [me]0-i ; and that the more as the same lot may happen on [you]2319-lords both , or either ; for [I]0-i can see for sure that [the wretch]4235-the wretch will weary of [me]0-i and desire one of [you]2319-lords two . Let it pass . [Somewhat]4236-somewhat have [I]0-i found out from [her]4235-the wretch , but not much ; first , that [she]4235-the wretch has forgotten [her]4235-the wretch first lie , to wit , how [she]4235-the wretch sent [[our]4237-our ladies]3882-our ladies to [the sister - witch]4239-the sister - witch ; for [I]0-i told [her]4235-the wretch of the golden cage , and how [we]4237-our had missed it in the storm ; and [she]4235-the wretch said : Though [I]0-i deem it a folly that [ye]0-i should seek these thralls , yet would [I]0-i help [you]0-i if [I]0-i might , since [ye]0-i are now become [[my]0-i dear friends]4240-my dear friends . Though , forsooth , when [ye]0-i meet [them]4240-my dear friends [I]0-i deem that [ye]0-i will find [them]4240-my dear friends sore changed to [you]0-i . For , as [I]0-i told [you]0-i , [they]4240-my dear friends fled away from [me]0-i , after [I]0-i had chastised [them]4240-my dear friends for a treason , into [the hidden places of [the isle]642-the isle]4241-the hidden places of the isle , whereas [they]4240-my dear friends had no keel to sail away hence . And [I]0-i cared not to follow [them]4240-my dear friends , as [I]0-i [myself]0-i am queen and lady of all things here , and am enough for [myself]0-i , save when love constraineth [me]0-i , [dear lord]4243-dear lord . Now , [my]0-i rede is that [ye]0-i seek [the golden cage]4215-the golden cage again and yet again , because [I]0-i deem that [these thralls]4245-these thralls have somehow learned some wisdom , and [they]4245-these thralls have enchanted [the said cage]4204-the said cage for a defence against [me]0-i , from whom [they]4245-these thralls might not hide as [they]4245-these thralls did from [you]0-i ; for of [me]0-i have [they]4245-these thralls stolen [their]4245-these thralls wizardry , and [I]0-i am [[their]4245-these thralls mistress]4247-their mistress therein .

This , therefore , is the new lie of [her]0-i , and [my]0-i rede is that [we]4248-we heed it nought . For [my]0-i mind is that [she]0-i it is that hath made the appearance of [the cage]4207-the cage and [the women therein]4250-the women therein , and that [she]0-i hath [[our]4248-we poor friends]4251-our poor friends somewhere underneath [her]0-i hand .

Now this [we]4248-we deemed most like ; yet whereas [we]4248-we had nought to do with the time , which , now that [we]4248-we had searched [the isle]642-the isle throughly , hung heavy on hand , [we]4248-we deemed it good to go to [the dale of the golden cage]4253-the dale of the golden cage again , though [we]4248-we looked not to find the cage there any more . But this betid , that [we]4248-we found [the little dale]4254-the little dale easily enough , and there stood the cage as [we]4248-we had seen [it]4207-the cage yesterday , but nought was there within [its]4207-the cage bright bars save the grass and the flowers , and the water of [the brook]711-the brook a - running .

[We]4248-we loitered about [that place]645-that place a while , and went back to [the house]325-the house in due time ; and to shorten the tale , [I]0-i shall tell that for many days it betid that [we]4248-we went every day to seek [the golden cage]4215-the golden cage , but after the first three days [we]4248-we saw [it]4215-the golden cage no more .

Now began sadness and weariness to overcome [us]4248-we as the days and weeks wore , and belike [the witch - wife]349-the witch - wife noted it that [we]4248-we were worse company than heretofore .

And now on a day [Arthur]125-arthur bade [us]4248-we note that [the said witch]4231-the said witch was growing weary of [him]125-arthur , and [he]125-arthur bade [me]0-i look to it ; for , said [he]125-arthur , [she]4231-the said witch is turning [her]4231-the said witch face toward [thee]125-arthur , [brother]2145-brother . [My]0-i heart burned with rage at that word ; [I]0-i said nought , but made up [my]0-i mind that [I]0-i would try to bring the matter to an end .

That same night befell what [Arthur]125-arthur had threatened ; for the feast being done in the evening , [the witch]407-the witch drew [me]0-i aside while the music was a - playing , and caressed [my]0-i hand and [my]0-i shoulder , and said : [I]0-i am yet wondering at [you]0-i [Champions]135-the champions , that [ye]0-i must needs follow after those three wretched thralls , whom never will [ye]0-i find , for [they]4263-them . need [ye]0-i not , but will flee from [you]0-i if [ye]0-i have sight of [them]4263-them , as [they]4263-them did that other day ; and therein they are scarce in the wrong , whereas [they]4263-them may well think that if [ye]0-i find [them]4263-them they should fall into [my]0-i hands ; for easily may [I]0-i take [them]4263-them any day that [I]0-i will , and then [I]0-i have a case against [them]4263-them , and may lawfully chastise [them]4263-them according to the law that has been given unto [me]0-i ; and then shall [they]4263-them be in grievous plight . Wherefore the rede [We]4264-we give unto [you]0-i three now is the rede of friendliness that [ye]0-i make [yourselves]0-i happy in [[Our]4264-we Island]4265-our island , and then will [We]4264-we do everything [We]4264-we may for [your]0-i pleasure and delight ; and if [ye]0-i will that [We]4264-we make [Ourselves]4264-we even fairer than now [We]4264-we be , that may be done , and shall be a reward unto [you]0-i for [your]0-i yielding and obedience . And if [ye]0-i will women thralls for [your]0-i pleasure , that also may be gotten for [you]0-i ; for [We]4264-we be not wholly without power in [these waters]4266-these waters , though [We]4264-we have no keel or ferry upon [them]4266-these waters . And now , [[thou]4267-you fair lad]4268-thou fair lad , [We]4264-we give [thee]4267-you this last word : [Ye]0-i Champions have been dwelling in [[Our]4264-we house]1679-our house a long while , and that while have ever striven to thwart [Us]4264-we . [We]4264-we now counsel [you]4267-you to make an end of it , and it shall be better for [you]4267-you .

[She]4270-her seemed to [my]0-i eyes prouder and stupider than ever erst , despite [her]4270-her golden hair and white skin and lovely limbs ; and [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i that now must [we]4264-we destroy the evil of [that house]1470-that house even if [we]4264-we died for it , or else [we]4264-we were all undone ; withal [I]0-i saw somewhat of truth thrusting up through [her]4270-her much lying , and [I]0-i deemed , even as [Arthur]125-arthur did , that [she]4270-her had [[our]4264-we friends]2302-our friends under [her]4270-her band somewhere .

Nought else betid that night ; but on the morrow [we]4264-we went forth and strayed on till [we]4264-we were come into [the southernmost quarter of [the isle]642-the isle]4273-the southernmost quarter of the isle , and not very far from [the water]361-the water [we]4264-we came upon a wood or big thicket which was new to [us]4264-we . So [we]4264-we entered [it]4276-it , and as [we]4264-we went and noted the wild things of the wood going hither and thither , [we]4264-we espied afar off the shape of [a man going amidst the thicket]4277-a man going amidst the thicket ; wherefore [we]4264-we went warily towards [him]4277-a man going amidst the thicket , lest [he]4277-a man going amidst the thicket should see [us]4264-we and flee from [us]4264-we ; and when [we]4264-we drew a little nigher [we]4264-we saw it was [a woman]250-a woman , though [she]250-a woman was clad as [a hunter , with legs naked to above the knee]4279-a hunter , with legs naked to above the knee . [She]250-a woman had a quiver at [her]250-a woman back and a bow in [her]250-a woman hand , and [her]250-a woman coat was black of hue . Belike now [she]250-a woman heard [our]4264-we going amongst the dry leaves , for [she]250-a woman turned [her]250-a woman face to [us]4264-we , and lo ! it was the face of [Atra]117-atra .

When [she]250-a woman saw [us]4264-we , [she]250-a woman gave a shrill cry , and fell to running at [her]250-a woman swiftest away from [us]4264-we , and [we]4264-we followed all [we]4264-we might , but [we]4264-we could not over - run [her]250-a woman , though [we]4264-we kept [her]250-a woman in sight ever , till [we]4264-we had run all through the wood , and before [us]4264-we was the sheer side of [a rocky hill]4280-a rocky hill and the mouth of [a cave therein]4281-a cave therein , and by the said mouth who should there be but [Aurea]116-viridis and [Viridis]116-viridis , as [we]4264-we thought , clad in gold and in green , but the fashion of [their]4282-their raiment not otherwise than [Atra]117-atra 's . [Their]4282-their bows were bended and [they]4282-their had shafts in [their]4282-their hands , and as [we]4264-we came out of the thicket into the open lawn before [the cave]4283-the cave , [Viridis]116-viridis nocked a shaft and aimed at [us]4264-we and drew , and the shaft flew over [my]0-i head ; therewith mocking laughter came from [them]4282-their , and [they]4282-their ran into [the cave]4283-the cave . Speedily [we]4264-we ran up to [it]4283-the cave , but when [we]4264-we came [home thither]4285-home thither , there was [the sheer hillside]4286-the sheer hillside , but never a cave nor an opening .

Dismayed were [we]4264-we thereat ; but more dismayed had [we]4264-we been but that [we]4264-we deemed that all this was but a cheat and a painted show put upon [us]4264-we by [the witch]407-the witch to back up [her]407-the witch lying . Nevertheless [we]4264-we fared the next day to seek the wood and the cave in the sheer rock , but nowise might [we]4264-we find either wood or [cave]4288-cave .

Now it was the night of the day hereafter , as [we]4264-we went to [[our]4264-we chambers]4191-our chambers , that [the witch - wife]349-the witch - wife took [me]0-i by the hand and led [me]0-i apart , and said [me]0-i many soft things of [her]349-the witch - wife accursed lust , whereof [I]0-i will not say one again . But the upshot of it all was that [she]349-the witch - wife would bring [me]0-i to [[her]349-the witch - wife chamber]2512-her chamber and [her]349-the witch - wife bed . And whereas [I]0-i was determined what to do , and had [my]0-i war - sword by [my]0-i side , [I]0-i naysaid [her]349-the witch - wife not , but made [her]349-the witch - wife good countenance . And when [we]4264-we came to [[her]349-the witch - wife chamber]2512-her chamber , which was full gloriously dight , and fragrant as with the scent of the roses and lilies of mid - June , [she]349-the witch - wife bade [me]0-i to lie in [her]349-the witch - wife bed of gold and ivory and [she]349-the witch - wife would be with [me]0-i anon . So [I]0-i unclad [myself]0-i and laid [me]0-i down , but [I]0-i drew forth [my]0-i sword , and laid the ancient naked blade betwixt [my]0-i side and [her]349-the witch - wife place .

Anon [she]349-the witch - wife cometh back again unclad , and would step into the bed ; but [she]349-the witch - wife saw the sword and said : What is this , [Champion]169-champion ? Said [I]0-i : These edges are the token of sundering between [us]4264-we , for there is a spell on [me]0-i , that with [no woman]757-no woman may [I]0-i deal , save with [mine]0-i only love , but [I]0-i shall do [her]349-the witch - wife mortal scathe ; so beware by the token of the grey edges of battle . [She]349-the witch - wife drew aback , and was as a spiteful and angry cat , and there was no loveliness in [her]349-the witch - wife ; and [she]349-the witch - wife said : [Thou]4294-thou liest , and [thou]4294-thou hatest [me]0-i ; see [thou]4294-thou to it , both for [thyself]4295-thyself and [thy]4294-thou loveling . And [she]349-the witch - wife turned about and strode out of [the chamber]306-the chamber ; but [I]0-i arose and clad [myself]0-i in haste , and took [my]0-i naked sword in [my]0-i hand . But before [I]0-i went , [I]0-i looked around , and espied an ambry fashioned in the wall of the bed - lane , and the door was half open ; and [the said ambry]4297-the said ambry was wrought of the daintiest , all of gold and pearl and gems ; and [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i : Herein is some treasure , and this is a tide of war . So [I]0-i opened the ambry , and within [it]4297-the said ambry was even more gloriously wrought than without ; and there was nought therein , save a little flask of crystal done about with bands of gold set with great and goodly gems . So [I]0-i took the said flask and went [my]0-i ways hastily to [[my]0-i own chamber]4298-my own chamber , and there [I]0-i looked at the said flask and took out the stopple ; and there was a liquor therein , white like to water , but of a spicy smell , sweet , fresh , and enheartening . So [I]0-i yet thought this was some great treasure , and that much hung upon it , could [I]0-i find out unto what use it might be put . And [I]0-i said : To - morrow [we]4299-we will put it to the proof . Then [I]0-i put the said flask under [my]0-i pillow , and laid [my]0-i sword by [my]0-i side and slept , and was not ill - content so far .

But on the morrow , when [I]0-i met [[my]0-i fellows]4300-my fellows , [they]4300-my fellows asked [me]0-i how [I]0-i had sped , and [I]0-i told [them]4300-my fellows , Well , and that [we]4299-we would talk the matter over under [our]4299-we tree of counsel . So [we]4299-we went down into [the hall]1202-the hall , where [we]4299-we met [the witch - lady]4302-the witch - lady ; and [I]0-i looked for it that [she]4302-the witch - lady would be angry and fierce with [me]0-i ; but it went far otherwise ; for [she]4302-the witch - lady was blithe and buxom , and abounding in endearments more than [I]0-i could away with . But this [I]0-i noted , that [her]4302-the witch - lady eyes wandered , and [her]4302-the witch - lady speech faltered at whiles , and ever [she]4302-the witch - lady seemed to be seeking somewhat ; and withal that [her]4302-the witch - lady caressing hands were seeking if they could aught stowed away in the bosom of [my]0-i coat . But all was nought , for as [we]4299-we came to the door of [the hall]1202-the hall [I]0-i gave [Baudoin]123-baudoin the flask to guard until [we]4299-we should come to [[our]4299-we apple - tree of rede]4304-our apple - tree of rede . Wherefore the she - wolf went red and white by turns , and fumed , and fretted [her]4302-the witch - lady bedizenments with unrestful hands , and when [she]4302-the witch - lady should let [us]4299-we go [our]4299-we ways , [she]4302-the witch - lady lingered and looked back oft , and was loth to depart ere [she]4302-the witch - lady had gotten what [she]4302-the witch - lady lacked , and that , forsooth , was the said flasket .

But when [we]4299-we were without [the house]325-the house , [I]0-i bade [[our]4299-we fellows]2290-our fellows go with [me]0-i to another place than [the wonted apple - tree of rede]4307-the wonted apple - tree of rede , and [they]2290-our fellows understood [my]0-i word , and [I]0-i led [them]2290-our fellows to [a little grassy plain without [the orchard]469-the orchard]4308-a little grassy plain without the orchard , where was no covert for a wide space about [it]4308-a little grassy plain without the orchard , nought but the one linden - tree under which now [we]4299-we sat . There [I]0-i told [them]2290-our fellows all the tale of the last night and of the flasket , and put before [them]2290-our fellows all that was in [my]0-i mind to do that evening at the banquet , and [they]2290-our fellows both of [them]2290-our fellows yeasaid it . But what it was , that shall [ye]4310-ye hear anon when [we]4299-we carried the matter through ; but [I]0-i bade [Baudoin]123-baudoin still carry the flasket till the evening .

Thereafter [we]4299-we spake of other matters ; but soon [we]4299-we had good cause to rejoice that [we]4299-we had not talked [our]4299-we talk under the apple - tree whereas [I]0-i doubted not that [the witch]407-the witch would spy upon [us]4299-we there , for not long had [we]4299-we been at [our]4299-we talk ere , looking that way , [we]4299-we saw the evil creature by the hedge of [the orchard]469-the orchard and gazing over at [us]4299-we .
