Light]208-the men of the red company light was growing on the dawn of the next day , and the colours of things could be seen , when [Birdalone , who was holding this last watch of the night]6560-birdalone , who was holding this last watch of the night , stood still and hearkened , deeming that [she]6560-birdalone , who was holding this last watch of the night could hear some noise that was neither the morning wind in the tree - boughs nor the going of the wild things anear them in the wood .

So [she]6560-birdalone , who was holding this last watch of the night did off [her]6560-birdalone , who was holding this last watch of the night helm to hear the better , and stood thus a little ; then [she]6560-birdalone , who was holding this last watch of the night turned about and stooped down to [Arthur]157-arthur , who was yet sleeping , and put forth a hand to rouse [him]157-arthur . But or ever [she]6560-birdalone , who was holding this last watch of the night touched [him]157-arthur , broke forth a sound of big and rough voices and laughter , and amidst it two shrieks as of [women]433-women .

[Arthur]157-arthur heard it , and was on [his]157-arthur feet in a moment , and helmed , and [he]157-arthur caught up [his]157-arthur bended bow and cast on the quiver for [Birdalone]101-birdalone was already weaponed , and without more words [they]6562-they went forth swiftly up [the bank]1043-the bank and through the thicket till [they]6562-they were looking on the half- blind way , but under cover , and there was nothing before [them]6562-they as yet .

There [they]6562-they stayed and hearkened keenly . There were no more shrieks of [women]433-women , nor heard [they]6562-they any weapon clash , but the talking and laughter of [men]219-men went on ; and at last [they]6562-they heard [a huge and grim whoop of many men]6566-a huge and grim whoop of many men together ; and then thereafter was less sound of talking , but came the jingle as of arms and harness ; and [Arthur]157-arthur whispered in [Birdalone]101-birdalone 's ear : Stand close ! [they]6562-they have gotten to horse , and will be coming [our]6562-they way . Nock an arrow . And even so did [he]157-arthur .

Therewith [they]6562-they heard clearly the riding of [men]219-men , and in less than five minutes ' space [they]6562-they saw [three big weaponed men]7208-three big weaponed men riding together , clad in red surcoats , and [they]7208-three big weaponed men were so nigh that [they]6562-they heard the words of [their]7208-three big weaponed men speech . [One]515-one said to [the other]265-the other : How long shall [the knight]2120-the knight hold out , think [ye]265-the other ? Oh , a week maybe , said [the other]265-the other . Meseems it was scathe that [we]6569-we stayed not a while to pine [him]2120-the knight , said [the first man]3575-the first man . Nay , said [the second]7214-the second , [we]6569-we be over - heavy laden with bed - gear to tarry . And [they]6569-we all laughed thereat , and so went on out of hearing .[219-men]

But then came four on together , whereof one , [a gaunt , oldish man]6568-a gaunt , oldish man , was saying : It is not so much how long [we]6569-we shall be getting there , but what shall betide when [we]6569-we get there . For this is not like lifting a herd of neat , whereof sharing is easy , but with this naked - skinned , two - legged cattle , which forsooth [ye]6570-ye can eat and yet have , there may well be strife over the sharing . And look to it if it hath not begun already : [we]6569-we must needs dismount [three of [[our]6569-we best men]6572-our best men]6571-three of our best men that [these white - skinned bitches]6573-these white - skinned bitches forsooth may each have a horse to [herself]6574-herself , or else would [they]6571-three of our best men be fighting as to which should have [a damsel of [them]6571-three of our best men before [him]6568-a gaunt , oldish man on the saddle]6575-a damsel of them before him on the saddle : curse [the fools]4340-the fools !

Laughed out [they]6571-three of our best men who were about [him]6568-a gaunt , oldish man , and [one young man]6577-one young man cast a jeer at [him]6568-a gaunt , oldish man the meaning whereof [they]6571-three of our best men might not catch , and again [they]6571-three of our best men laughed ; and that deal passed on . And next came a bigger rout , a half score or so , and [they]6571-three of our best men also laughing and jeering ; but amidst [them]6571-three of our best men , plain to see riding a - straddle , [their]6571-three of our best men ankles twisted together under the horses ' bellies , [their]6571-three of our best men hands bound behind [them]6571-three of our best men , first [Atra]117-atra , black- clad as erst ; then [Aurea]116-viridis , in a gown of wheat - colour ; then [Viridis]116-viridis , green - clad . [Atra]117-atra rode upright , and looking straight before [her]117-atra ; [Aurea]116-viridis hung [her]116-viridis head all [she]116-viridis might , and [her]116-viridis long red hair fell about [her]116-viridis face ; but [Viridis]116-viridis had swooned , and was held up in the saddle by one of [the caitiffs on each side of [her]6578-her]7215-the caitiffs on each side of her . [They]7216-they were but little disarrayed , save that [some felon]7217-some felon had torn the bosom of [Viridis]116-viridis '[101-birdalone] gown , and dragged down the cloth so that [her]6578-her left shoulder was bare .

[Arthur]157-arthur looked , and drew at the caitiff who went afoot beside [Atra]117-atra , and [Birdalone]101-birdalone at [him]157-arthur who went by [Viridis]116-viridis , for [she]101-birdalone wotted whitherward [Arthur]157-arthur 's shaft would be turned . The loose of the two bows made but one sound ; [both men]6579-both men fell stark dead , and [the others]1301-the others huddled together a moment , and then ran toward the thicket on either hand , and [they]1301-the others who ran north , two of [them]1301-the others saw not [Arthur]157-arthur , because of [his]157-arthur green armour , ere [they]1301-the others felt the death which lay in [his]157-arthur sword . And then [he]157-arthur brake out amidst [them]1301-the others , and there were three of [them]1301-the others on [him]157-arthur , yet for no long while , whereas [their]1301-the others weapons bit not on the armour of [the Faery]7087-the faery , and [his]157-arthur woodland blade sheared leather and ring - mail to the flesh and the bone : mighty were [his]157-arthur strokes , and presently [all three]1245-all three were wallowing on [the earth]445-the earth .

Even therewith [the seven who had passed on]6584-the seven who had passed on had turned back and were come on [him]157-arthur a - horse - back ; and hard had it gone with [him]157-arthur , despite of [his]157-arthur might and [his]157-arthur valour and the trustiness of [Habundia]106-habundia 's mail . But meanwhile [Birdalone]101-birdalone had run to [Viridis]116-viridis , who had fallen a dead weight aside of [her]116-viridis horse , and lay half hanging by the bonds of [her]116-viridis ankles . [Birdalone]101-birdalone swiftly cut the cords both of [her]116-viridis feet and [her]116-viridis hands , and drew [her]116-viridis off [her]101-birdalone horse as best [she]101-birdalone might , and laid [her]116-viridis down on the grass ; and then ran to [Arthur]157-arthur sword aloft , just as [his]157-arthur new battle was at point to begin .

But as [she]101-birdalone ran it came into [her]101-birdalone mind in a twinkling that [her]101-birdalone sword would be but weak , and the horn hung about [her]101-birdalone neck . Then [she]101-birdalone stayed [her]101-birdalone feet , and set the horn to [her]101-birdalone lips and blew ; and the oliphant gave forth a long singing note which was strange to hear . But while it was yet at [her]101-birdalone lips one of the caitiffs was upon [her]101-birdalone , and [he]157-arthur cried out : [Hah the witch]6585-hah the witch , [the accursed green witch]6586-the accursed green witch ! and fetched [her]101-birdalone a great stroke from [his]157-arthur saddle , and smote [her]101-birdalone on the helm ; and though [his]157-arthur sword bit not on that good head - burg , [she]101-birdalone fell to the ground unwitting .

Yet was not [the wood - wife]570-the wood - wife 's promise unavailing , for even while the voice of the horn was in the air , the way and thickets were alive with [men - at - arms]2059-men - at - arms , green - clad as those twain , who straightway fell on [the caitiffs]6589-the caitiffs , and with [Arthur]157-arthur to help , left not one of [them]6589-the caitiffs alive . Then went some to [Viridis]116-viridis , and raised [her]116-viridis up , and so dealt with [her]116-viridis that [she]116-viridis came to [herself]116-viridis again ; and the like [they]6590-they did by [Birdalone]101-birdalone , and [she]101-birdalone stood , and looked about confusedly , but yet saw this , that [they]6590-they had gotten the victory . [Some]229-some went withal to [Aurea]116-viridis , and cut [her]116-viridis bonds and took [her]116-viridis off [her]116-viridis horse and set [her]116-viridis on [the ground]1690-the ground ; and [she]116-viridis was all bewildered , and knew not where [she]116-viridis was .

But [Arthur]157-arthur , when [he]157-arthur saw [Birdalone]101-birdalone on [her]101-birdalone feet , and unhurt by seeming , went to [Atra]117-atra , and cut [her]117-atra bonds and loosed [her]117-atra , and set [her]117-atra on [the earth]445-the earth , all without a word , and then stood before [her]117-atra shyly . Came the colour back into [her]117-atra face therewith , and [she]117-atra flushed red , for [she]117-atra knew [him]157-arthur despite [his]157-arthur outlandish green war - harness , and [she]117-atra reached out [her]117-atra hand to [him]157-arthur , and [he]157-arthur knelt before [her]117-atra and took [her]117-atra hand and kissed it . But [she]117-atra bent over [him]157-arthur till [her]117-atra face was anigh [his]157-arthur , and [he]157-arthur lifted up [his]157-arthur face and kissed [her]117-atra mouth . And [she]117-atra drew aback a little , but yet looked on [him]157-arthur earnestly , and said : [Thou]6594-thou hast saved [my]0-i life , not from death indeed , but from a loathsome hell ; [I]0-i may well thank [thee]157-arthur for that . And O , if [my]0-i thanks might be fruitful to [thee]157-arthur ! And [her]117-atra bosom heaved , and the sobs came , and the tears began to run down [her]117-atra cheeks . And [he]157-arthur hung [his]157-arthur head before [her]117-atra . But in a while [she]117-atra left weeping , and turned about [her]117-atra face and looked round [the field of deed]6595-the field of deed ; and [she]117-atra said : Who is [yonder]6596-yonder [slim green warrior who hath even now knelt down by [Viridis]116-viridis]6597-slim green warrior who hath even now knelt down by viridis ? Is it not [a woman]250-a woman ? [Arthur]157-arthur reddened : [Yea]6599-yea , said [he]157-arthur ; it is [Birdalone]101-birdalone . [Thy]101-birdalone love ? [she]117-atra said . [He]157-arthur said swiftly : [Yea]6599-yea , and [[thy]6599-yea friend]2239-thy friend , and this time [[thy]6599-yea deliverer]6601-thy deliverer . So it is , [she]117-atra said . It is five years since [I]0-i beheld [her]117-atra . [My]0-i heart yearns for [her]117-atra ; [I]0-i shall rejoice at the meeting of [us]6602-they .

[She]117-atra was silent , and [he]157-arthur also a while ; then [she]117-atra said : But why tarry [we]6602-they here in idle talk when [he]157-arthur is yet bound , and in torment of body and soul ; [he]157-arthur the valiant , and [the kind]6603-the kind and [the dear brother]6604-the dear brother ? Come , tarry for no question . And [she]117-atra stepped out swiftly along [the green road]3551-the green road going westward , and [Arthur]157-arthur beside [her]117-atra ; and as [they]6602-they went by [Viridis]116-viridis , lo ! [Aurea]116-viridis had wandered unto [them]6602-they , and now was [Birdalone]101-birdalone unhelmed and kissing and comforting [her]117-atra . Then cried out [Atra]117-atra : Keep up [thine]6606-thine heart , [Viridis]116-viridis ! for now [we]6602-they go to fetch [thee]117-atra [[thy]117-atra man]4622-thy man safe and sound .

So [they]6602-they went but a little way on the green road ere [they]6602-they came to [Sir Hugh]124-hugh bound hard and fast to a tree - bole , and [he]124-hugh naked in [his]124-hugh shirt , and hard by lay the bodies of two stout carles with [their]6602-they throats cut ; for [these honest men]6608-these honest men and [the two felons who had betrayed [them]6608-these honest men]6609-the two felons who had betrayed them were all the following wherewith [the Green Knight]1331-the green knight had entered [Evilshaw]4-evilshaw . And as it fell , [the traitors]6611-the traitors had been set to watch while [the others]1301-the others slept ; and sleeping [the caitiffs]6589-the caitiffs found [them]6611-the traitors , and slew [the said men - at - arms]6614-the said men - at - arms at once , but bound [Hugh]124-hugh to a tree that [he]124-hugh might be the longer a - dying ; since [none]1226-none looked for any but [[their]6602-they own folk]6616-their own folk to pass by that way . All this [they]6602-they heard afterwards of [Hugh]124-hugh .

But now [the said Hugh]6617-the said hugh heard [men]219-men going , and [he]124-hugh opened [his]124-hugh eyes , and saw [Atra]117-atra and [a man - at - arms]6619-a man - at - arms with [her]117-atra ; and [he]124-hugh cried out : Hah , what is this now , [sister]783-sister ? a rescue ? [Yea]6621-yea , [she]117-atra said , and look [thou]6622-thou on the face of [the rescuer]6623-the rescuer ; and there is another hard by , and [she]783-sister is [a woman]250-a woman .

Therewith was [Arthur]157-arthur on [him]124-hugh and cutting [his]124-hugh bonds , and when [he]124-hugh was loose [they]6625-they fell into [each other]580-each other 's arms , and [Hugh]124-hugh spake : Now then at last doth life begin for [me]0-i as [I]0-i willed it ! And hast [thou]6627-thou [[my]0-i sweet [she]6629-she - fellow]6628-my sweet she - fellow , [Birdalone]101-birdalone , with [thee]6627-thou ? Yea , said [Arthur]157-arthur . How good is that ! said [Hugh]124-hugh . And yet , if it might but be that [Baudoin]123-baudoin were yet alive for [us]6630-they to seek ! Then [he]124-hugh laughed and said : These be but sorry garments wherewith to wend along with [dear and fair ladies]6631-dear and fair ladies , [brother]2145-brother ! Nay , said [Arthur]157-arthur , that may soon be amended , for yonder , where sword met sword , lieth raiment abundantly on the grass . Fie on it ! said [Hugh]124-hugh , laughing ; shall [I]0-i do on [me]0-i the raiment of [those lousy traitors]6633-those lousy traitors ? Not [I]0-i , by the rood ! [Thou]6634-thou must seek further for [my]0-i array , [dear lad]5176-dear lad ! So [they]6630-they all laughed , and were glad to laugh together . But [Atra]117-atra said : It is easier even than that , for [thine]6636-thine own fair garments and weapons shall [we]6630-they find if [we]6630-they seek them . Sooth to say there was none left to bear [them]6637-them off , save it were [this man]1976-this man , or [Birdalone]101-birdalone [[his]1976-this man mate]4650-his mate .

With that word [she]117-atra looked kindly on [Arthur]157-arthur , and again [they]6630-they laughed all three ; though forsooth [they]6637-them were well - nigh weeping - ripe ; one for joy , and that was [Hugh]124-hugh ; one for memory of the days gone by ; and one for the bitterness of love that should never be rewarded ; albeit dear even unto [her]117-atra was the meeting of [friends]416-friends and the glory of forgiveness and the end of enmity .

CHAPTER XXXIII . [VIRIDIS]116-viridis TELLETH THE TALE OF [THEIR]6630-they SEEKING

Now came [they]6630-they back to where were [the three others]6641-the three others , and [Viridis]116-viridis was quite come to [herself]116-viridis and ran to meet [[her]116-viridis man]3698-her man , and [he]3698-her man took [her]116-viridis in [his]3698-her man arms and caressed [her]116-viridis sweetly ; and then [he]3698-her man turned to [Birdalone]101-birdalone , and spared no sign of friendly love to [her]101-birdalone ; and [Arthur]157-arthur , for [his]157-arthur part , did so much for [Aurea]116-viridis and [Viridis]116-viridis . No long tale there was between [them]6630-they for that while , for [they]6630-they would busk [them]6630-they to be gone . But first [they]6630-they dug a grave for [those two poor men who had been slain by [the felons]6644-the felons]6643-those two poor men who had been slain by the felons , and prayed for [them]6643-those two poor men who had been slain by the felons . As for [the caitiffs who lay slain there]6645-the caitiffs who lay slain there , one score and two of [them]6645-the caitiffs who lay slain there , [they]6630-they left [them]6645-the caitiffs who lay slain there for the wolves to devour , and the tearing of the kites and crows ; nor meddled [they]6630-they with any of [their]6630-they gear or weapons . But [they]6630-they speedily found [Hugh]124-hugh 's raiment , and [his]124-hugh pouch , wherein was money good store ; and [they]6630-they found also rings and ouches and girdles , which had been torn from the damsels in the first rage of [their]6630-they taking .

First though , when [they]6630-they had gathered together such horses as [they]6630-they needed , and let the rest run wild , [Birdalone]101-birdalone brought [[her]101-birdalone [she]101-birdalone - friends]2054-her she - friends down into [the dale]2735-the dale , and did [them]2054-her she - friends to bathe in [a pool of the stream]6648-a pool of the stream , and tended [them]2054-her she - friends as if [she]101-birdalone were [[their]2054-her she - friends tire - woman]6649-their tire - woman , so that [they]2054-her she - friends were mightily refreshed ; and [she]101-birdalone made garlands for [them]2054-her she - friends of the woodland flowers , as eglantine and honeysuckle ; and [herself]101-birdalone , [she]101-birdalone bathed [her]101-birdalone , and did not on [her]101-birdalone battle - gear again , but clad [her]101-birdalone body in [[her]101-birdalone woman]6650-her woman 's array .

Then [she]101-birdalone brought forth victual and wine from [[Habundia]106-habundia 's store]6651-habundia 's store , and set it out on [the stream - side]6094-the stream - side ; and thereafter [she]101-birdalone went up the bent to the green way and fetched down [Hugh]124-hugh and [Arthur]157-arthur , and brought [them]2054-her she - friends to [the ladies]2309-the ladies , and bade [them]2309-the ladies note how trim and lovely [they]2054-her she - friends were gotten again , and again it could scarce be but that kisses and caresses were toward ; and in all content and love [they]2054-her she - friends took [their]2054-her she - friends breakfast , though bitter - sweet unto [Atra]117-atra had been the holding of [her]117-atra hand by [Arthur]157-arthur and the kissing of [her]117-atra cheek , albeit not for worlds had [she]101-birdalone foregone it .

So there [they]2054-her she - friends abode merrily for some three hours , whereas the day was yet young ; and [they]2054-her she - friends asked and told [each other]580-each other much , so that the whole tale , both of [the seekers]6655-the seekers from [the world]430-the world and of [the seekers]6655-the seekers from [the water - side]365-the water - side , came out little by little . Now of the last [ye]6659-ye have heard what there is to tell , but for the others [Viridis]116-viridis took up the tale , as erst [she]116-viridis did with the dealings of [the Knights of the Quest]6660-the knights of the quest in [the Isle of Increase Unsought]22-the isle of increase unsought ; and it seemed by [her]116-viridis tale that [Hugh]124-hugh and [the ladies]2309-the ladies , though [they]2054-her she - friends were living happily and prosperously in [the land of [the Green Mountains]91-the green mountains]6662-the land of the green mountains , wherein [Hugh]124-hugh had wealth enow , yet the thought both of [Arthur]157-arthur and of [Birdalone]101-birdalone would not out of [their]2054-her she - friends minds , and often it was that [they]2054-her she - friends thought of [them]2054-her she - friends , not as [friends]416-friends think of friends of whom [they]416-friends are content to know that [they]416-friends are yet alive and most - like thriving , but as [friends]416-friends think of friends whose absence cuts a shard out of [their]2054-her she - friends lives , so that [they]416-friends long to see [them]2054-her she - friends day by day . Wherefore it came to this at last , after much talk hereof , that [Hugh]124-hugh left [his]124-hugh possessions and [[his]124-hugh children]6665-his children for [he]124-hugh had [two women- bairns born of [Viridis]116-viridis in the keeping of [trusty folk]6667-trusty folk]6666-two women- bairns born of viridis in the keeping of trusty folk , and took with [him]124-hugh [Viridis]116-viridis [[his]124-hugh wife]6668-his wife , and [Aurea]116-viridis and [Atra]117-atra , and [they]6669-they set out to seek those twain [the world]430-the world over till [they]6669-they should find [them]2054-her she - friends . And first by the rede of [Atra]117-atra [they]6669-they fared to [Greenford]45-greenford , and there tarried a month , and sought tidings of many , and heard a word here and there whereby [they]6669-they deemed that [Birdalone]101-birdalone had passed therethrough some little time before . So [they]6669-they went thence to [the Castle of [the Quest]31-the quest]1931-the castle of the quest , and found [it]1931-the castle of the quest in such plight as [ye]6672-ye have heard , and it went sore to [their]6669-they hearts to behold it and to be there . But therewithal [they]6669-they happed upon [Leonard]137-leonard [the priest]1984-the priest , and [he]137-leonard was rejoiced beyond measure to see [them]6669-they , and told [them]6669-they all that [ye]6672-ye have heard concerning [Birdalone]101-birdalone 's coming thither and departing thence ; and [he]137-leonard told [them]6669-they therewith about those hauntings and sendings in [the hall of [the castle]1838-the castle]4510-the hall of the castle , and that [they]6669-they came to an end the very day that [Birdalone]101-birdalone departed thence in [the Sending Boat]832-the sending boat . Yet for the last three days there had been visions therein ; but being questioned [he]137-leonard was loth to tell [thereof]6677-thereof , so [they]6669-they forbore [him]137-leonard a while .

At these tidings [they]6669-they were sore moved , and [they]6669-they talked the matter over betwixt [themselves]6669-they and [Leonard]137-leonard also was in [their]6669-they redes , and [they]6669-they must needs deem that either [Birdalone]101-birdalone was cast away , or that [she]101-birdalone had come to [[her]101-birdalone old dwelling]6678-her old dwelling , [the House under [the Wood]348-the wood]2453-the house under the wood , and belike had fallen into the hands of [the witch]407-the witch once more , and thereat were [they]6669-they sore downcast ; and yet somewhat it was , that [they]6669-they had heard sure tidings of [her]101-birdalone ; though meanwhile of [Arthur]157-arthur had [they]6669-they heard nought .

While [they]6669-they talked this over , [Atra]117-atra , who had been somewhat silent , spake and said : Here are [we]6669-they brought to a stop with the first tidings which [we]6669-they have heard , whereas [we]6669-they know no manner of wending [the Great Water]30-the great water . This seemeth evil , but let [us]6669-they not be cast down , or die redeless . [Ye]6682-ye have heard of what sayeth Sir Leonard of these hauntings in [the hall]1202-the hall , and how that [they]6669-they have come back again , wherefore why should [we]6669-they not sleep in [the hall]1202-the hall this night , those of [us]6669-they at least who have not so much fear as not to note [them]6669-they well , to see if [we]6669-they may draw any avail from [them]6669-they ? How say [ye]6682-ye ? For [my]0-i part [I]0-i will try the adventure , whatever may come of it .

Now [they]6669-they all yeasaid it , though [Aurea]116-viridis was somewhat timorous , albeit [she]116-viridis would not be parted from [the others]1301-the others ; so when night came there [they]6669-they made [their]6669-they beds and lay down ; and the end of it was , that a little before midnight [Atra]117-atra waked [the others]1301-the others , and did [them]1301-the others to wit that by [her]117-atra deeming something was toward ; and presently [they]6669-they were all four as wide awake as ever [they]6669-they were in [their]6669-they lives ; and next , without any sound that was strange , there came the image of [a woman on to the dais]6687-a woman on to the dais , clad in green like to [an huntress of ancient days]6688-an huntress of ancient days , [her]117-atra feet sandalled , [her]117-atra skirts gathered up into [her]117-atra girdle , so that [her]117-atra legs were naked ; [she]117-atra had a quiver at [her]117-atra back , and a great bow in [her]117-atra hand .

Now to all of [them]6669-they save [Atra]117-atra this appearance seemed to be the image of [Birdalone]101-birdalone ; but [she]117-atra told [[her]117-atra fellows]6689-her fellows afterwards , that to [her]117-atra it seemed not to be altogether [Birdalone]101-birdalone , but rather [some other one most like unto [her]117-atra , as it were [[her]117-atra twin - sister]6691-her twin - sister]6690-some other one most like unto her , as it were her twin - sister .

Gazed the image kindly and sweetly on [them]6669-they , so that [they]6669-they beheld it without fear ; and it seemed to [them]6669-they that it gave forth speech ; yet not so much that the sound of words was in the air about and smote [their]6669-they ears , as that the sense of words reached the minds of [them]6669-they . And this was the tale of it : [Ye]6692-ye , who are seeking the lost , have done well to come hither , and now shall [ye]6692-ye do well to wend the straightest way to [the dwelling of [the wildwood]523-the wildwood]6693-the dwelling of the wildwood , and that is by way of [the western verge of Evilshaw the forest]6695-the western verge of evilshaw the forest . [Greenford]45-greenford is on the way . [Way- leaders [ye]6692-ye shall get]6696-way- leaders ye shall get ; be wise , yet not prudent , and take [them]6696-way- leaders ye shall get , though [they]6696-way- leaders ye shall get be evil , and [your]6692-ye luck may well avail .

Therewith the image vanished away as it had come , and [Leonard]137-leonard , who with [the others]1301-the others took the appearance for an image of [Birdalone]101-birdalone , said that it was such as [he]137-leonard had seen it the three last days . So [they]6669-they lay not down again , but departed for [Greenford]45-greenford without tarrying , and rode the other end of the short night through till [they]6669-they came to [Greenford]45-greenford . But [Leonard]137-leonard would not with [them]6669-they ; and [Hugh]124-hugh behight [him]137-leonard , if [he]137-leonard lived and did well , to come back somehow to [the Castle of [the Quest]31-the quest]1931-the castle of the quest , and so redo it that [it]1931-the castle of the quest should be no longer desolate . So to [Greenford]45-greenford [they]6669-they came , and spared not to do [folk to wit]6699-folk to wit that [they]6669-they would ride a pilgrimage in [Evilshaw]4-evilshaw , and were fain of [way - leaders]6700-way - leaders ; and there [they]6669-they dwelt a day or two , and [many]6701-many would let [them]6669-they of that journey , which , said [they]6669-they , was rather deadly than perilous only . But on the third day came to [Sir Hugh]124-hugh [two stout carles well weaponed , who said that [they]6702-two stout carles well weaponed , who said that they knew well all the ways that led to evilshaw , and the ways that went therethrough knew well all the ways that led to [Evilshaw]4-evilshaw , and the ways that went therethrough]6702-two stout carles well weaponed , who said that they knew well all the ways that led to evilshaw , and the ways that went therethrough , and [they]6702-two stout carles well weaponed , who said that they knew well all the ways that led to evilshaw , and the ways that went therethrough offered [themselves]6702-two stout carles well weaponed , who said that they knew well all the ways that led to evilshaw , and the ways that went therethrough for a wage to [Sir Hugh]124-hugh . Now [these said carles]6703-these said carles were not over fair of favour , but seemed somewhat of ribalds , nor would [Sir Hugh]124-hugh have taken [them]6703-these said carles to service in [[his]124-hugh house at [home]387-home]6704-his house at home ; but [he]124-hugh called to mind that it were more prudence than wisdom to spoil [his]124-hugh journey and lose the occasion of finding [[his]124-hugh dear friends]6706-his dear friends for the hasty judgment of [a man]234-a man 's face and demeanour , wherefore [he]124-hugh waged [these two men]6708-these two men , and [they]6708-these two men set out for [the western edges of [Evilshaw]4-evilshaw]6709-the western edges of evilshaw .

[Many towns]6710-many towns and thorps [they]6708-these two men passed through , and everywhere , when [men]219-men knew whither [they]219-men were bound , [they]219-men letted [them]219-men all [they]219-men might in words ; but little heed [they]6708-these two men paid thereto , whereas [they]6708-these two men were all fixed in [their]6708-these two men rede that nought was to be done save the finding of [[their]6708-these two men friends]4365-their friends , and that [their]6708-these two men life - days were spoiled if [they]219-men found [them]219-men not . And moreover , [each one of [them]6708-these two men]2350-each one of them , but especially [Atra]117-atra and [Viridis]116-viridis , had dreams of the night from time to time , wherein [they]6708-these two men seemed to see [the green - clad woman]6714-the green - clad woman , were [she]6714-the green - clad woman [Birdalone]101-birdalone or another , beckoning and bidding [them]6708-these two men to enter [the Wood of Evilshaw]92-the wood of evilshaw .

As to [those two way - leaders withal]6715-those two way - leaders withal , whether it were that [they]6708-these two men got used to [their]6708-these two men faces , or that [their]6708-these two men ways and manners were nought uncourteous or fierce , [they]6708-these two men doubted [them]6708-these two men less and less as time wore ; all save [Viridis]116-viridis , whose flesh crept when [they]6708-these two men drew anigh [her]116-viridis , as will betide one who comes across an evil - looking creeping thing . As for [Atra]117-atra , [she]117-atra now began to heed little the things about [her]117-atra , as if [her]117-atra heart were wholly set on the end of the journey .

But now at last were [they]6708-these two men come so far that [they]6708-these two men had no choice but to use [the said way - leaders]6716-the said way - leaders , for [they]6708-these two men were gotten to [the edge of [Evilshaw]4-evilshaw]6717-the edge of evilshaw . So [they]6708-these two men entered [it]6717-the edge of evilshaw , and [those two]2209-those two led [them]6708-these two men by half - blind ways and paths amongst the thickets , and fumbled never with [the road]2103-the road .

Five days [they]6708-these two men went thus , and on the fifth evening [they]6708-these two men lay down to sleep in [the wood]348-the wood , and it was the turn of [those two hirelings]6721-those two hirelings to keep watch and ward , and [they]6708-these two men woke not the next morn save with the hands of the Red Felons at [their]6708-these two men throats , so that [Hugh]124-hugh was bound , and [[his]124-hugh two trusty men who came with [him]124-hugh from [the Green Mountains]91-the green mountains]6722-his two trusty men who came with him from the green mountains were slain before a stroke might be struck .

This was the end of [Viridis]116-viridis ' tale , save that [she]116-viridis told how that it was [she]116-viridis that had uttered those two shrieks which [Arthur]157-arthur and [Birdalone]101-birdalone had heard from the thicket ; and that [she]116-viridis had so done when [the two false way - leaders]7218-the two false way - leaders laid hold of [her]116-viridis to drag [her]116-viridis away from [[her]116-viridis man]3698-her man , who stood there before [her]116-viridis bound to a tree that [he]3698-her man might perish there , whereon [the two caitiffs]7220-the two caitiffs had smitten [her]116-viridis into unwit that [they]7220-the two caitiffs might have no more of [her]116-viridis cries .[116-viridis]

Now when all this had been told , and [they]6723-they had abided awhile in [the fair little dale]6724-the fair little dale , and had said many kind endearing words of friendship , [they]6723-they went up on the green way again , and took what of the horses [they]6723-they needed and trussed [their]6723-they goods thereon and [Birdalone]101-birdalone would not leave that brave armour which [Habundia]106-habundia had given [her]101-birdalone , and [they]6723-they dight others for [their]6723-they home - riding , and the rest [they]6723-they turned loose into [the woods]463-the woods , and so rode [their]6723-they ways , [Birdalone]101-birdalone going ever with [Atra]117-atra , and [Arthur]157-arthur by [Aurea]116-viridis ; but [Viridis]116-viridis must needs have [Hugh]124-hugh within reach of [her]116-viridis hand all the way .

Good speed [they]6723-they made , so that ere the night had fallen on [them]6723-they , though the sun was set , [they]6723-they ' had come to [the House under [the Wood]348-the wood]2453-the house under the wood ; and there again was joy and wondering of [the new - comers]7129-the new - comers , and merry feasting on such simple victuals as were there , and good - night and rest in all contentment in [the house where erst had [Birdalone]101-birdalone tholed so many griefs and fears]7224-the house where erst had birdalone tholed so many griefs and fears .[6723-they]

Here ends the Sixth Part of [the Water of [the Wondrous Isles]1-the wondrous isles]1065-the water of the wondrous isles , which is called [The Days of Absence]6727-the days of absence , and begins the Seventh Part , which is called The Days of Returning .

THE SEVENTH PART : THE DAYS OF RETURNING

CHAPTER I. [SIR HUGH ASKETH BIRDALONE]209-birdalone WHERE [SHE]101-birdalone WOULD HAVE THE ABODE OF [THEIR]6723-they FELLOWSHIP TO BE

On the next day , [they]6723-they arose and were glad , and it was to [them]6723-they as if the sun of the early summer had arisen for nought save to shine on [their]6723-they happy day . And [they]6723-they went about from place to place whereas tidings had befallen [Birdalone]209-birdalone ; and [she]101-birdalone served [them]6723-they one and all as if [she]101-birdalone were [[their]6723-they handmaid]6728-their handmaid , and [they]6723-they loved [her]101-birdalone and caressed [her]101-birdalone , and had been fain to do all [her]101-birdalone will did [they]6723-they but know it .

In this wise wore day after day till June began to wane , and then on a time came [Hugh]209-birdalone unto [Birdalone]209-birdalone , and spake unto [her]101-birdalone and said : All [we]6723-they have been talking together , and [I]0-i am sent to ask [thee]101-birdalone what is in [thy]101-birdalone mind as to abiding here or going elsewhither . For now that [we]6723-they be come together again , not for [all the kingdoms of [the world]430-the world]6729-all the kingdoms of the world would [we]6723-they sunder again ; and above all , [none of [us]6723-they]6731-none of us would leave [thee]101-birdalone , O [[my]0-i sister]1171-my sister . But if [thou]101-birdalone wilt come with [me]0-i to [[our]6723-they land under [the Green Mountains]91-the green mountains]6733-our land under the green mountains , there is for [thee]101-birdalone a pleasant place and [a fair dwelling]6734-a fair dwelling , and honour from [all folk]3407-all folk , and [our]6723-they love that shall never leave [thee]101-birdalone ; and [I]0-i , and [Arthur]157-arthur [[my]0-i brother]4044-my brother , [we]6723-they shall win fame together amongst [the knighthood]4816-the knighthood , and [thou]101-birdalone shalt be proud and glad both of [him]4044-my brother and of [me]0-i .

[She]1171-my sister said : And if [I]0-i may not go with [thee]4044-my brother thither , what other way is there to escape the sundering ? Said [Hugh]209-birdalone : This , that [thou]101-birdalone choose in [the world]430-the world what land liketh [thee]101-birdalone for [a dwelling - place]6739-a dwelling - place , and [we]6723-they will go with [thee]101-birdalone and leave [thee]101-birdalone never , and [thou]101-birdalone shalt be [[our]6723-they lady]488-our lady and [queen]6741-queen . Then [he]209-birdalone laughed and said : Yet , [[our]6723-they lady]488-our lady , [I]0-i have left behind [me]0-i under [the Green Mountains]91-the green mountains certain things which [I]0-i love , as [two fair women-]6743-two fair women- [children]1288-children , and [a squire or two whose fathers]6745-a squire or two whose fathers served [[my]0-i fathers]7079-my fathers , and whose children [I]0-i would should serve [[my]0-i children]6747-my children . And moreover [I]0-i have left there certain matters of avail , [my]0-i wealth and livelihood to wit . Wilt [thou]6748-thou begrudge it if [I]0-i must needs go fetch these , and bring [them]6749-them to [the land where [thou]6748-thou dwellest]6750-the land where thou dwellest , through whatever peril [we]6751-we may have to face ?

Dear art [thou]6748-thou , [she]6752-she said , and [[my]0-i very friend]6753-my very friend , but tell [me]0-i : how sorry wouldst [thou]6748-thou be to leave [thine]6754-thine [own land]6755-own land and follow after [me]0-i for the sake of [one who is neither thine own true love nor of [thy]6754-thine kindred]6756-one who is neither thine own true love nor of thy kindred ? Said [he]6753-my very friend : Not so sorry that [I]0-i should grudge against [thee]6752-she thereafter . Moreover if that much of sorrow came to [me]0-i , [I]0-i should deem it not ill , lest [I]0-i grow so over - happy that the luck rise up against [me]0-i and undo [me]0-i .

[She]6752-she said , smiling on [him]6753-my very friend kindly : Meseems that [I]0-i am over - happy , whereas [I]0-i have such dear cherishing of [noble friends]6757-noble friends . But now [I]0-i will tell [thee]6753-my very friend all , and maybe [thou]6753-my very friend wilt love [me]0-i the less for the telling . In [these woods]6171-these woods here , and [lady]504-lady and [mistress of [them]6171-these woods]6760-mistress of them , dwelleth [one who is not of the race of [Adam]103-adam]6761-one who is not of the race of adam . And [she]6752-she helped and cherished [me]0-i and gave [me]0-i wisdom when [I]0-i was tormented and accursed , and [she]6752-she it was who saved [me]0-i from [the evil witch]6762-the evil witch , and gave [me]0-i the good hap to meet [your]6763-you loves and to fetch [you]6763-you to [their]6764-their helping ; and twice hath [she]6752-she saved [me]0-i from mortal peril otherwise . And [she]6752-she hath found [me]0-i [my]0-i love , [[thy]6752-she brother]6765-thy brother [Arthur]157-arthur , and delivered [him]157-arthur from [unwit and wanhope]6766-unwit and wanhope ; and [she]6752-she it is who drew all [you]6763-you hither unto [us]6767-us , and who delivered [you]6763-you from [the felons who had mastered [you]6763-you]6768-the felons who had mastered you . And [I]0-i have sworn unto [her]6752-she that [I]0-i would never wholly sunder [me]0-i from [her]6752-she ; and how shall [I]0-i break [mine]0-i oath and grieve [her]6752-she , even had [I]0-i the will thereto , as [God]120-god wot [I]0-i have not ? And [she]6752-she wept therewith .

But [Hugh]209-birdalone kissed [her]6752-she and said : [Birdalone]209-birdalone , [[my]0-i dear]2256-my dear , why weepest [thou]6752-she ? Didst [thou]6752-she not hear [my]0-i word , that [[thy]6752-she people]6770-thy people should be [[my]0-i people]6771-my people , and [thy]6752-she land [[my]0-i land]6169-my land , and that whither [thou]6752-she goest [I]0-i will go ? Dost [thou]6752-she not trow [me]0-i then ? Or how deemest [thou]6752-she [I]0-i may tear [[thy]6752-she friend]2239-thy friend Viridis from [thee]6752-she , when [she]2239-thy friend hath just found [thee]6752-she ? But tell [me]0-i , hast [thou]6752-she in [thy]6752-she mind any dwelling - place other than this ?

Yea , [she]2239-thy friend said : [I]0-i may not depart very far from [this forest of Evilshaw]6774-this forest of evilshaw lest [I]0-i grieve [my]0-i wisdom - mother overmuch . But if [one]515-one go westward through [the wood]348-the wood , [he]515-one shall happen at last , when [he]515-one cometh forth of [it]348-the wood , on [a good town hight Utterhay]4774-a good town hight utterhay , which lieth on [the very edge thereof]6778-the very edge thereof . There was [I]0-i born , and there also [I]0-i look to find [three dear and trusty friends to whom [I]0-i owe return of [their]6779-three dear and trusty friends to whom i owe return of their much kindness much kindness]6779-three dear and trusty friends to whom i owe return of their much kindness . [It]4774-a good town hight utterhay is [a noble town]6780-a noble town in [a pleasant land]6781-a pleasant land , and [thou]6782-thou and [[my]0-i lord]2574-my lord [Arthur]157-arthur may well win both honour and worship and lordship there . And wholly [I]0-i trust in [thy]6782-thou word that [thou]6782-thou wilt not grudge against [me]0-i for dragging [thee]6782-thou thither .

Therewith [she]6782-thou gave [him]6784-him [her]6782-thou hand , smiling on [him]6784-him , though there was yet trouble in [her]6782-thou face . But [he]6784-him took the hand and held it , and laughed merrily and said : Lo now ! how good it is for [friends]416-friends to take counsel together ! What better may [we]6786-we do than go with [thee]6782-thou thither ? And how greatly will [Viridis]116-viridis rejoice when [she]116-viridis heareth of this . Now will [I]0-i go and tell [her]116-viridis and [the others]1301-the others .

Go then , [dear lad]5176-dear lad , [she]6782-thou said ; but as to the matter of [thy]6782-thou fetching [[thy]6782-thou children]6789-thy children and livelihood hither , that may be not so hard nor so perilous as [thou]6782-thou deemest ; and [thou]6782-thou shalt go about it whenso [thou]6782-thou wilt , and the sooner the better , and [we]6786-we shall abide [thee]6782-thou here as long as need may be . And therewith [he]6784-him went [his]6784-him ways to tell [Viridis]116-viridis and the others of this rede which [they]6790-they had come to between [them]6790-they .

CHAPTER II . [BIRDALONE]209-birdalone TAKETH COUNSEL WITH [HER]6791-her WOOD - MOTHER CONCERNING THE MATTER OF [SIR HUGH]209-birdalone

On that same day went [Birdalone]209-birdalone to [the Oak of [Tryst]13-tryst]12-the oak of tryst and called [her]6791-her wood - mother to [her]6791-her , and [she]6791-her came glad and smiling , and kissed and embraced [Birdalone]209-birdalone , and said unto [her]6791-her : Now [I]0-i see that [thou]0-i art well content with this last matter [I]0-i have done for [thee]0-i , whereas [thou]0-i art come to crave a new gift of [me]0-i . How knowest [thou]0-i that ? said [Birdalone]209-birdalone , laughing . Said Habundia :

Wouldst [thou]0-i have come to [me]0-i so soon otherwise from out of all that happiness ? [I]0-i have come to tell [thee]0-i of [my]0-i rede , said [Birdalone]209-birdalone , and to ask [thee]0-i if [thou]0-i art like - minded with [me]0-i thereon . Said [the wood- wife]5964-the wood- wife : And what is [thy]0-i rede , [[my]0-i child]915-my child ? [Wood - mother]1915-wood - mother , said [Birdalone]209-birdalone , [we]6795-we deem that it were good for [us]6795-we all to go down into [Utterhay]3-utterhay where [I]0-i was born , and to take up [our]6795-we abode therein .

Said [the wood - wife]570-the wood - wife : This rede [I]0-i praise , and even so would [I]0-i have counselled [you]915-my child to do ; but [I]0-i abided to see if it should come from out of [thy]0-i breast , and now even so it hath done ; wherefore [I]0-i understand [thy]0-i wisdom and rejoice in [thee]915-my child . And now crave [thy]0-i boon , [[my]0-i child]915-my child , and [thou]0-i shalt have it without fail .

[Yea]6798-yea , said [Birdalone]209-birdalone , that will [I]0-i , and the more that it is a simple one and easy for [thee]915-my child to do . [Thou]0-i knowest that [Hugh the Green Knight]124-hugh hath come with [[my]0-i she - friends]6799-my she - friends seeking [us]6800-us all the way from under [the Green Mountains]6801-the green mountains , and [he]124-hugh hath left there goods that [he]124-hugh needs must have [and folk whom [he]124-hugh loves]6802-and folk whom he loves ; and now [he]124-hugh would go back thither , and fetch all that away hither , and see to [his]124-hugh matters as soon as may be . And [I]0-i would have [thee]915-my child counsel [us]6800-us what to do , whether to build a barque , as perchance [we]6800-us may get it done , and sail [the lake therein]6803-the lake therein to [the Castle of [the Quest]31-the quest]1931-the castle of the quest or thereabout , and thence to ride to [[his]124-hugh land]6805-his land ; or else to take [thy]124-hugh guidance and safe - conduct through [the wood]348-the wood , and to bring [[his]124-hugh folk]1337-his folk back the same way .

Said [the wood - wife]570-the wood - wife : As to the way by water , [I]0-i may help [you]6809-you little therein , and meseemeth that way be many traps and wiles and many perils . Wherefore [I]0-i bid [you]6809-you try it not , but let [the Green Knight]1331-the green knight come up hither to this tree to - morrow before noon , all horsed and armed and arrayed , and there shall [he]1331-the green knight find three men armed in green gear , horsed well , and leading two sumpter - beasts with [them]6811-them ; and [they]6811-them shall be [his]1331-the green knight until [he]1331-the green knight giveth [them]6811-them back unto [me]0-i . But if [he]1331-the green knight doubteth any thing betwixt [the wood]348-the wood 's end and under [the Green Mountains]6801-the green mountains , let [him]1331-the green knight wage what folk [he]1331-the green knight will besides , for these [[my]0-i men]5098-my men will have money enough of [his]1331-the green knight with [them]6811-them . But by no means let [him]1331-the green knight send [them]6811-them away till [he]1331-the green knight hath done with [the wood]348-the wood altogether , both betwixt here and [the western dwelt - land]6816-the western dwelt - land , and here and [Utterhay]3-utterhay , save [thou]6817-thou be with [him]1331-the green knight . But while these be with [him]1331-the green knight , both [he]1331-the green knight and whatsoever money [he]1331-the green knight bringeth shall be sure from all peril whiles [they]6811-them be in [the wood]348-the wood . Now , [[my]0-i child]915-my child , was not this the boon [thou]6817-thou camest up hither to ask of [me]0-i ?

[Yea]6820-yea verily , said [Birdalone]209-birdalone ; yet also [I]0-i came up hither to praise [thee]915-my child and thank [thee]915-my child and love [thee]915-my child . And [she]915-my child threw [herself]915-my child into [Habundia]106-habundia 's arms and kissed and caressed [her]915-my child , and [Habundia]106-habundia [her]915-my child in like wise .

Spake [the wood - wife]570-the wood - wife : [Thou]915-my child art [the beloved child of]6822-the beloved child of [my]0-i wisdom ; and now [I]0-i see of [thee]915-my child that [thou]915-my child wilt be faithful and true and loving unto [me]0-i unto the end . And [I]0-i think [I]0-i can see that [thou]915-my child and [[thy]915-my child man]4622-thy man shall do well and happily in [Utterhay]3-utterhay ; and [the Green Knight]1331-the green knight also and [[thy]915-my child she - friends]5332-thy she - friends . And whatsoever [thou]915-my child wilt of [me]0-i that [I]0-i may do for [thee]915-my child or [[thy]915-my child friends]2122-thy friends , ask it freely , and freely shalt [thou]915-my child have it . But this [I]0-i will bid [thee]915-my child , that the while [the Green Knight]124-hugh shall be gone about [his]124-hugh matter , [thou]124-hugh shalt come hither to [me]0-i often ; and [[thy]915-my child friends]2122-thy friends also [thou]124-hugh shalt bring to [me]0-i , that [I]0-i may see [them]2122-thy friends and talk to [them]2122-thy friends and love [them]2122-thy friends . And specially shalt [thou]124-hugh bid [Atra]117-atra unto [me]0-i ; for meseems [she]117-atra is so wise already that [I]0-i may learn [her]117-atra more wisdom , and put that into [her]117-atra heart which may solace [her]117-atra and make [her]117-atra to cease from fretting [her]117-atra own heart , and from grief and longing overmuch . And [I]0-i were fain to reward [her]117-atra in that [she]117-atra hath forborne to grudge against [thee]6828-thee and to bear [thee]6828-thee enmity . For [I]0-i know , [[my]0-i child]915-my child , not from [mine]0-i own heart , but from the wisdom [I]0-i have learned , how hardly [the children of [Adam]103-adam]562-the children of adam may bear to have that which [they]562-the children of adam love taken away from [them]562-the children of adam by [another]6831-another , even if [they]562-the children of adam [themselves]562-the children of adam might in the long last have wearied of it and cast it away [their]562-the children of adam own selves . Go now , [[my]0-i child]915-my child , and do [[thy]6828-thee friend]2239-thy friend to wit what [I]0-i will do for [him]2239-thy friend .

Therewith [they]6834-they parted , and [Birdalone]209-birdalone fared [home]387-home to [the house]325-the house , and found the fellowship of [them]6834-they all sitting by [the brookside]6837-the brookside , and talking sweetly together in all joy and hope of what [their]6834-they life should be in [the new land whereto]6838-the new land whereto [Birdalone]209-birdalone would lead [them]6834-they . Straightway then [she]6839-her told [them]6834-they of [Hugh]209-birdalone and [his]209-birdalone journey , and how well [he]209-birdalone should be guarded in [the wood]348-the wood both coming and going . And [they]6834-they thought that right good , and [they]6834-they thanked [her]6839-her and praised [her]6839-her , and took [her]6839-her into [their]6834-they talk , and [she]6839-her sat down by [them]6834-they happily .

CHAPTER III . OF THE JOURNEYING THROUGH [THE FOREST OF]6841-the forest of [EVILSHAW]97-evilshaw UNTO [THE TOWN OF UTTERHAY]6842-the town of utterhay

On the morrow in due time [Birdalone]209-birdalone , going afoot , led [Sir Hugh]209-birdalone , all- armed and horsed , to [the Oak of Tryst]12-the oak of tryst , and there [they]6834-they found [the three men - at - arms]6843-the three men - at - arms , well - weaponed and in green weed , abiding [them]6843-the three men - at - arms . [They]6843-the three men - at - arms did obeisance to [Sir Hugh]209-birdalone , and [he]209-birdalone greeted [them]6843-the three men - at - arms , and then without more ado [he]209-birdalone kissed [Birdalone]209-birdalone and went [his]209-birdalone ways with [his]209-birdalone way - leaders , but [Birdalone]209-birdalone turned back to [the house]325-the house and [[her]6845-her friends]1314-her friends .

Next day [Birdalone]209-birdalone brought [[her]6845-her three [she]6845-her - friends]6847-her three she - friends unto [the Trysting Oak]94-the trysting oak , and showed [them]6847-her three she - friends to [the wood - mother]934-the wood - mother , and [she]6845-her was kind and soft with [them]6847-her three she - friends ; and both [Aurea]116-viridis and [Viridis]116-viridis were shy with [her]6845-her , and as if [they]6847-her three she - friends feared [her]6845-her , but [Atra]117-atra was frank and free , and spake boldly . And thereafter when [Birdalone]209-birdalone went to meet [[her]6845-her wood - mother]908-her wood - mother , [Atra]117-atra would go with [her]117-atra if [she]117-atra were asked , and at last would go alone , when [she]117-atra found that [Habundia]106-habundia was fain of [her]117-atra coming , so that there were not many days when [they]6850-they met not ; and [the wood - wife]570-the wood - wife fell to learning [her]570-the wood - wife the lore of [the earth]445-the earth , as [she]570-the wood - wife had done aforetime with [Birdalone]209-birdalone ; and [Atra]117-atra waxed ruddier and merrier of countenance , whereof was [Birdalone]209-birdalone right glad , and [Arthur]157-arthur yet more glad , and [the others]1301-the others well content .

So wore the time till [Hugh]209-birdalone had been gone for twenty and three days , and as [they]6850-they walked [the meadows]2079-the meadows anigh [the house about undern]6855-the house about undern , [they]6850-they saw [a knight]1353-a knight riding down the bent toward [them]6850-they , and presently [they]6850-they knew [him]1353-a knight for [Hugh]209-birdalone , and turned and hastened to meet [him]1353-a knight , so that [he]1353-a knight was straightway amidst [them]6850-they , and on foot . Dear then were the greetings and caresses betwixt [them]6850-they , and when it was over , and [Birdalone]209-birdalone had led away [his]209-birdalone horse and dight it for [him]209-birdalone , and had gotten [him]209-birdalone victuals and drink , and [they]6850-they were all sitting on the grass together , [he]209-birdalone told [them]6850-they how [he]209-birdalone had fared . [He]209-birdalone had done all [his]209-birdalone matters in [the Land under [the Green Mountains]91-the green mountains]6857-the land under the green mountains , and had given over [[his]209-birdalone lands and [houses]5389-houses]6858-his lands and houses to [a man of [his]209-birdalone lineage]6860-a man of his lineage , [[his]209-birdalone cousin]6861-his cousin , [a good knight]6862-a good knight , and had taken from [him]209-birdalone of gold and goods what [he]209-birdalone would . Then [he]209-birdalone had taken [[his]209-birdalone two bairns]6863-his two bairns and [[their]6863-his two bairns nurse]6864-their nurse , and [an old squire]6865-an old squire and [five sergeants]6866-five sergeants , whereof one was [[his]209-birdalone foster - brother]6867-his foster - brother , and [the others men somewhat stricken in years]6868-the others men somewhat stricken in years , and had departed with [them]6863-his two bairns . Sithence [he]209-birdalone had come [his]209-birdalone ways to [Greenford]45-greenford , and had held talk therein with [the prior of [a great and fair house of Black Canons]6870-a great and fair house of black canons]6869-the prior of a great and fair house of black canons , and had given [him]209-birdalone no little wealth wherewith to re - do [the Castle of the Quest]1931-the castle of the quest what was needed , and for livelihood of four canons to dwell [there]232-there , and [Leonard]137-leonard to be [[their]6873-they prior]6874-their prior , that there [they]6873-they might remember [Sir Baudoin]123-baudoin [[their]6873-they dear friend]6875-their dear friend daily in [the office]6876-the office , and do good unto [his]123-baudoin soul . Sithence [he]209-birdalone had ridden to [the Castle of the Quest]1931-the castle of the quest with [the said Prior of [St. Austin of Greenford]95-st. austin of greenford]6878-the said prior of st. austin of greenford , and had found [Leonard]137-leonard , and had settled all the business how it was to be done . Thereafter [he]209-birdalone had returned to [Greenford]45-greenford , and gathered [[his]209-birdalone folk]1337-his folk , and got [him]137-leonard gone , under the guidance of [[Habundia]106-habundia 's folk]6880-habundia 's folk , by [castles]6881-castles and thorps and [towns]6882-towns the nearest way to [the edge of [Evilshaw]4-evilshaw]6717-the edge of evilshaw . And [they]6873-they had come to [the forest]4809-the forest , and ridden [it]4809-the forest six days without mishap ; and when [they]6873-they had come to [the Oak of [Tryst]13-tryst]5879-the oak of tryst once more , [the way - leaders]6886-the way - leaders said that it were well if all [they]6873-they together tarried not much longer in [the forest]4809-the forest ; wherefore [they]6886-the way - leaders had brought [them]6873-they to [a fair wood - lawn]2672-a fair wood - lawn , and there [they]6873-they encamped , and were there as now . And , said [Hugh]209-birdalone , there are [they]6873-they abiding [me]0-i , and it is in [my]0-i mind that this very eve [we]6889-we go , all of [us]6889-we , and meet [them]6873-they there , if [ye]6890-ye may truss [your]6890-ye goods in that while ; but as to victuals , [we]6889-we have plenty , and it needeth not . And then to - morrow shall [we]6889-we wend [our]6889-we way as straight as may be toward [the good town of Utterhay]6891-the good town of utterhay .

All [they]6873-they yeasaid it , though in [her]6892-her heart maybe [Birdalone]209-birdalone had been fain of abiding a little longer in [[her]6892-her own land]6893-her own land ; but [she]6892-her spake no word thereof . And [they]6873-they all set to work to the trussing up of [their]6873-they goods , and then turned [their]6873-they backs on [the Great Water]30-the great water , and came up into [the woodland]669-the woodland , and so to [the camp in [the wood - lawn]6896-the wood - lawn]6895-the camp in the wood - lawn . And there had [Viridis]116-viridis a joyful meeting with [[her]116-viridis babes]6897-her babes , and [she]116-viridis gladdened the hearts of [[Sir Hugh]209-birdalone 's men - at - arms]6898-sir hugh 's men - at - arms by [her]116-viridis kind greeting ; and [they]6873-they rejoiced in meeting [Aurea]116-viridis and [Atra]117-atra again , and [they]6873-they wondered at [Birdalone]209-birdalone and [her]116-viridis beauty , and [their]6873-they hearts went out to [her]116-viridis , both [the old men]6899-the old men 's and [the young ones]6900-the young ones . But [[Habundia]106-habundia 's men]6901-habundia 's men looked on it all like images of [warriors]2117-warriors .

There then [they]6901-habundia 's men feasted merrily that evening . But when the morrow was come [they]6901-habundia 's men were speedily on the way toward [Utterhay]3-utterhay ; and [the way- leaders]6903-the way- leaders guided [them]6901-habundia 's men so well and wisely , that by noon of the fifth day [they]6901-habundia 's men were come forth of [the wood]348-the wood and on to the bent that looked down upon [the town of [Utterhay]3-utterhay]6842-the town of utterhay . There turned to [Hugh]209-birdalone [the three way- leaders]6906-the three way- leaders , and spake : [Lord]2620-lord , [we]6901-habundia 's men have done [thee]2620-lord the service which [we]6901-habundia 's men were bidden ; if [thou]2620-lord hast no further need of [us]6901-habundia 's men , give [us]6901-habundia 's men leave .

Said [Hugh]209-birdalone : Leave [ye]2620-lord have , and [I]0-i shall give [you]2620-lord a great reward ere [ye]2620-lord go . Said [the chief of [them]6901-habundia 's men]6908-the chief of them : Nay , [lord]2620-lord , no reward may [we]6901-habundia 's men take , save a token from [thee]2620-lord that [thou]2620-lord art content with [us]6901-habundia 's men . What token shall it be ? said [Hugh]209-birdalone . Quoth [the way - leader]3299-the way - leader : That each of [us]6901-habundia 's men kiss [the Lady Birdalone]155-birdalone on the mouth , for [she]155-birdalone it is that is verily [[our]6901-habundia 's men mistress]1119-our mistress under [[our]6901-habundia 's men great mistress]6912-our great mistress .

Laughed [Hugh]209-birdalone thereat , but [the men]2426-the men laughed not ; then spake [Hugh]209-birdalone : This must be at [the lady]1157-the lady 's own will . Even so , said [they]2426-the men .

Then [Hugh]209-birdalone brought [Birdalone]209-birdalone thither and told [her]155-birdalone what was toward , and [she]155-birdalone consented to the kiss with a good will , and said to each of [the men]2426-the men after [they]2426-the men had kissed [her]155-birdalone : Herewith goeth [my]0-i love to [the mistress]709-the mistress and queen of [the woods]463-the woods ; do [ye]6918-ye bear the same unto [her]709-the mistress . And thereafter [those way - leaders]6919-those way - leaders fared back into [the woods]463-the woods .

Now [they]6919-those way - leaders gather [themselves]6919-those way - leaders together and go down toward [Utterhay]3-utterhay , and make a brave show , what with the sumpter - horses , and the goodly array of [the four ladies]6921-the four ladies , and the glittering war - gear of [the men - at - arms]2679-the men - at - arms ; and [Sir Hugh]209-birdalone and [Sir Arthur]157-arthur displayed [their]6919-those way - leaders pennons as [they]6919-those way - leaders went .

All this saw [the warders]6923-the warders on the wall of [Utterhay]3-utterhay ; and [they]6919-those way - leaders told [the captain of the porte]6924-the captain of the porte , and [he]6924-the captain of the porte came up on to the wall , and [a man]234-a man with [him]6924-the captain of the porte ; and when [he]6924-the captain of the porte saw this bright company coming forth from [the wood]348-the wood , [he]6924-the captain of the porte bade [men]219-men to [him]6924-the captain of the porte , [two score of [them]219-men]6928-two score of them , all weaponed , and [he]6924-the captain of the porte did on [his]6924-the captain of the porte armour , and rode out - a - gates with [them]219-men to meet [those new - comers]6929-those new - comers ; and this [he]6924-the captain of the porte did , not because [he]6924-the captain of the porte did not see [them]219-men to be but few , but because [they]219-men came forth out of [Evilshaw]4-evilshaw , and then doubted if [they]219-men were trustworthy .

So [he]6924-the captain of the porte met [them]219-men two bowshots from the gate , and rode forward till [he]6924-the captain of the porte was close to [the wayfarers]3416-the wayfarers ; and when [he]6924-the captain of the porte beheld the loveliness of [the women]2418-the women , and especially of [Birdalone]209-birdalone , who wore that day the gleaming- glittering gown which [Habundia]106-habundia had given [her]6932-her , [he]6924-the captain of the porte was abashed , and deemed yet more that [he]6924-the captain of the porte had to do with [folk of [the Faery]82-the faery]6933-folk of the faery . But [he]6924-the captain of the porte spake courteously , and said , turning to [Hugh]209-birdalone , who rode the foremost : [Fair sir]2215-fair sir , would [ye]2215-fair sir tell unto [the man whose business it is to safeguard [the good town of Utterhay]6891-the good town of utterhay what [folk]1529-folk [ye]2215-fair sir be]6935-the man whose business it is to safeguard the good town of utterhay what folk ye be , and on what errand [ye]2215-fair sir ride , and how it is that [ye]2215-fair sir come forth from [Evilshaw]4-evilshaw safe , in good case , with pennons displayed , as if [the said wood]235-the said wood were [your]2215-fair sir very own livelihood ? For , sooth to say , hitherto [we]6939-we have found this , that [all men]228-all men dread Evilshaw , and [none]1226-none will enter [it]4-evilshaw uncompelled .

Thereto answered [Hugh]209-birdalone : [I]0-i hight [Sir Hugh the Green Knight]124-hugh , and am come from under [the Green Mountain]96-the green mountain ; and this is [Sir Arthur]157-arthur , called [the Black Squire]1334-the black squire , but a knight [he]157-arthur is verily , and of great kindred and [a warrior most doughty]6943-a warrior most doughty . And [he]157-arthur hath been captain of [the good town of Greenford]3258-the good town of greenford west away through [the wood yonder]6945-the wood yonder a long way , and hath done [the town]319-the town and the frank thereof mickle good service in scattering and destroying [the evil companies of [the Red Hold]49-the red hold]6947-the evil companies of the red hold , which hold [we]6939-we took by force of arms from [the felons who held [it]49-the red hold for the torment and plague of [the country - side]2227-the country - side]6948-the felons who held it for the torment and plague of the country - side .

Now as to [our]6939-we errand , [we]6939-we be minded to dwell in [[your]6950-you good town of [Utterhay]3-utterhay]6951-your good town of utterhay , and take [our]6939-we part with [[your]6950-you folk]6952-your folk , and [we]6939-we have wealth enow thereto , so as to be beholden to [none]1226-none ; and as time goes on [we]6939-we may serve [you]6950-you in divers wise , and not least in this maybe , that with a good will [we]6939-we shall draw sword for [your]6950-you peace and the freedom of [them]6952-your folk of [Utterhay]3-utterhay .

When [the captain]6954-the captain heard these words , [he]6954-the captain made obeisance to [Sir Hugh]124-hugh , and said : [Fair sir]2215-fair sir , though [we]6939-we be here a long way from [Greenford]45-greenford , yet have [we]6939-we heard some tale of the deeds of [you]6950-you , and surely [the porte]6956-the porte and [all the folk]2661-all the folk shall be fain of [your]6950-you corning . Yet [I]0-i pray [thee]6950-you be not wrath ; for there is a custom of [the good town]4670-the good town , that [none]1226-none may enter [its]4670-the good town gates coming from out of [this Forest of Evilshaw]6774-this forest of evilshaw , save [he]1226-none leave some pledge or caution with [me]0-i , be it [his]1226-none wealth , or the body of [some friend or fellow]6961-some friend or fellow , or , if nought else , [his]1226-none very own body . Wherefore if [thou]6950-you , [Sir Green Knight]124-hugh , wilt but give [us]6939-we some sure pledge , then will [I]0-i turn about and ride with [you]6950-you back and through the gate into [Utterhay]3-utterhay ; and doubtless , when [the mayor]6962-the mayor hath seen [you]6950-you and spoken with [you]6950-you , the said pledge shall be rendered to [you]6950-you again .

Ere [Hugh]124-hugh might answer , came [Birdalone]209-birdalone forth and said : [Sir captain]6963-sir captain , if [I]0-i , who am [the lady of the Black Squire]6964-the lady of the black squire here , be hostage good enough , then take [me]0-i , and if need be , chain [me]0-i to make surer of [me]0-i . And [she]0-i drew near unto [him]6963-sir captain smiling , and held out [her]0-i hands as if for the manacles .

But when [the captain]6954-the captain saw [her]0-i thus , all the blood stirred in [his]6954-the captain body for joy of [her]0-i beauty , and [he]6954-the captain might but just sit [his]6954-the captain horse for [his]6954-the captain wonder and longing ; but [he]6954-the captain said : [The saints]225-the saints forbid it , [lady]504-lady , that [I]0-i should do [thee]504-lady any hurt or displeasure , or aught save the most worship [I]0-i may . But [[thy]504-lady hostage]6968-thy hostage [I]0-i will take , [Sir Knight]124-hugh if [thou]504-lady be content to yield [her]0-i , whereas in an hour belike [she]0-i shall be free again . And now fare [we]6969-them all gateward again .

So then [they]6969-them all rode on together , [Birdalone]209-birdalone by [the captain]6954-the captain 's left hand ; and as [they]6969-them passed by [the poor houses without the wall]6971-the poor houses without the wall , [she]504-lady looked and saw the one which had been [[[her]504-lady mother]332-her mother 's dwelling]6973-her mother 's dwelling , so oft and so closely had [she]504-lady told [her]504-lady all about it .

Thus then [they]6969-them entered [Utterhay]3-utterhay , and [the captain]6954-the captain led [them]6969-them straight to [the mote - house]6975-the mote - house whereas [the mayor]6962-the mayor and [the porte]6956-the porte were sitting ; and [much people]6978-much people followed [them]6969-them through [the streets]4674-the streets , wondering at [them]6969-them , and praising the loveliness of [the women]2418-the women , and the frank and gallant bearing of [the men - at - arms]2679-the men - at - arms .

So [they]6969-them lighted down at [the mote - house]6975-the mote - house and were brought to [the mayor]6962-the mayor , and when [he]6962-the mayor had spoken [them]6969-them but a little , and had come to [himself]6962-the mayor again from the fear and abashment that [he]6962-the mayor had of [them]6969-them , [he]6962-the mayor showed [himself]6962-the mayor full fain of [their]6969-them coming , and bade [them]6969-them welcome to [the good town]4670-the good town , and took [them]6969-them into [[his]6962-the mayor own house]4681-his own house to guesting , until [folk]1529-folk might dight [a very goodly house]6987-a very goodly house which [the porte]6956-the porte did give unto [them]6969-them .

But some two hours afterwards , when [they]6969-them were housed in all content , as [they]6969-them sat in [the hall of [the mayor]6962-the mayor , which was great and goodly , talking and devising with worthies of [Utterhay]3-utterhay]6989-the hall of the mayor , which was great and goodly , talking and devising with worthies of utterhay , there entered [two fair and frank - looking young men , who went straight up to [Birdalone]209-birdalone]6991-two fair and frank - looking young men , who went straight up to birdalone , and [the first]6992-the first knelt down before [her]6993-her and kissed [her]6993-her hand , and said : O [[our]6994-our lady]488-our lady , and art [thou]6996-thou verily come to [us]6994-our ! O [our]6994-our happiness and the joy of this day !

But when [she]6993-her saw [him]6992-the first and heard [him]6992-the first and felt the touch of [his]6992-the first hand , [she]6993-her bent down to [him]6992-the first and kissed [him]6992-the first on the forehead , for [she]6993-her knew [him]6992-the first that it was [Robert Gerardson]181-robert .

Then [the other man]6997-the other man came up to [her]6993-her as if [he]6997-the other man also would have knelt to [her]6993-her , but [his]6997-the other man purpose changed , and [he]6997-the other man cast [his]6997-the other man arms about [her]6993-her body and fell to kissing [her]6993-her face all over , weeping the while , and then [he]6997-the other man drew off and stood trembling before [her]6993-her and [she]6993-her , all blushing like a red rose and laughing a little , and yet with the tears in [her]6993-her eyes , said : O [Giles Gerardson]182-giles gerardson , and [thou]6998-thou , [Robert]181-robert , how fain [I]0-i am to see [you]6998-thou twain ; but tell [me]0-i , is [[your]6998-thou father]6999-your father well ? Yea , verily , [[our]7000-our dear lady]5096-our dear lady , said [Robert]181-robert , and it will be unto [him]6999-your father as a fresh draught of youth when [he]6999-your father wotteth that [thou]6998-thou art come to dwell amongst [us]7000-our ; for so it is , [O lady beloved]7002-o lady beloved , is it not ? said [he]181-robert . [Yea]7003-yea , forsooth , or even so [I]0-i hope , said [Birdalone]209-birdalone . But here be other friends that [ye]7003-yea must needs know , if [we]7000-our come to dwell together here in peace ; and then go and fetch [me]0-i hither [[your]7003-yea father]6999-your father .

Therewith [she]0-i presented [them]7005-them unto [Arthur]157-arthur and [Hugh]209-birdalone and [the three ladies of the Quest]7006-the three ladies of the quest , and all [they]7005-them greeted [them]7005-them kindly and in all honour ; and [the Gerardsons]189-gerardsons loved and worshipped [them]7005-them , and especially [the lovely ladies]7007-the lovely ladies , [the she - friends of [[their]189-gerardsons lady]1592-their lady]7008-the she - friends of their lady .

And whiles [they]7000-our were about this , in cometh old [Gerard]187-gerard [himself]187-gerard , and when [Birdalone]209-birdalone saw [him]187-gerard at the door , [she]0-i arose and ran to meet [him]187-gerard , and cast [her]0-i arms about [him]187-gerard as if [she]0-i were [[his]187-gerard own daughter]7010-his own daughter ; and most joyful was the meeting betwixt [them]7000-our .

CHAPTER IV . OF THE ABIDING IN [UTTERHAY]3-utterhay IN LOVE AND CONTENTMENT

Now when seven days were worn , [the mayor]6962-the mayor made a great feast at [[his]6962-the mayor house]1705-his house , and thither were bidden all [the men of the porte]7013-the men of the porte and other worthies , and [great merchants who had come into [[their]7000-our town]7015-their town]7014-great merchants who had come into their town ; and the said feast was given in honour of [these new - comers]7016-these new - comers , and that day [they]7016-these new - comers sat on the dais , and [all the guests]7017-all the guests worshipped [them]7016-these new - comers and wondered at [their]7016-these new - comers beauty ; and nought was spoken of for many days save the glory and hope that there was in [this lovely folk]7018-this lovely folk .

But the next day after the feast were [they]7016-these new - comers brought to [[their]7016-these new - comers house]2007-their house in all triumph ; and it was as fair as might be thought of , and there [they]7016-these new - comers dwelt a while in rest and peace , and great recourse there was there of [Gerard]187-gerard and [[his]187-gerard sons]4698-his sons .

But ere the winter was over , were [Hugh]209-birdalone and [Arthur]157-arthur and [Gerard]187-gerard and [[his]187-gerard sons]4698-his sons taken to [the freedom of [Utterhay]3-utterhay]7022-the freedom of utterhay ; and thereafter spake [the chief men of the porte]7023-the chief men of the porte and [the masters of the crafts]7024-the masters of the crafts unto [the two knights]4513-the two knights by the mouth of [the mayor]6962-the mayor ; and [he]6962-the mayor told [them]7016-these new - comers , what already [they]7016-these new - comers partly knew , that [the good town]4670-the good town had of late gotten [many enemies]7028-many enemies , whereas [it]4670-the good town was wealthy and not very strong , and that now [two such warriors]7029-two such warriors having come amongst [them]7016-these new - comers , [they]7016-these new - comers were minded to strengthen [themselves]7016-these new - comers , if only [they]7016-these new - comers two would of [their]7016-these new - comers gentleness and meekness become [their]7016-these new - comers war - dukes to lead [them]7016-these new - comers against [the foemen]7030-the foemen . But [the two friends]7031-the two friends answered that it was well [their]7016-these new - comers will to dwell there neighbourly , and do [them]7016-these new - comers all the help [they]7016-these new - comers might , and that [they]7016-these new - comers would not gainsay the worship [they]7016-these new - comers offered [them]7016-these new - comers nor the work that should go with it .

With that answer were [all men]228-all men well content and more : and then [the mayor]6962-the mayor said that the mind of [the porte it]7034-the porte it was to strengthen the walls and the gates , and to build [a good and fair castle]7035-a good and fair castle , meet for [any earl]7036-any earl , joining on to the wall by the face that looked west , that is to say , on to [Evilshaw]97-evilshaw ; and that liked [the war - dukes]7037-the war - dukes well .

So when spring came it was set about , but it was five years adoing , and before it was all finished [the war - dukes]7037-the war - dukes entered into it , and dwelt [there]232-there with [[their]7037-the war - dukes wives]7040-their wives and [[their]7037-the war - dukes friends]4365-their friends in all honour . And a little thereafter , whether [they]7016-these new - comers would or no , [the men of [Utterhay]3-utterhay]7042-the men of utterhay had to handle weapons and fare afield to meet the foe with [the valiant men of the crafts]7043-the valiant men of the crafts , and what of [waged men [they]7016-these new - comers might get]7044-waged men they might get . And well and valiantly were [they]7016-these new - comers led by [[their]7016-these new - comers dukes]7045-their dukes , and [they]7016-these new - comers came to [their]7016-these new - comers above , and gained both wealth and honour thereby ; and from that time forward began the increase of [Utterhay]3-utterhay under [those two captains]7046-those two captains , who were unto [them]7016-these new - comers as in old time [the consuls]7047-the consuls had been unto [the Roman folk]7048-the roman folk , save that [they]7047-the consuls changed [them]7048-the roman folk not year by year as [the Romans]7049-the romans were wo nt .

So wore the days , and [all those friends]7050-all those friends dwelt together in harmony and joy ; though the wearing of time wrought changes amongst [them]7050-all those friends . For [Robert Gerardson]181-robert began in no long while to look on [Aurea]116-viridis with eyes of love ; and at last [he]181-robert came to [Birdalone]209-birdalone and craved [her]116-viridis leave to woo [the said lady]7051-the said lady , and [she]116-viridis granted it with a good will , and was fain thereof , whereas [she]116-viridis saw that [Aurea]116-viridis sorely lacked [a mate]7052-a mate ; and scarce might [she]116-viridis have a better than was [Robert]181-robert ; so in process of time [they]7053-they two were wedded and dwelt together happily .

[Forsooth Birdalone]101-birdalone had been fainer yet might [she]116-viridis have seen [Giles Gerardson]182-giles gerardson and [Atra]117-atra drawn together . But though [they]7053-they were [dear friends]1325-dear friends and there was much converse betwixt [them]7053-they , this betid not , so far as [we]7055-we have heard .

[The old Gerard]7056-the old gerard dwelt happily amongst [them]7053-they all for fifteen years after [they]7053-they had come to [Utterhay]3-utterhay , and then fell asleep , [a very old man]7057-a very old man .

As to [the wood of [Evilshaw]97-evilshaw]6321-the wood of evilshaw , it was not once a year only that [Birdalone]101-birdalone and [Arthur]157-arthur sought thither and met [the wood - mother]934-the wood - mother , but a half - score of times or more , might be , in the year 's circle ; and ever was [she]934-the wood - mother kind and loving with [them]7053-they , and [they]7053-they with [her]934-the wood - mother .

But of [all those fellows]7060-all those fellows it was [Atra]117-atra that had longest dealings with [the wood - wife]570-the wood - wife ; for whiles would [she]117-atra leave [Utterhay]3-utterhay and [[her]570-the wood - wife friends]1314-her friends and fare lonesome up into [Evilshaw]4-evilshaw , and find [Habundia]106-habundia and abide with [her]934-the wood - mother in all kindness holden for a month or more . And ever a little before these departures betid would [she]117-atra fall moody and few - spoken , but [she]117-atra came back ever from [the wood]348-the wood calm and kind and well - liking . Amidst all these comings and goings somewhat wore off the terror of [Evilshaw]97-evilshaw ; yet never was it accounted other than a daring deed to enter [it]97-evilshaw alone without fellowship ; and [most]7064-most had liefer that [some man of religion]7065-some man of religion were of [[their]7064-most company]7066-their company therein , or [they]7064-most would bear about [them]7064-most something holy or blessed to hold the evil things .

Now when all this hath been said , [we]7067-we have no more to tell about [this company of friends]7068-this company of friends , [the most of whom had once haunted [the lands about the Water of [the Wondrous Isles]1-the wondrous isles]7070-the lands about the water of the wondrous isles]7069-the most of whom had once haunted the lands about the water of the wondrous isles , save that [their]7068-this company of friends love never sundered , and that [they]7068-this company of friends lived without shame and died without fear . So here is an end .
